name: Armies of the Coalition: Austria, Prussia and Russia 1808-1815
description:
Second Grand Battles supplement.
You can build Austrian, Prussian and Russian armies between 1808-1815 using Armies of the Coalition Parade Handbook.

In this supplement you will find in-depth divisional organisations for all the Russia, Prussian and Austrian main battle divisions between 1808-1815.
From these lists you can build pretty much any coalition corps that fought between 1808 and 1815.
Although for all other allied divisions such as the German Confederation and Swedes you will need their handbooks as well.

We have also added in our selection of National Heroes into the Headquarters options.Archduke Charles, Blucher, Bagration, Platov and Kutuzov!

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Koenig Krieg: Horses and Musket Edition – Fighting Battles with Model Soldiers, 1660 - 1900
description:
Koenig Krieg Version 4

This new edition allows players to not only re-fight battles during the wars of Frederick the Great, but also the Great Northern War, Napoleonic Wars, American Civil War, War of Triple Alliance, Mexican-American War, Zulu Wars, Crimean, Franco-Prussian and Austro-Prussian wars as well. It has taken a few years now of game testing and organising but we are finally there.

Inside the book:

Clearly presented rules, easy to read with plenty of diagrams and examples.
New and improved sequence of play, with detailed rules for command and control, movement, shooting, close combat, exploitation and morale.
New Brigade Morale Rules.
New Combined Action Rules.
New Reaction Rules.
New Village and Garrision Rules.


And much, much more!

So come on and play Koenig Krieg, its the way Freddy would have played it!

—description from the publisher
categories: Age of Reason, Book, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame

name: General's Compendium: Supplement for Koenig Krieg
description:
Koenig Krieg v4: General's Compendium

Content:

Authors musings and design notes for Koenig Krieg.
In depth explanation of formations.
The Parade Handbooks and how to build an army.
Points based games Victory rules.
12 Battlefield Scenarios and special rules.
Optional rules, like night fighting and wagons.
A sample turn.
Sneak Peak Generic Parade Handbooks for
La Guerre Du Roi 1660-1730
Frederick The Great 1730-1790
Napoleon 1790-1815



Rise of Nations 1830-1902
Sun Never Sets 1830-1902 colonial wars.
Charts for 6mm, 10mm, 15/18mm/20mm and 28mm.

—description from the publisher
categories: Age of Reason, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Legion d'Honneur
description:
Legion d'Honneur

This supplement is designed to spice up Napoleonic games with new and exciting fast play missions, rules for big games, generating narratives for your battles, campaigns and loads more!

All the rules in this supplement are optional and we encourage players to tinker with the rules and create new rules as suits their group.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Kelloggs Album of Australian Games
description:
Kelloggs Album of Australian Games is a promotional mail out set of 4 games published by Kelloggs during the 1940's.

The games are stapled into a booklet style and have pop out playing pieces and dice made of cardboard. Games are about racing, swimming, golf and saving money and all require movement by the roll a dice and the players playing pieces to be first to reach the end of the playing course to win the game.

—user summary
categories: Sports

name: Navy Bobs
description:
Navy Bobs is an Australian wartime game of skill where players use either a wooden cue or a cardboard chute to roll a marble down a playing board which consists of a long channel and warships on either side. The ships have wooden pegs for masts.

If the marble stops opposite a mast on an enemy ship the mast is removed. The winner is the player who removes all the masts from the enemies ships.

—user summary
categories: Nautical, World War II

name: Jump River
description:
Jump River

Summary

Jump River is a game of wits for two players. The goal is to have your fish reach the other river without being captured by the cats! But cats beware, dogs are on the prowl to protect their fishy friends. Move the most fish to the opposite riverbank to win!


of Players


2 Players All Ages
(2-4 players with expansion)

Fish Pieces - These represent your fish and can move in any direction, One space at a time

14 pink 14 Green

Cat Pieces - These represent your cats! Use your cats to target the opposition’s fish.

2 Pink 2 Green

Dog Piece - Each player has a dog piece! The dog can be used to block or attack cats.

1Pink 1 Green

River Race Cards(aka Fish Bowl Cards) - These cards can help you to attack/block an opponent player - among other things!

28 cards

Gameboard

10x10

Set-Up

To begin each player collects 14 Fish pieces, two Cat pieces, and one Dog piece.

Each player should put their 10 Fish in the first-row space closest to their river, and rest their 4 Fishes in the river water by their bank.

Dog in the river water by their bank

Cats in the river water by their bank

Shuffle all the River Race Cards(aka Fish Bowl Cards) and distribute each player 14 cards or equally -

Once both players have placed their fish, pieces the game is ready to begin.

Rules and Gameplay.

Players can move any there fish from the first row to second row then second replace cats first and dogs there wish.

Players take turns moving any of their pieces on the board. Each piece moves differently:

Dogs can move horizontally or vertically in any distance across the board. They can only attack Cats or other Dogs.

Cats can only move diagonally across the board in any distance. They can only attack Fish, not Dogs.

Fish can move one space at a time in any direction only 1 cell at a time.

In addition:

When a Fish is on top of water space, can not attack them for any reason.

When a Cat attacks a Fish, the player draws a River Racecard and face up and plays it when it is required in the game. ( opponent players can plan strategies accordingly)


Players can move any fish Jump into an opponent's river that player can draw a River Racecard and face up and play it when it is required in the game. ( opponent players can plan strategies accordingly)


When a Cat attacks a Fish, it is removed from the game (discarded outside of the board).

When a Dog attacks a Cat, Cat is removed from the game as well.

Based on the rules of play, the game ends when there are no Fish left on the board. The winner is whichever player has moved the most Fish to the opposite river.

River RaceDeck :

River Racecards are obtained when a player moves their fish to an opponent's water space. They may then draw a card and use it immediately. Once a card is used, it must be discarded from play.

Also When a Cat attacks a Fish, the player draws a River Racecard and face up and plays it when it is required in the game. ( opponent players can plan strategies accordingly)

Note: Once a card is used, it must be discarded from play.

● Go fish (2 Cards )-–Return the user to an opponent’s fish from their first row.
● Doggie Treat (2 Cards)-- Your opponent can’t use their Dog for one turn.
● Block Shield (2 Cards)-player can block any attack one turn.
● Bird (2 cards) -Hunt an opponent’s fish from their river and discard it from the game.
● Fish hook 2cards -You can discard opponent 1 fish from the game.
● Catnip 2 cards-Your opponent can’t use their Cat for one turn.
● Fish Flop 2 Cards -Move any one Fish horizontally two spaces.
● Fishbowl Cards(2 cards) - Move the number of Fish shown on the card directly into the other player’s river. There are 2 types of Fishbowl cards:, 0 Fish, 1 Fish.
Angelfish 1 card - reborn dead fish one time from the discarded game.
Swordfish 2 cards - Fish can attack opponent fish one time and discard it from the game.
Fish Flop 2 Cards -Move any one Fish diagonally two spaces.
Fish flop 2 Cards -Move any one Fish (L) Shape 4steps..
Fish flop 2 Cards -jump one time on any opponent 1 piece.
Skip card 2 Cards- players can skip opponent turn-on time.
Queenfish 1 card - Fish can receive Cat or Dog power one time (it's upon players choice).

Rules for 4 players update:1

1. Gameboard
10x10

2. A) It’s like a split between 2 players. So each player can put their fish, cats and dogs only on his/her 5 columns and 2 rows like an original game
https://monosnap.com/file/yuPN3oZoZKcyju6U5goz0RgpzbCU7x however they can reach any column on the other side to make their fish a winner
https://monosnap.com/file/zO7IHZRmegX3T9ob5ZErYguEMuaGM9
B) Each player has 10 fish, 2 cats, and 1 dog.

3. Main rules:
-players play in teams so the winning condition is for the players to bring as much fish as possible together to the other river bank.
-rules for moving for every pawn are the same. So they can move across all the big boards.
-players take turns so If players 12 and 34 are teams then player 1 starts his first move then player 3 takes another move then player 2 and then player 4 etc…
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Children's Game, Dice
mechanics: Move Through Deck, Moving Multiple Units, Roll / Spin and Move, Stat Check Resolution

name: Invazions: Sajou
description:
One more place for the Invazions game.
This place can replace one of the places in the base game, it has a defense of 5 and the following effects:
-Humans : as long as there is a search on the place, your card hand is increased by 1
-Zombies: +1 zombie
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Frontline: Beach Red – Guadalcanal: The US Forces in the Pacific Theatre 1942-1943
description:
These are historical briefings for appropriate company sized battles for any size of tabletop miniatures from 1/100 to 1/72 or 28mm.

You can use it with any WWII tabletop rule system.
In the books and in our apps we included all you need to set up your armies for this specific Pacific theatre.
You can configure your company with a typical HQ, Combat and Weapons Platoons and of course some support units.
You find all this in full overview on the company diagrams, with special rules, point values and more.

Based on historical facts players can refight the famous battle of Guadalcanal 1942 - 1943.

It contains:

7 US lists,
special rules,
a story part about the setting and the historical battle of Guadalcanal in 1942 to 1943 between the US and the Japanese forces.


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Frontline: Great Asia War –  Allied and Japanese Forces in Asia and the Pacific 1941-1945
description:
These are historical briefings for appropriate company sized battles for any size of tabletop miniatures from 1/100 to 1/72 or 28mm.
You can use it with any WWII tabletop rule system. In the books and in our apps we included all you need to set up your armies for this specific Pacific theatre.
You can configure your company with a typical HQ, Combat and Weapons Platoons and of course some support units. You find all this in full overview on the company diagrams, with special rules, point values and more.

Based on historical facts players can refight the famous battle in the Pacific and South East Asia 1941-45. This is a great source for all WWII tabletop gamers.

It contains:

Allied lists and Japanese lists,
special rules for the armies,
a story part about the setting and the historical battles from December 1941 to 1945 between Allied and the Japanese forces.


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Polemos: War of the Spanish Succession – Chosen Men, Well Disposed
description:
Polemos War of Spanish Succession is specifically aimed at enabling the wargamer to fight large scale actions; actual battles, rather than small scale skirmishes. Systems for firing, melee and morale are straightforward and easy to learn, but allow your troops to emulate the tactics used by their historical counterparts. For instance, troops using the platoon firing system have improved close range factors, while others using fire by ranks are allowed to be more aggressive.

Chosen men, well disposed is therefore produced as one of two sets of rules produced to cover the period.
CMWD enables the player to recreate the small to medium sized battles of the War of Spanish Succession, or crucial parts of the major battles. Use CMWD you can, if you wish, replay General Webb’s action at Wynendael or perhaps the attack of the Allied left column on the village of Blenheim.

The aim of the rules is to allow you to fight actions of this size to a finish in three to four hours while retaining the feel of warfare in this period and giving you some tactical control over your troops

The same wargames figures may be used in both sets of rules, as the basing system is universal; only the nominal scale will differ.

Basing and Representation

The basic unit of manoeuvre in Polemos CMWS is the Base - a group of wargames figures mounted permanently on a single base of a given size. The actual position of the figures on the base is not important, nor is it important that the base sizes given below are adhered to. So long as both armies use the same basing system, the rules should not be affected.
A base of infantry in CMWD represents between 300 and 500 men. This generally represents a battalion in most armies of the period. Some armies tended to field larger battalions and these will be represented by two bases.
A base of cavalry represents a regiment or two to three squadrons.
An artillery base represents 2-3 guns.
All distances in Polemos games are expressed in Base Widths (BW) and Base Depths (BD) in order to allow the use of differing base sizes. A BD is half a BW.
This system means that any size can be used for bases, so no rebasing is required so long as both sides are consistent. We believe that a 60mm x 30mm base gives the best results in terms of both practical use and visual impact.


—description from the publisher
categories: Age of Reason, Book, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Cold War³: Ukraine! – Invasion & Civil War 2014 -present -Russian Forces
description:
Ukraine ! Invasion & Civil War 2014 -present -Russian Forces is the first book in the CRISIS UKRAINE trilogy.
This volume covers the Russian Army volunteers* who are currently fighting in Ukraine. This book focuses primarily on the 9th Motor Rifle brigade, 18th Guards Motor Rifle Brigade and the 200th Motor Rifle Brigade as those are volunteer* units that have been positively identified as being on Ukrainian Soil. This book can be used for the Ukrainian Civil War of 2014, the Annexation (Invasion) of Crimea and the continued fighting in the Donbas-Luhansk region(s) of Ukraine.

Included in this volume are comprehensive rules for the modern electronic battlefield, including ground surveillance radars, drone cameras, armed drones, IR smoke, Krasnopol Ammunition, upgraded ATGM’s such as the Akaka and the Shturm as well as trench fighting, and upgraded armour for Russian tanks such as the Shotra/Arena package and Kontakt-5 ERA and composite armours!

This book introduces new Russian equipment such as the 2s19 MSTAS-s self-propelled artillery platform, the 2s7 Psion and the TOS-1 Burantino artillery systems; the (infamous) 9k37 BUK Anti-Aircraft Missile System, the Tunguska Self-Propelled Anti-Aircraft Gun and Missile System; the T-90a, the T-80u, the up-armoured T-72bv and the T-62e tanks as well as the BTR-80, BRM-1k, BMP-3 and the Gaz Tigr Armoured Personnel Carriers. Along with modern anti-tank rounds, artillery rounds (such as Rocket Assisted projectiles) and a new threat for the battlefield: DRONES!

Using this book you can field any modern Russian Army force –not just for the current crisis in Ukraine but for many other what-if scenarios such as World War III, Invasion of Poland and other nightmare scenarios of your devising!

This book is fully compatible with other titles by Dean Wilson and is recommend for the COLD WAR3! Modern Combined Arms Rules System –but is perfectly compatible with Batlefront ™ Team Yankee and Flames of War systems. Ideally suited for 15mm but can use any scale from 6mm to 1:32!!

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: The Royal Thai Army: History, Organisation and Insurrection 2000 to 2014
description:
The Royal Thai Army: History, Organisation and Insurrection 2000 to 2014 covers the area of instability, protests and coup's as well as the ongoing (and continuing) Southern Insurgency (where the RTA and RTP are fighting the Islamic separatists and IS).

This book works for 6mm, 15mm and 20mm (1:72) scales and any combination thereof and is ideally for COLD WAR3! Set of rules but is compatible with any of the popular 15mm tabletop rules such as TY and FoW and any titles produced by Dean Wilson.

This book covers the organisation of the Royal Thai Army, including all of their equipment (from M48a3 tanks through to the modern T80u's from Ukraine), Humvee's and Honda Pick-Up trucks as well as artillery such as the 105mm Field Howitzer, M-109a1 Paladin and the ubiquitous 81mm mortar!

All major Thai units such as the Thahan Phranh (Rangers), the Cavalry and the Armoured units are included as well as weapons from the AK-47 right through to the newly acquired Tavor though the M16 and G3 rifles.

The Royal Thai Police, including the Naresuan-261 (HRT unit), the PARU (SWAT), Border Police and the RTP Special Branch -including their equipment such as UH-1D helicopters, Unimog trucks, pick-up trucks, Tactical vehicles, and all light weapons from the AK through to the M16 and M203 grenade launcher.

The Southern Insurgents are included with their diverse equipment such as 122mm rockets, 120mm mortars, road side bombs, person borne bombs, assault teams and so on. Two 'drug dealing' armies are included, the LAO Drug Barons and the Burmese Drug barons -so you can play interdiction missions along the Thai borders where Border Police, Army rangers and any units in-between interdict and fight it out with heavily armed drug lords and their private militias.

There is also a comprehensive army list for protesting factions (of either the red or yellowshirt variety and any hue in between such as white, lilac, pink or even rainbow coloured!) including taxies, LPG Gas Tankers, protesters, agitators, grenade units, medics, civilians and armed sections.

A comprehensive rules section covers drones, tyre fires, taxies (used to blockade routes) army riot squads and police riot squads, engineers, roadside bombs and all wepaons in-between! A campaign and scenario section is included as well as a detailed look at how to asemble and paint a RTP and RTA force.

A very detailed history section detailing the various protests, the ongoing insurgency in southern Thailand as well as the history and organisation of the Royal Thai Army and Police is also included.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Cold War³!: Canuck! – The 4th Canadian Mechanised Brigade 1968 to 1993
description:
Canuck! The 4th Canadian Mechanised Brigade 1968-1993 covers the Canadian deployment to West Germany in support of NATO between 1968 and the draw down in '93 (after the end of the Cold War).

Suitable for 6mm, 15mm and 20mm (1:72) tabletop wargaming miniatures and ideally for COLD WAR3!
this rulebook supplement is also compatible with other 15mm popular tabletop games such as TY and FoW.

Armed with this book you can field a 4th CMB force for early, middle and late Cold War. It covers all Canadian equipment such as Lynx Recon APC's (baby M113's!), Ferret's (British Armoured Cars), centurion through to Leopard 2a4 Main Battle Tanks, 6 wheeled Cougars, Huskies and Grizlies as well as 8 weeled LAV's and 4x4 VW Iltis and M151 Jeeps.

Air support is also included from the F104 Starfighter, the CF-86 Sabre and the CF-188 Hornet along with all various air launched nasties such as rocket pods, air to air and air to ground missiles, bombs and napalm to seriously ruin any Soviet commanders day.

Rules for Canadian engineering vehicles, Assault-M113's, minefields and entrenchments; battlefield recovery and repair, medic sections and air observers mounted in Kiowa helicopters or Cesna aircraft.

NATO air defences in the form of Chaparal or West German Roland or gepards are included to bolster the 4CMB's AA assets (alongside their own Blowpipe sections of the RCHA).

Princess Patricias Light Infantry, Lord Strathcon's Horse, the Royal Canadian Regiment, Royal Canadian Horse Artillery, Royal Canadian Dragoons and Fort Garries Horse are all included as well as a background and historical section and a comprehensive how to paint your Canuck force! Alongside a list of stockists who supply suitable 15mm Canadian models.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: The Kentucky Sampler: Three Scenarios Based on the Conflict in Eastern Kentucky, January 1862 – for use with Forty Dead Men ACW Rules
description:
The Kentucky Sampler

Three introductory scenario's for Forty Dead Men ACW Rules.

—description from the publisher
categories: American Civil War, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Hex Command: Gunpowder – The Horse and Musket Era with Pike and Shot Addendum
description:
Hex Command Gunpowder are rules for miniature gaming the horse and musket era.
Also includes rules for the Pike and Shotte era.

These rules for miniature war gaming combine board game mechanics with miniatures, where the basic concepts and intent of the rules is to be shared or made common with other rules in the Hex Command System: Ancients, Mechanized and more.
Where possible, as many common concepts and procedures were to be incorporated so that once a particular set was learned, the other rules would find the same intentions.

Hex Command avoids complex issues of movement and measuring due to the use of a hex grid, and infantry regiments do not consist of multiple stands and are not concerned with formations. When a is "Fatigued" it means it has reached the limit of encountering obstacles and efforts such as melee.

To win this game, players must observe the tactical reserve, maneuvering the enemy, and supported combat. Use of Game Cards keep players from being all-knowing and all-seeing above the game table... the fog of war element.

—description from the introduction of the book from the publisher
categories: Age of Reason, Book, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Pike and Shot

name: RECALLATI Compact Edition
description:
RECALLATI™ is the ultimate memory game.
Those who recall triumph, and those who triumph recall

Players take turns to uncover complete RECALLATI card chains. During their turn a player turns over one card at a time, until they have uncovered a complete card chain, taking these cards from the grid, or until they uncover a card that doesn't match the other uncovered cards. Play then passes to the next person.
The WINNER is the player who uncovers the most complete RECALLATI card chains.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Memory, Party Game, Puzzle
mechanics: Memory, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Hex Command: Mechanized – Rules for War Gaming The Mechanized Battlefield
description:
These rules for miniature war gaming combine board game mechanics with miniatures, where the basic concepts and intent of the rules is to be shared or made common with other rules in the Hex Command System: Ancients, Mechanized and more.
Where possible, as many common concepts and procedures were to be incorporated so that once a particular set was learned, the other rules would find the same intentions.

Hex Command avoids complex issues of movement and measuring due to the use of a hex grid.

To win this game, players must observe the tactical reserve, maneuvering the enemy, and supported combat. Use of Game Cards keep players from being all-knowing and all-seeing above the game table... the fog of war element.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Hero High
description:
Congratulations, future Heroes! You have been accepted into Hero High, the most decorated Academy for supernaturally gifted young adults. In Hero High, you will hone your superpowers, complete daring assignments, participate in school events, and discover yourself as you compete to become the most prestigious of Hero High students! Buckle up, because this year is sure to be one for the books!

Hero High takes place over the course of 2 semesters, each 2 rounds long. During each round, players (also referred to as students) will train in feats of heroism, attend extra-curriculars, and complete heroic assignments, which they will use to gain Prestige. Whoever has the most Prestige by the end of the school year wins the game and will place themselves among the most decorated of Hero High alumni!

Hero High has elements of worker placements, set collection, and dice rolling. Players inhabit different facilities at school, growing their distinct superpowers and becoming stronger heroes. Who will become one of Hero High's decorated alumni?

—description from the designers
categories: Dice, Economic, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Stars & Lasers!!: The Pride & The Passion
description:
The Pride & The Passion is a mini campaign for Stars & Lasers, where seven scenario's are linked, starting with a meeting engagement with a twist, in “Diplomatic Incident” and then you get to fight through six more scenarios following the exploits of a proud warrior and his crew.

The scenarios allow you to play the battles of a lone Battlecruiser and its crew as they attempt to bring honour to their people, or you could play from the other side as the people trying to stop them entering your territory.

The scenarios could also be played as single one off games.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: To Arms!: Core Rules for Historical Battles
description:
To Arms! is an easy and fast ruleset for historical games.

This core rulebook focus on the ancient part but the rules can be used for 3000BC~1865AD.

The book is written in simple English.
It's very easy to read and understand.

Diagrams in each key step guide you how to play the game.

The featured Order of Activation makes the game feel like a RTS game. Not I-Go-U-Go, no PIPs. All the troops have chance to move in every turn.

The game length is about 1 Hour. You only need A Tape Measure and Some D6 Dice. Almost no counters or markers are needed. No chart looking, most of the combat is judged by Roll-Off. Figures are individually based and formed in ranks and files. If you want to play with DBx bases, that's also fine. You just need some markers to track the casualty.

Overall, it's a easy and fast ruleset. It's good for beginners. Experienced players can also have funs. To Arms! is not a highly realistic battle simulation but a game of leisure and fun.

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Book, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Depicted
description:
Depicted is a conceptual, abstract boardgame where players match images with attributes to gain territory.

Matching justification can vary by age group and is designed to encourage dialogue and conceptual thinking.

Tiles are flipped to claim spaces by arrow direction.
Players score a point every time they control four contiguous spaces.

The board constantly changes as board spaces are reclaimed with new images, making for a very dynamic game.
The first player to accumulate 20 points wins.

Themes:
* Symbols - uses coloured shapes
* Classic - use generic images
* Nature - Mother Nature
* Muskoka - Ontario Canada cottage country.

Game Components:

The 12x12 inch x 1/4 inch laser-cut wooden game board consists of:
* room for 100 or 121 territorial tile spaces
* four built-in scoring tracks.

The game includes:
* at least 100 two-sided image tiles (depending on theme)
* 20-40+ attribute cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Children's Game, Territory Building

name: The Big Job
description:
I’ve got a new job for you and your crew. There’s this new bank called the Mega Bank. The bank itself consists of 4 giant vaults. There must be millions stored in each. Your job is to find those vaults, stuff as much money down your pockets, and get out before you get busted. The police are stationed all around the bank. So you have to be careful. For the entire year, we can make this bank our primary target. So what do you say, are you in?

Welcome to The Big Job. The card game that tests your luck and greed to become rich. Are you lucky enough to hit the jackpot and avoid detection? Drawing the million dollar card and leaving with what you've got sounds like a lucky way to get rich. Or do you hunger the greed and adrenaline rush of taking hostages and pulling off some big time cash while dodging the police? Clearing out all the vaults and ransoming up a hostage for millions of dollars sounds right up your alley. Just try not to get busted in the process. It's going to cost ya! Grab your crew and lets head out for the big job!

If you're looking for a snatch and grab game to play with family and friends that requires no strategy, just sheer luck and greed, The Big Job is the perfect game for you. The Big Job is very easy to learn and play with others. Setup 4 decks and then just take turns pulling cards. Sounds very simple right? If only pulling money from a deck of cards was real. While the chances of getting caught are slim your greed will be your demise.

As The Big Job may seem like a very simple game with no strategy what so ever, it will keep you immersed with greed and other players’ demises. Trust us the only player that can hurt you is you. So make sure you choose wisely, whether it’s to keep drawing money or to just call it quits.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game
mechanics: Bribery, Kill Steal, Push Your Luck

name: Republican Roman 208~105BC: A To Arms! Supplement
description:
Republican Roman 208~105BC contains a 3 pages PDF of army list and an A4 size file of troop cards!

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Gallic Army 40~105BC: A To Arms! Supplement
description:
Gallic Army 40~105BC contains a 2 pages PDF of army list and an A4 size file of troop cards!

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Petrolissima
description:
Petrolissima shows the path of oil in Switzerland. The players take on the role of entrepreneurs working in the oil industry. Each of them can determine for themselves which areas of business they want to enter. The oil production chain goes from exploration and production of crude oil to the transport from the oil fields to Europe, the raffination in Europe and Switzerland - the processing of crude oil into products such as petrol, diesel or heting oil - and the final distrubution to the end customers.

In the game, all entrepreneurs start with the same capital - a handful of Petros, so to speak. They invest their capital into various business areas and/or trade on the oil markets with the goal of becoming the richests entrepreneur.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Petrolissima zeigt den Weg des Öls in die Schweiz. Die Spielenden schlüpfen in die Rolle von Unternehmern, die in der Ölbranche tätig sind. Es ist jedem einzelnen selbst überlassen, in welche Geschäftsbereiche sie oder er einsteigen will. Die Wertschöpfungskette der Ölbranche reicht dabei von der Exploration und Förderung von Rohöl über den Transport aus den Herkunftsgebieten nach Europa, der Raffination in Europa und der Schweiz – also der Verarbeitung von Rohöl in Handels- bzw. Gebrauchsprodukte wie Benzin, Diesel oder Heizöl – und der abschliessenden Distribution an den Endkunden.

Im Spiel starten alle Unternehmer mit dem gleichen Startkapital – so zu sagen einer Handvoll Petros. Mit dem Ziel, der reichste Unternehmer zu werden, investieren sie ihr Kapital in verschiedene Geschäftsbereiche und/oder betreiben Handel auf den Ölmärkten.

—description from the publisher
categories: Economic, Industry / Manufacturing, Transportation
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Turn Order: Auction

name: Fast Play Naval Rules for the 17th Century Anglo-Dutch Wars
description:
These rules are based on a version of Fast Play Napoleonic Naval Rules that appeared in the first printed edition of the 'Wargames Journal' magazine several years ago.

They have been adapted and amended since then to reflect new interpretations of combat in 'the Age of Sail' and to learn from other rule systems.

These rules do not claim to be an original piece of work but have been created to fine-tune an already workable and enjoyable set of rules to ensure better game flow and address some period-specifc issues not covered in the original set.

T his simple version was amended and developed for a re-creation of the Battle of Sole Bay (1672) using 1:2400 scale ships with each model ship representing 4 actual ships.

The original rules were authored by Neil Fox.

—description from the rules introduction
categories: Book, Miniatures, Nautical, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: Close Fire & European Order: 16th C
description:
Close Fire & European Order are wargames rules originally designed to re-create battles of the early 18th C in Europe with miniature figures.

This version is an adaptation which takes the rules back in time to the XVI Century
categories: Book, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Renaissance, Wargame

name: Ambiguity: A Game of Decent Deductions
description:
In Ambiguity, you try to be first to deduce the secret items (words) of your opponents. Each player secretly picks an item from over 400 items. Clues, in the form of attributes, are revealed and players use them, or lack thereof, to guess who has what item.

The box of lasercut components includes:

450 “items” on 45 cards
105 attributes on 35 cards (describe items)
60 indicator tokens in six colours
3 special revelation cards
12 “Take a Guess” cards
2 gameboards
20 deduction forms (more on our website).


After a brief setup, the game play folllows:

A player pulls an Attribute card and places it into the Attributes grid in an unused slot – one without indicator tokens
Each player whose mystery item matches one of the attributes on the card must place their coloured token on the card without revealing the actual attribute
Players will record any deductions on their forms.


Players can make guesses of other players’ items at any time, although you shouldn’t do so until enough attributes have been exposed – no need to waste your limited “Take a Guess” cards.

Attributes describe item qualities and categories. All items will have at least three attributes. Some items will have ambiguous attributes out of context. For example, CHEDDAR is both a CHEESE and a CITY while MERCURY is a GOD, a LIQUID, a PLANET, ROUND, METALLIC, SILVER-coloured and in the SOLAR SYSTEM.

—description from the publisher
categories: Deduction, Word Game

name: 上海 (Billionaire)
description:
Chinese language Monopoly clone that renames all the spaces and modifies some rules. For example, there are more limits on the number of houses.

Includes cartoon illustrations on the board and replaces the dice with a plastic spinner giving numbers 1-12, thus changing the landing probabilities.

Includes four large, clear plastic pawns, 27 clear plastic houses, 8 clear plastic hotels and two six-sided dice.

—user summary
categories: Economic, Negotiation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Lose a Turn, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Track Movement, Trading
publishers: (Unknown), 亞灣文具股份有限公司 (Yawan Stationery Co., Ltd.)

name: Mit Blut und Eisen: A Set of Wargaming Rules for Large Battles of the Mid 19th Century European and American Wars
description:
Mit Blut und Eisen are rules for European style battles in the period 1840 - 1880.
Battles in the rest of the world can also be fought a long as the forces are similar to those used in Europe at the time. For example the American Civil War.

The focus of the rules is on the Crimean War (1853-56), the Franco-Austrian War of 1859, the American Civil War (1861-1865), the War of 1866 and the Franco-Prussian War of 1870-1871. Details of other conflicts during the period will be available later.

The rules are for large battles of this period.
The players will usually command a Corps or other large part of a full army, if not the whole army.

One base usually represents 600 infantry, 300 cavalry or 12 guns.
A unit is usually 3 to 12 bases and represents a brigade.

—description from the publisher
categories: American Civil War, Book, Miniatures, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Objective Cards WW2: Blue
description:
Objective Cards WW2: Blue

These cards are great for Solo and multi-player wargamers and bring asymmetrical objectives into your games making them more interesting and exciting.

Can be used with any WW2 wargame and any scale!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Final Assault: Top Secret Files – United States-Great Britain: Classified – Late War
description:
This is one of a series of supplements for FINAL ASSAULT

This volume contains full Army Lists for American and British Armies in the Late War period.

Each Army shows the basic units that you can start with, the optional units, the variants and even explains how to split them into Sections.

The points costs will let you play a game that is both balanced and historically accurate. Show your bravery in battle, glory awaits!

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Final Assault: Top Secret Files – Soviet Union-Germany: Classified – Late War
description:
This is one of a series of supplements for FINAL ASSAULT.

This volume contains full Army Lists for German and Soviet Union Armies in the Late War period.

Each Army shows the basic units that you can start with, the optional units, the variants and even explains how to split them into Sections.

The points costs will let you play a game that is both balanced and historically accurate.

Show your bravery in battle, glory awaits!

You will need a copy of FINAL ASSAULT to use these rules.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Final Assault: Top Secret Files – Italy: Classified – Early/ Mid/ Late War
description:
This is one of a series of supplements for FINAL ASSAULT

This volume contains full Army Lists for Italian Armies in Early, Mid and Late War period.

Each Army shows the basic units that you can start with, the optional units, the variants and even explains how to split them into Sections.

The points costs will let you play a game that is both balanced and historically accurate. Show your bravery in battle, glory awaits!

You will need a copy of FINAL ASSAULT to use these rules.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Final Assault: Scenarios for Friendly and Tournament games – Period: Late War
description:
Scenarios for Friendly and Tournament games is an expansion for FINAL ASSAULT.

In this book you’ll find a simple way of creating scenarios that you can use in friendly games as well as some guidelines for Tournaments too.

This book covers five scenarios:

The River, involving the protection of bridges to guarantee supply lines;
The Village, where an enemy force has moved into the area;
Break the Lines, the offensive is coming and you must find a gap in the enemy lines;
Radio Station, you must silence the radio station that is observing for the enemy artillery and
Vanguard, where estimating the size of the enemy force is key to victory.


All of these scenarios are for the Late War period.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Final Assault: Squad Attack Rules Supplement
description:
Final Assault: Squad Attack will let you play games between single squads of infantry with some support sections.
The rules are basically the same as the main game, but in this book you’ll find some specific rules for single-man squads and changes to how you build your force.

The armies, now called Combat Groups, will comprise a single Basic Squad chosen from those in the official Army lists: vehicles and support squads will be chosen and managed with normal rules.

These rules apply to all theatres of war.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Final Assault: Normandy Attack – Classified: Late War
description:
Normandy Attack is a supplement for FINAL ASSAULT

This Scenario Supplement concentrates on the airborne operations undertaken by the allies during Operation Overlord, or the Normandy Landings.

The Supplement contains six historical scenarios that cover some of the attacks that took place during the night of D-Day:

the taking of Puppeville and Neuville,
the attack on the Merville battery,
the battles for Sainte-Mère-Eglise and Carentan.


The Supplement is divided into two parts:

the first contains new rules for night-fighting
while the second contains the scenarios.


All the scenarios in the Supplement are classified Late War.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: 三國演 (Romance of the Three Kingdoms)
description:
Three Kingdoms roll and move game with almost no decisions.

Along the way players collect power points. After every player reaches the end of the course, the one having the most power points wins.

Includes five colored disks with stickers as pawns and 42 cards that come in three types: weapons, power points and destiny. Anachronistically, the power points cards depict pizza, hamburgers, drumsticks, lobster and ham and turkey.
Comes in a plastic box similar to video tape cases. Published in Taiwan, Republic of China.

—user summary
categories: Children's Game, Medieval
publishers: Little Giant Stationery Business Co., Ltd.

name: Commit the Garde!: Leipzig
description:
Leipzig is the ultimate battle of the Napoleonic wars, the "Battle of Nations."

This was the conclusive act of the 1813 Campaign in Prussia. This 4-day battle was the largest ever in Europe before World War I (101 years later!)

This scenario comprises 3 separate battlefields fought simultaneously, or the two main battlefields can be fought as stand-alone scenarios.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Commit the Garde: Rousse
description:
June 22nd, 1811- Rousse, the last battle of the Russo-Turkish War of 1808-1812.

General Kutusov has been sent to Wallacia to conclude the war with Turkey before Napoleon's expected invasion next year.

Scenario for Commit the Garde!
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Imperial Eagle: Wargaming the Age of Napoleon
description:
Very dynamic play with a subtle infinity of tactical variations you can try out.

The basic game lasts between 1 and half to 3 hours or so but you can use larger forces than suggested.

Each Player has a Division of infantry and cavalry plus artillery and Generals for a typical tournament or pick up game using real historical Orders of Battle with the names of the Generals and regiments present.

Use from Old Guard to Landwehr and Militia, all troop types used as historically.

This is the ultimate in Napoleonic Wargaming and it will inspire you whether veteran or newcomer.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Borodino: Wargame Scenarios
description:
Complete orders of battle.

37 scenarios plus variants for over 50 taken from areas of this mighty battle.

Counters and icons used to make it quick and easy to identify troops from the beautiful organigram army lists.

A simple format, short simple texts so easy to understand with the lowest level of English. A visual delight.

64 Full colour pages with historical and terrain maps scaled to a typical wargame table size for each scenario which are graded as Small, medium, large and extra large.

Although we recommend Imperial Eagle rules you can use it with other rule sets.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Imperial Lances: Rules for the Conduct of Napoleonic Warfare in Miniature
description:
Imperial Lances is designed to provide players with a visually stunning battlefield containing masses of troops and for-mations that generate the look and feel of a Napoleonic battle.

Imperial Lances has a distinct “Old School” feel. Imperial Lances is a game that may be played by two or more players.

The game scale is 1:100
categories: Book, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Objective Cards WW2: Original
description:
These cards are great for Solo and multi-player wargamers and bring asymmetrical objectives into your games making them more interesting and exciting.

Can be used with any WW2 wargame and any scale!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Objective Cards WW2: Red
description:
These cards are great for Solo and multi-player wargamers and bring asymmetrical objectives into your games making them more interesting and exciting.

Can be used with any WW2 wargame and any scale!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Aerial Battles: 1939-1945 – Air Wargame Rules for the Second World War
description:
WARGAMES RULES FOR AIR COMBAT IN THE SECOND WORLD WAR


Recommended scales: 1/144 TO 1/300; 1/72 OR 1/600 possible
Complexity: 4/10


A SET OF QUICK REFERENCE SHEETS IS AVAILABLE THROUGH THE PUBLISHER'S WEBSITE

These rules are intended to allow two or more Players to have a fast and simple game representing tactical air combat during the Second World War. Model aircraft of any scale from 1/600th to 1/72nd, can be used. If necessary you could also use card counters. Minimal bookkeeping is required because Markers or Tokens are used to indicate the status of aircraft during the game. Furthermore you do not need to use a hex mat.

The capabilities of aircraft within the game have been calculated, taking a common aircraft type of average performance as the base line, in this case the Hawker Hurricane. All other aircraft capabilities relate to how they compare with this aircraft. It is possible that the performance of this or that aircraft might not match your expectations based on anecdotal evidence. We make no apology for this as we are not trying to create a simulation. The resulting data has been kept to a simple format, which enables a Player to control several aircraft during a game, and the overall gaming experience will be improved if multiple Players attempt to “co-operate” on each side.

The abilities of pilots and crew are represented by having Skill Factors. These determine how well they fly their aircraft, their chances of hitting the target when shooting, and avoiding serious damage if their own aircraft is hit. Pilot skill is vitally important in air combat, and Players will need to learn where to position their best pilots, as well as to protect their novice aviators . In the case of aircraft with several crew members, Skill is determined for the crew as a whole. You do not need to keep track of individual crew.

To carry out any action other than level flight requires the expenditure of one or more Orders, which may also require a successful Skill Test. Orders are generated each turn and better leaders generally mean more Orders. Scenario rules are provided covering simple dogfights during an Encounter, for attacking surface targets, and to represent missions where the aim is to get a force of bombers across the table.

Altitude represented during the game assumes that the main combat is taking place in roughly the same area of the sky, and it is possible to climb or dive to gain an advantage, or try to escape.

Players alternate the activation of their aircraft. Optional Tactical Cards can be used during the game to provide additional detail.

Game Data is provided for most aircraft that saw action during the Second World War. We have not included experimental aircraft or those produced in small numbers.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Ral Partha's Chaos Wars: Classic Rules – Book Three: The Ancient Rivalry Campaign
description:
Elf Alliance vs. Orcs & Goblins

Chronicles of Romanni the Wanderer - It began innocently, quietly, and as a result of the diligence of a well-intentioned priest. Brother Thaddeus unriddled the hiding place of the long-lost Chalice of Lentagern from certain obscure passages in Zentarch’s Great Book of Thaumaturgy. Desirous of gaining the beneficial powers of the artifact, Thaddeus urged his master, the powerful border princeling High Lord Roderick, to mount an expedition to recover it. That lord, seeing only good to come of it, agreed.

—description from the introduction

This expansion campaign presents various scenarios in the "ancient rivalry" between elves and goblins (includes expansion armies, 14 scenarios, and various "personalities" of the Chaos Wars).

Note that the core game books 1 & 2 are required to use this expansion.

–user summary
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Ral Partha's Chaos Wars: Classic Rules – Book Five: Personalities & Additional Material
description:
If both players agree, each may field up to three of these unique Personalities in their Army Roster.
—description from the introduction

This expansion presents "personalities" for use with the base game - these are essentially unique, named miniature figures. Each personality belongs to one of five groups. The supplement also presents gateway gems, expanding magic, and brief comments on roleplaying.

Note that the core game books 1 & 2 are required to use this expansion.

–user summary
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Ral Partha's Chaos Wars: Classic Rules – Book Six: Armies of the Chaos Wars
description:
These 26 Army Rosters are intended to give you some examples of the types of armies that can be built for playing games with CHAOS WARS: CLASSIC RULES. While these do give some insight into the possibilities, the different options you have when building your Army Roster are near-limitless.

—description from the introduction

This expansion presents twenty-six sample army rosters for use with the base game.

Note that the core game books 1 & 2 are required to use this expansion.

–user summary
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Ral Partha's Chaos Wars: Classic Rules – Book Seven: Army Building Tools
description:
This expansion presents worksheets/forms, charts, and troop lists for use with the base game, including infantry and cavalry costs for each unit and each unit modification.

Note that the core game books 1 & 2 are required to use this expansion.

–user summary
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Ral Partha's Chaos Wars: Classic Rules – Book Eight: Clash of Runes & Bone Campaign – Dwarves vs. The Undead
description:
Welcome to the 8th book in the series of Ral Partha’s Chaos Wars Classic Rules. This is the first book released after the initial seven. This is the first opportunity to clarify some rules, and add some minor new rules to expand on the variety of options available to you when building your Army Roster.

—description from the introduction

This expansion campaign presents the "Clash of Runes & Bone" for use with the base game. Note that numerous figures used in this campaign have additional skills, attributes, and rules - which also are presented.

Note that the core game books 1 & 2 are required to use this expansion.

–user summary
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Ral Partha's: Chaos Wars – Classic Rules Book Four: Legendary Scenarios
description:
Chronicles of Romanni the Wanderer - It began innocently, quietly, and as a result of the diligence of a well-intentioned priest. Brother Thaddeus unriddled the hiding place of the long-lost Chalice of Lentagern from certain obscure passages in Zentarch’s Great Book of Thaumaturgy. Desirous of gaining the beneficial powers of the artifact, Thaddeus urged his master, the powerful border princeling High Lord Roderick, to mount an expedition to recover it. That lord, seeing only good to come of it, agreed.

—description from the introduction

This expansion campaign presents ten additional "legendary scenarios" for use with the base game.

Note that the core game books 1 & 2 are required to use this expansion.

–user summary
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Ral Partha's Chaos Wars: Classic Rules – Book Ten: Nature's Wrath Campaign – Chaos Warriors vs. Dryads and Fae
description:
Welcome to book #10 in the series of Ral Partha’s Chaos Wars Classic Rules.

This book contains the campaign rules, scenarios, and Special Characters for playing the ‘Nature’s Wrath’ Campaign. Please consider the rules within this document to be canon for all Chaos Wars games that you play.

—description from the introduction

This expansion campaign presents the "Nature's Wrath" campaign and associated figures for use with the base game. Note that numerous special cases, upgrades, and additional component rules are also included in this supplement.

Note that the core game books 1 & 2 are required to use this expansion.

–user summary
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Get Some!: Fantasy Warfare – War of the Dead: Act 1 – The Gathering Storm
description:
Refugees flee across the land. Tales of woe and death follow. The residents of horseshoe valley fled for their lives in the middle of the night while being chased by the dead. Yes, the dead have come to life and they walk the land. The fleeing residents are exhausted from running for their lives day and night with very littel rest. Some sought sanctuary with the wild elves of the forests and were shot down with whistling arrows from unseen archers for their troubles.

The Elves have so far maintained a vigilant watch and slaughter any undead that enter their forests from lofty vantage points high in the tree-top canopy. Some refugees fled down the river in boats, rafts and some just floated along on doors, luggage, dead animals anything that floated. The once flourishing human town of Riverhead has become a harbor of corpses and all who fled there were consumed by the dead.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Get Some!: Fantasy Warfare – War of the Dead: Act 2 – Storm Surge
description:
The Dead stalk across the land and the living flee from thier deadly embarce. The Free Cities have mustered thier militia and taken the war to the dead. The Blankenship Militia under general Wheeler fought a hard, running battle with the undead hordes that ended with them putting Ash Town to the torch and burning the entire rotten city to the ground. General Wheeler who is in charge of the Blankenship Militia expeditionary force and the victor at Ash Town has decided to make for Rotten Crossing and assault the city. General Wheeler reports flames have been seen in the forests to the south and suspects the Wild Elves are fighting a guerilla war from the trees against the undead. How they fare is unknown as the Elves tend to shoot first and ask questions later when strangers appear in their forest home.

12 New Scenarios play out the drama of the War of the Dead as the battle continues and cities fall.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Get Some!: Fantasy Warfare – War of the Dead: Act 3 – The Deluge
description:
The Deluge of Rot...

The Dead flood through the mountains after defeating the valiant dwarves who gave their lives to try and stop the flood. Alas, the Sky Pass has fallen and the dead march towards Shipton, a port city on the banks of the Bay of Despair. The people of Shipton have been digging a huge fortified entrenchment for the last month in the hopes of sparing the town. How effective this defensive ditch will work against the undead none can say. The Dwarves meanwhile rush forces to attempt to close the pass once again.

12 New Scenarios play out the drama of the War of the Dead as the battle continues and cities fall.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Get Some!: Fantasy Warfare – War of the Lions: Act 1 – Gravest of Insults
description:
The Leonids have been expanding around the peninsula in the last few decades and have established fortifications along trade routes and near protected harbors. Warprides have been harrassing caravans between the Dwarven Holds in the Rock Serpent Mountains and some of the free cities like New Wayland and Tiresia. Without the supplies earned in trade from these free ports the Dwarven Holds would lose an important source of food and lumber.

Emissaries have been sent by King Thargold Hardgrin of StoneGate to the commander of forces within Bloodsea Castle to begin talks to correct the harrassing of dwarven trade delegations on a free road to Market Point. He received his emissaries' heads in a large basket a few weeks later. This greivous affront is obviously meant to enrage and goad the stubborn and honor-bound dwarves into a fight.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Get Some!: Fantasy Warfare – War of the Lions: Act 2 – The Wrath of Dwarves
description:
The Leonids have failed in their siege of KinGrave Hold thanks to the harrowing forced march of Thane Beldin Graybeard and his five hundred dwarven warriors. Once Lord Goldenmane, of the Dawning Sun warpride, was informed of a large dwarven force marching upon his vulnerable rear he ordered a general withdrawl from KinGrave Hold, vowing to return and finish what he started. During the height of the Battle for KinGrave Hold, King Snori Halfhelm sent his fastest messengers to the other dwarven holds to warn them of an impending attack and to send reinforcements if they could spare any. King Thargold Hardgrin, of StoneGate Hold, sent a hundred of his best warriors via the Underway that runs between mountains.

King Thargold would not be sitting out the battles with the treacherous Leonids. One of the emissaries that the commander of Bloodsea Castle had executed had been a distant relation to the King and a dwarf would see blood spilled as payment for such an affront to his families honor. King Thargold immediately ordered that the clans assemble on the field of war outside the massive stone gate of the hold. Five thousand warriors answered his call to war and the dwarves marched upon Bloodsea Castle.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Get Some!: Fantasy Warfare – An Army of Heroes: Classical Greek Warfare
description:
When the Greeks mercenaries set sail for Ionia they had no idea a storm of magnificent proportions would sweep their ships through space and time and deposit them on strange shores in a foreign land. They manage to make landfall on a strange island and immediately came into conflict with strange monsters who inhabited the forests of the island chain. The small green creatures were vicious and cruel but could not stand up to the hedgehog of spears presented by the Greek phalanx. Eventually the Greeks dug out a fort and raided nearby islands and the mainland for women and provisions. They have not only survived but thrived in this strange land.

A Greek army is centered around the heavily armored hoplite and supported by archers, slingers, javelin wielding peltasts and cavalry. They also bring with them priests of the Olympian Gods who have found that they can wield divine powers in the cause of their gods. The Greek army is slow and dependent on the phalanx to hold formation long enough to drive the foe from the field so the cavalry and skirmishers can run them down and slaughter them.

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Get Some!: Fantasy Warfare – The Dwarves
description:
This force represents the typical force found among the Dwarven Holds of the Stone Serpent Mountains. This particular army comes from the ancient and proud Hold of Iron Root. They are led by King Torgul Pigiron and have been for over two centuries. Recent clashes with Felinid war parties have King Torgul angry and is seriosly considering launching a strike across the foothills and take Bloodsea Castle to secure dwarven trade with his allies in Market Point. In the meantime he has ordered his Thanes to ready their Dwarves for action, just in case.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Get Some!: Fantasy Warfare – The Leonids
description:
The Leonids are an agressive, expansionistic and brutal people. They rule Empire that spans the known world. They are not evil, just power hungry. They cannot abide the thought of another race ruling over them and whenever confronted with a people that could someday pose a threat to their Empire they attack it and seek to subjagate and enslave its people.

Get Some! Fantasy Warfare is about getting your models out and playing an enjoyable wargame for a couple of hours with your buddies. It is NOT about WAAC (Winning at all Costs) but about designing an army that fits your collection and play style as well as the background for the Universe you are playing in. Tactics and Command should play the pivotal roles in the battel as well as a little bit of Luck and NOT pimped out units. Armies should be a mix of Melee, Ranged and Magical/Monsterous units. Each should check some of the power of the others in the rock, paper, scissors kind of way, which is similar to actual warfare.Above all remember the

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Get Some!: Fantasy Warfare – Monsters and Mercenaries
description:
Mercenary armies are often cobbled together by experienced and money savvy soldiers who have a lot of friends in seedy places. These mercenary captains will recruit a dour and taciturn fellow soldier who can be trusted around gold and jewels. Together the Captain and Paymaaster will begin frequenting the brothels, taverns and dives recruiting sellswords, cutthroats, second story men, former soldiers and other violent riff raff. They will then hire out their services to a city state or mercantile concern to guard property of take it from someone else. Occasionally a mercenary captain will have the opportunity to team up with a wizard who can vastly increase a mercenary armies' desirability to an employer. These wizards can heal the wounded, raise morale or make large fiery explosions happen to the enemy ranks or keep such things from happenin to friendly troops. Beast masters are hired usually alon with whatever beastie the master has been training. Beastmasters will often ride monsters into battle or serve as a liason with a monsterous infantry unit like trolls and ogres, if they survive the negotiation phase.

Get Some! Fantasy Warfare is about getting your models out and playing an enjoyable wargame for a couple of hours with your buddies. It is NOT about WAAC (Winning at all Costs) but about designing an army that fits your collection and play style as well as the background for the Universe you are playing in. Tactics and Command should play the pivotal roles in the battel as well as a little bit of Luck and NOT pimped out units. Armies should be a mix of Melee, Ranged and Magical/Monsterous units. Each should check some of the power of the others in the rock, paper, scissors kind of way, which is similar to actual warfare.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Get Some!: Fantasy Warfare –  Ratlings
description:
A ratling army is an undisciplined horde. They swarm across the battlefield pushing slaves and house rats in front in order to soak up enemy missile fire. They use large units of lightly armed skirmishers to outflank the enemy and attack from an unexpected direction. They use strange weapons and magic fueled warmachines that can cause panic in the enemy ranks. Ratling priests use strange ancient magics to blast enemy formations and reinforce faltering ratling morale.

A ratling army uses a ton of basic troops supported by ratling guns, ratling snipers and lightning cannons in order to hold the enemies attention. While the enemy tries to thin the ratling hordes and deal with their magical warmachines and firearms, a horde of giant rats and rat swarms speed across the battlefield to attack vulnerable troops or distract enemy cavalry. All the while wererat assassins and sewer scouts move into a position behind the enemy and attack from an unexpected direction. Once the enemy is surrounded it cannot escape and is swarmed under by a horde of furry bodies.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Get Some!: Fantasy Warfare – Satyrs: Marauders of the Forest
description:
Satyrs are a flexible and mobile force and wander the forests ambushing caravans, traders and travellers. They are in a near constant state of war with the Wild Elves. They inhabit most of forests of the Known World and are a constant threat to trade and isolated villages.

Satyrs use deception and speed to out manuver their enemies and can strike from an enemies flanks or rear while it is engaged with Minotaurs and other foul creatures from the front. Chariots then strike the unprotected warmachines and wizards in the rear before running down any enemy unit that flees the field. Satyr armies use this speed and mobility combined with terror causing units to break units from multiple directions. They are particularly effective against heavily armored opponents which are slow and vulnerable to the huge weapons carried by their monsterous allies.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Get Some!: Fantasy Warfare – Skirmish Rules
description:
The Skirmish Rules use the Get Some! system to play out small unit actions in your fantasy games. The rules have been tweaked to better simulate small actions between warbands. This is a good way to try out an army or the basic rules for Get Some! without buying or using tons of models. Less than ten models to a side usually and games can be pretty fast (around 30 to 45 minutes) it is great for a lunch time league and these rules will be used extensively in the upcoming fantasy campaigns using the Get Some! system.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Get Some!: Fantasy Warfare – Blankeship Fusiliers
description:
Fusilier Regiments are built around a strong corps of massed musket fire. Each Company fires and fights as a solid cohesive body. They are drilled to fire by ranks in order to keep up a withering hail of gunfire into an advancing enemy or as a solid mass to break up an enemy charge.

They are a lightly armoured army and rely on their ranged attacks to pin down the enemy and wittle down their numbers before recieving the charge with a hedge of bayonets or counter-attacking a wavering foe. They bring heavy firepower to the table as well as a diverse range of cavalry and some light melee troops but may suffer when presses by large or terrifying monsters and monsterous infantry. The BattleMage and WarMage help mitigate some of their weaknesses but can be overwhelmed by a numerically superior force able to accept casualties or posessing weaker but more numerous mages of their own.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Fantasy, Miniatures, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Get Some!: Fantasy Warfare – The Celestial Host
description:
Armies of angels and mortals march across the lands of man and the rest of the known world to bring the light of Law and Order to the darkest and coldest areas. Bloody conflict lay it this armies wake. There is no reasoning with an angel who's orders come directly from their gods. Those who attempt to resist are deemed blashphemers and heretics an entire cities have been leveled and burned in order to remove evil and entropy from the face of the known world. The sight of winged beings bearing swords and huge bows flying towards a city is enough to cause rioting in the streets and mass panic as the population tries to escape the coming slaughter and subjugation.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Get Some!: Fantasy Warfare – The Celtic Tribes
description:
When the Celts where transported to the Known World they quickly adapted and thrived int he deep forests and plains. They are a hardy and industrious folk. Oddly enought hey found themselves cloe to thier ancient enemies the Romans though the two cultures have found a way to work together there are occasional flare-ups of animosity.

A Celtic Warband favors fast moving bands of warriors and cavalry supported by chariots and druids. They can make chainmail and the wealthy nobles and more adept swordsmen use it regularly. Celts are a an undisciplined lot and will try to make a name for himslef in battle which is counter to small unit tactics where each man works together.

name: Get Some!: Fantasy Warfare – Crusaders of Outre Mare
description:
The Crusaders initially invaded Outre Mare in order to cleanse the countryside of foul monsters that had overrun the area and killed the local villagers in droves. Some nobles within the Confederate Kingdoms answered the call by the Church of the Old One to rid the land of these monsters. They formed into crusading bands which eventually conglomerated into small fiefdoms once the area had been cleansed of the foul beasts that had inhabited it.

The Crusaders nobles prefer to fight from horseback clad in heavy armor and use sword and lance. They are supported by blocks of heavily armored men at arms wielding spear and tower shields. Archers armed with various bow and crossbows provided ranged fire support for the knights and Men at Arms. Peasant levies and mounted Hobilars are also not uncommon. The crusaders rely on the venerable catapult and trebuchet for their heavy support in a siege. The Crusaders are also joined by priests of the Old One who provide spiritual guidance and support.

name: Get Some!: Fantasy Warfare – The Dunelords
description:
On the edge of the Leonid Empire, btween the Sand Kings and open savannah, lies the realm of the Dunelords. They are close cousins of the more civilized Leonid clans but prefer the open sky to cramped urban living. They do not build machines of steam and magic and instead work together with many natural species to form a more harmonious existance. They are a nomadic people by nature and do not dwell in one place very long. Instead they chose to follow the herds in their timeless wanderings from watering hole to grassland and back. While the Dunlords are not very cosmopolitan they are not stupid and instead of machines they rely on the large and sometimes vicious beasts that roam the trackless wastes and tall grass of the plains. The Dunelords and their Beast Lords have a natural affinity for animals and the large hunting cats in particular.

The Dunelords often go their own way even if they are nominally auxiliaries to the Imperial purple. They guard the western approaches to the Empire and fight a near constant battle with the undead Sand Kings of Necrokahara. The Dunelords are constantly fighting among themselves as well as external enemies even though they have no imperial ambitions or delusions of conquest. They are a fractitious, stubborn and warlike people. They are also loyal, honorable and courageous to the core.

name: Get Some!: Fantasy Warfare – Empire of the Sun
description:
The Empire of the Sun controls a large island chain far to the east, across the raging sea. They are led by an Emperor who the common folk believe is descended from a divine ancestory. The Emperor is reclusive and mysterious and most of the country is ruled by a warrior aristocracy called the Samurai, or those who serve.
The senior and most powerful samurai in the Emperor's service is his personal warlord called the Shogun. The Shogun does not lead troops in the field but coordinates strategy, administration and logistics among the Daimyo or clan lords. These Daimyo take to the field of battle under the auspices of the Shogun and Emperor. They field their own personal retinues of samurai and ashigaru warriors and lead them into battle. For larger battles many Daimyo will come together and elect a temporary warlord to lead them in battle for that day though this rarely happens.
The Empire has sent trade ships across the Raging Sea and made contact with the Leonid Empire and Sea Elves and does a brisk trade with these nations exchanging rare spices for tin and iron to make steel. The Trade expeditions have also discovered the Land of the Dead and have reported this to the Emperor.
The Emperor now believes that the entire continent to be tainted with the touch of ncromancy and decay. He has sent a large invasion fleet to cleanse the lands and extend his domain into this new world.

name: Get Some!: Fantasy Warfare – The Forces of Carthage
description:
Carthage was founded by nobles from the Phoenician city of Tyre and from Cyprus. From the start it was a complete and independent city on a spot with favorable access to important resources such as clay and sea salt. Carthage in North Africa then became the cradle and center of the Punic state which spread across the Mediterranean. Carthage's military traditions showed its Phoenician roots and reflected native Libyan and Greek influences.
It has traditionally been argued that Carthage was a peaceful city of merchants or a brutal colonial power and both theories were rather dependent upon modern perceptions. Almost all approaches towards Carthage have in common the fact that they do not look at Carthaginian policy-making as such, but rather its structure in a fundamental contrast to that of Rome. However, the polis Carthage was over the course of several centuries the dominant power in the Western Mediterranean and could establish its authority over large territories which were also deeply influenced by the Punic culture.
Ancient authors tend to stress the reliance of Carthage on foreign mercenaries. However, the term 'mercenary' is misleading when applied to the African and Spanish recruits, i.e. from areas controlled by Carthage. They were comparable to Roman Auxilia though Carthage did also employ mercenaries in the true sense as well. These units were mostly deployed in the expeditionary armies overseas, while in Africa Punic militias formed the backbone of the troops. Units were generally segregated by ethnicity which was also a criterion for the respective specialisation.

name: Get Some!: Fantasy Warfare – The Free Cities
description:
The Free Cities are usually ports and run by an oligarchy of wealthy merchants. As such most of their forces are mercenaries with a few specialist units native to that city. They tend to rely on formations of pikemen, crossbowmen and various light and heavy cavalry units. They use few warmachines and rarely take them on campaign. Thier mercenary forces tend to wear lighter armor, make extensive use of shields and invariably have low morale but strong leadership. Wanering Wizards often hire out their services to reputable mercenary captains in order to further their arcane studies.

name: Get Some!: Fantasy Warfare  – The Gunpowder Kingdoms
description:
The Gunpowder Kingdoms rely on the use of firearms and cannon mostly to defend their territories. Since the discovery of gunpowder they have abandoned the use of the heaviest armor but they still use a steel breastplate, open helmet and greaves. They use formations of Pikemen supported by llightly armored Gunners and heavy cannon. They still use fast cavalry for scouting and a few small formations of heavier cavalry but these are becoming more rare. Becasue of their devout religious beliefs they abandoned magic long ago and occasionally conduct witchhunts for magic users of any sort.

name: Get Some!: Fantasy Warfare – The Infernal Legions
description:
The Demon Queen sits upon her Throne of Bones and sends for legions of devils and deluded men to sow strife and violence in the world of ordinary men. She is an ancient creature born at the dawn of creation and constantly at war with the forces of Law and Order.
The Abyss lives outside but alongside the world of mortals and occasionally passageways between the two worlds open up. When this happens the forces of the Abyss pour forth and rush across the land slaughtering all who oppose them. Infernal Legions overthrow kingdoms and place Pit Lords upon the thrones of Men, Elves, and Dwarves.
It is said that in the end times near the Coming of the Apocalypse the forces of the Abyss will ravage the land and wage a thousand year war against the Celestial Host and their mortal allies.
