Draw these cards into your hand and use them to take food from the buffet, matching at least one card with the food's suit and totaling its point value. You may, instead, steal food from the top of an opponent's plate, but it costs 2x.

Watch out for veggies that show up on the buffet because the appetite deck doesn't contain veggie cards. Someone will have to take on for the team and spend a turn to remove it.

Stack the food you take onto your character card's plate. This character card shows any bonuses you may have. Be wary of others snatching food right off your plate. You can safely store food at your table, but that just gives your opponent more time alone at that sweet, sweet buffet.

Each piece of food has an effect that can shift the tide of the game, and so does each slot on the buffet line, so no matter if you're scrounging for scraps there is still a chance to win!

A Turn

During your turn, you may either spend Appetite Cards to get food from the buffet or bring your plate to the table so that it can no longer be stolen from your plate.

What's in the Box

Buffet Table

The buffet is made up of four cards or “tables” on which to stack the food. Each of these cards reveals a bonus when all the food is removed.

Food Deck

Up to four different food cards are face-up on the buffet table that all players will vie for. These foods show a number and food suit. Foods also have bonuses that can sway the game.

Appetite Deck

This deck of 52 poker cards contains four suits (the four food groups: meats, carbs, desserts, and lard), and each group is numbered from 1-13.
Character Plates
These are larger cards that show one of the playable characters and their bonuses.

Winning

Keep playing until you have ravaged the buffet, and there is no food left! Count up the total points to see who is the most gluttonous.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Humor, Math, Number

name: Cosplay Quest
description:
You have invaded the convention hall in search of some great relic; but its pieces have been scattered throughout the event. Will you be the first to find the parts needed to claim the prize?

How to Play

Players build teams, either solo or collectively, of searchers, scouts, and fighters. Searchers investigate areas, the time it takes is based on that character's skills and the size and use of the room. Once found, your scouts run the relic piece back to base. But watch out for your opponent's fighters as they want to get it back.

The convention hall uses a modular system so you may decide on the size of the game. A more enormous building has more rooms, events, and hidden pieces, and will provide longer playing time. Costumes, food, boosts, and more come from cards that are found or purchased. Use dice for combat and searching revelations.

When entering an area, flip the tile to show its layout. Is it filled with several vendor booths or one room dedicated to a celebrity speaker? Is it themed for anime or sci-fi? This all matters because you can dress your team members to get the help of the other con-goers in the room, and you definitely don't want to get caught wearing your StarFeet uniform in the Anime room.

Time and Turns

The game progresses using a virtual time system based on 5-minute increments and passing half-hours. Players take their characters through a half-hour at a time, completing as much as they can during their turn. Events may change from hour to hour, so teams need to be sure they are paying attention to the show schedule. A quick-moving scout may get from one corner of the conference to the opposite side in 15 minutes, or 3 turns, while a fighter wearing a giant robot armor suit may take an hour or 12 turns. Once in an area with a potential object, searchers use their observation skills to look for them. Someone more observant will use fewer turns to search the area. Two searchers on a team will do it faster, and an enemy in the room can distract the searcher.

Classes

Searchers find items based on a combination of factors: their statistics, environmental factors from the area card, time elapsed, and dice. Be sure to read the room because if your cosplay matches your environment, the others in the room will help your search, whereas you in a pirate outfit will surely be harassed by a room full of furries.

Scouts are used to transfer information, outfits, and relic pieces quickly. If a room changes from one theme to another during an investigation, a scout may need to purchase and run a new costume over. Once a relic piece is found, you may want to use your scout to get it back to your base as fast as possible.

Fighters are the brawn that are used to steal a relic piece from scouts or to help escort a weak scout back to base. They can also interrupt a searcher or keep an enemy from entering a room being examined.

How to Win

The winning team will have gathered all the relic pieces in their base before the event ends.
categories: Adventure, Deduction, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Humor, Medieval, Puzzle, Science Fiction, Spies/Secret Agents, Zombies
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Events, Hand Management, Hidden Movement, Modular Board, Movement Template, Race, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Tiger: Wargames Rules for World War II
description:
Rules for 1/300th scale Battalion level games.

It focuses on the problem of command and control for forces in close combat.

The rules use an "Activation" test for each company-sized unit in an army.
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Lists for Tiger
description: Army lists for Tiger Wargames rules for World War II
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Miniature Wargames du temps de Napoleon
description:
Detailed rules for a Napoleonic land and sea wargame.

Covering all aspects necessary to play a detailed Napoleonic wargame on the tabletop.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Dinosaur Whisperers
description:
You are part of an expedition that has discovered an island where dinosaurs still roam. Your goal is to safely herd some specimens to your ships, and then set sail to show the world these amazing creatures.

As you explore this unknown land, new options will become available to you as you assign your assistants to perform various tasks. You must be cautious as there are many predators in this place, including the T-Rex. However, if you take too long, your dinosaurs can starve, escape, or even turn on their captors.

In Dinosaur Whisperers, you work cooperatively with other players or you can play solo. Your objectives are two-fold: first you must explore the land to find some dinosaur specimens, then you must safely guide them back to your ships before you are overcome by the dangers of the island.

The game starts with several hex tiles that make up the main play area. Players collaboratively place their workers on the available spaces to perform those actions, such as explore, move, feed dinosaurs, etc. As you explore, new tiles are drawn from the deck to expand the map; each tile provides new worker actions, events, and items to help you on your expedition. Many of the tiles also increase the likelihood that the dreaded T-Rex will appear and hunt you down.

—description from the publisher
categories: Exploration
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: The Worlde of Terror Incognito: Issue One 'Wendigo'
description:
A simple set of skirmish rules for beginners or for experienced gamers who prefer a light set of rules.

The Worlde of Terror Incognito is a blend of historical settings inhabited by creatures from popular mythology and horror. The rules have been left open ended in regards to scale to allow them to be used for any of the most common miniature scales.
Each WoTI update will feature the continuing adventures of Captain Jacobs and his 'Redcoats'. The story starts with Chapter one 'Wendigo'. A Wendigo in WoTI is a man who has sold his soul over to a powerful cannibalistic demon, inspired from modern Native American lore. See what happens when Capt. Jacobs and his men encounter the unfortunate Sergeant Wilkes in the wilds then have a chance to recreate the battle with some scenarios at the end of the chapter!

—description from the designer
categories: Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Rock-Paper-Scissors

name: A Clash of Sabers!
description:
10 ACW regimental scenarios from all theatres of the war.

These are mainly small actions which contain some cavalry or are all cavalry to give you a chance to get those horsesoldiers out of the box.

To be used with Regimental level ACW ruleset

—description from the publisher
categories: American Civil War, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Seapower III
description:
Advanced Rules Covering Target Size Factor, Movement of Ships, Environmental Factors, Projectile Penetration, Torpedoes, Ship Control/Battle Damage, Radar Fire Control, Sea Coast Fortifications, Aircraft Operations, Land Air Base Rules, Hit & Damage Computations, Aircraft vs Aircraft & Air Combat Maneuver, Aircraft Engagement Table & Use of Combat Rating Ration, Charts.

The Most Widely Used Rules For Wargaming with Naval Miniatures in the World
categories: Expansion for Base-game, World War I, World War II

name: 4 Bananas
description:
Three bananas are just as many as three crocodiles; and the number 3!

Match the symbols and numbers in this domino game, where you will also meet Star cards, Stop cards and the coveted Sigma cards!

First player to lay out all their cards wins...

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Educational

name: Electoral!
description:
If you have ever wondered if a quite short Hispanic Jewish man could beat an Asian Mormon billionaire with an embarrassing tattoo in a presidential election, then this is the game for you!

In Electoral! you must harness the political effects of your candidate’s randomly juxtaposed gender, race and religion to win a successful, 2-term presidency. Make good choices to build up support among relevant political and regional factions, accomplish your hidden agenda and manage your karma while being assailed by your opponent’s strategy and the indifference of the political factions that, well, don’t like your “type”.

Electoral! is a good-natured and smart political parody that is equally perfect for boozy Election Night watch parties or random Thursday game night.

—description from the designer
categories: Party Game, Political
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Shufflepuck Cafe
description:
Shufflepuck Cafe is a reflex game for gamers inspired by Air hockey games and the video game of the 90s: Shufflepuck Cafe.

With the help of "Shuffle" or "Puck" cards, players take turns controlling their pushers or the disc, validating the effects by tapping activation cards. Players score points each time the disc passes through the opposing side without being stopped by the pusher. The first player to score 3 VP wins the game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Simulation

name: Race to 10
description:
Play, have fun and help Sigma the monkey draw hidden numbers, add or subtract them to your previous number tokens and get the numbers to reach the sum of ten!

—description from the publisher
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Math

name: The Worlde of Terror Incognito: Open Playtest Ruleset – French Indian War: The Seven Years War in North America 1754-1763
description:
Basic Revised rules for Terror Incognito.

Also included are the playtest rules for making characters from the French Indian War.
categories: American Indian Wars, Fantasy, Horror, Wargame, Zombies
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Rock-Paper-Scissors

name: World War Commander: Core Rule Set for 1/72  and 1/56 scales
description:
A turn-based real-time strategy game based on the WW2 European Theater using scale miniatures on 4” inch square scale maps.

Included is a complete rule set for armies of the German and American Army’s and how to conduct battle engagements.

—description from the designer
categories: Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Mathopia
description:
Mathopia is a game for two or more players

Each player is dealt 7 answer cards which they need to match to question cards as they are turned face up
The question card has three questions on each card and the answer cards each have three answers
Players must work out the answers to the three questions on the question card and see if they hold any of the answers in their hand
If a player has more than one correct answer, they must decide which card to play and which card to keep!
The game ends when the first player correctly matches all their answer cards to the question cards.


—description from the publisher
categories: Math

name: Airborne: The Battle At Foucarville – Book 1: 12 Squad to Company Level Scenarios
description:
Airborne is a four volume series that seeks to chronicle the combat experience of the 101st Airborne Division during the early days of the Normandy Invasion.

Although book 1 of the series, Airborne: The Battle at Foucarville, has been play-tested with Final Combat and Micro Melee, these 12 historical scenarios can be enjoyed with most WWII squad to company level rules.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Airborne: Le Barquette Lock – Book 2: 12 Squad to Company Level Scenarios
description:
Airborne: Le Barquette Lock is the second book of four about the 101st Airborne Division's combat experience in Normandy during the early days of Operation Overlord.

The story is told in 12 squad to company level scenarios that examine the action at Les Droueries, Addeville, Pouppeville and more.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Airborne: Les Droueries – Book 3: 12 Squad to Company Level Scenarios
description:
Book No. 3 in the Airborne series takes the player to the infamous "Dead Man's Corner." This event was depicted in the video game, "Brothers in Arms, but it also plays out well on the gaming table with miniatures. The book includes the culminating struggle by Lt. Col. Ballard and his exhausted collection of airborne troopers.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Airborne: The Battle of Carentan – Book 4: 12 Squad to Company Level Scenarios
description:
Book 4, The Battle of Carentan, is the fourth and final book in the tetralogy.
It chronicles the horror on the Causeway and the action for which Lt. Col. Robert Cole was awarded the Medal of Honor.

It also covers the capture of Carentan and the counter attack by the 17th SS Panzergrenadier Division.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: A New Korean Crisis: 12 Notional Skirmish Scenarios
description:
A New Korean Crisis depicts 12 notional skirmishes within the context of a fictitious war for gamers to use on the miniature table. It covers events prior, during, and after a postulated modern war on the Korean peninsula.

Four of these skirmishes are inter-connected in a mini-campaign depicting an assault on a U.S. airbase.

All were created to explore various aspects of a major conflict where special forces will be deployed to conduct reconnaissance, direct action and related operations. Although designed with the SOF Warrior game system in mind, these skirmishes can be enjoyed with any set of modern conflict wargame rules.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Al Fajr: 14 Scenarios Based on the 2nd Battle of Fallujah
description:
Al Fajr contains 14 skirmish scenarios that chronicle the experience of an Army platoon during the opening days of the second battle for Fallujah in November 2004.

It is not written with one particular rules set in mind, and most squad to platoon level systems should work perfectly.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Arracourt '44: 12 WWII Armored Clashed Based on the Battle of Lorraine
description:
Arracourt '44 chronicles one of the greatest tank battles of the Second World War.

It follows Patton's 3rd Army as it rolls through Lorraine, France in early September of 1944 and confronts the make-shift Panzer Brigades that include the formidable Panther tank.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Beyond La Fièré: 22 Scenarios that Chronicle the Battle of Cauquigny
description:
Beyond La Fièré picks up where La Fiere leaves off.

It contains 22 skirmish and company level scenarios that examine the 82nd Airborne Division's struggle to consolidate the bridgehead west of the Merderet River during the first few days of Operation Overlord.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Final Combat: Battle for Saipan – Pacific Theather Action in 24 Skirmish Scenarios
description:
Final Combat: The Battle for Saipan chronicles the struggle for Saipan through 24 skirmish scenarios.

Although written for Final Combat, the book translates well to other skirmish rules.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Final Combat: Battle of Arnhem – 75 skirmish scenarios based upon Operation Market-Garden
description:
Final Combat: Battle of Arnhem contains 75 skirmish scenarios that chronicle the battle of Arnhem during Operation Market-Garden.

Although it is written for Final Combat, it will translate well to most skirmish rules.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Final Combat: Ernst Barkmann – 13 Skirmish Scenarios
description:
Final Combat: Ernst Barkmann examines the exploits of Knight's Cross winner Ernst Barkmann from February 1943, when he fought in Russia, through 1945, as he attempted to defend his homeland.

The book is written at a skirmish level and is designed for Final Combat.
However, as proven throughout the years, it will translate well to most skirmish level rules.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Final Combat: Operation Jupiter – 30 WWII Skirmish Scenarios that Chronicle the Battle for Hill 112
description:
Final Combat: Operation Jupiter contains 30 skirmish scenarios that chronicle the titanic struggle for Hill 112 during Operation Jupiter on 10-11 July 1944.

Although it is designed for Final Combat, it will translate well to most other skirmish rules.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Final Combat: Unternehmen Lüttich – 50 Skirmish Scenarios that Chronicle the Battle of Mortain
description:
Taken directly from Mark J. Reardon's excellent book, Victory at Mortain: Stopping Hitler's Panzer Counteroffensive, Final Combat: Unternehmen Lüttich offers the player an unparalleled gaming experience.

The battle is conveyed through 50 skirmish scenarios.
Actual terrain tables in both 15 and 20mm are included along with game master notes.

Although written expressly for Final Combat, these scenarios will translate well to most skirmish rules.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Final Combat: Victoria Cross – Skirmish Scenarios
description:
Victoria Cross presents a series of skirmish scenarios that allows you to recreate the heroic exploits of Second World War VC recipients.

In this United Kingdom tribute, you will be able to read the extraordinary accounts of how these soldiers overcame insurmountable odds in the prosecution of their duty.

The character sheets will endow you with the attributes of these great men.
Just fill in your name and see if you can replicate their conspicuous gallantry and devotion to country in the presence of the enemy.

—description from the designer
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Fulda Gap: A Fictional Cold War Campaign
description:
Fulda Gap: A Fictional Cold War Campaign contains 10 scenarios that chronicle a fictional Cold War campaign through West Germany. It is not written for any specific rules set, and the forces are generic enough, that any company level system should work just fine.

Although this campaign is based upon real-world circumstances, the actual date of the event remains undeclared. Therefore, the player is free to enjoy these scenarios with any Cold War force that is post WWII to present day. However, a so-called Ultra-Modern order of battle will assume the Soviet Union did not collapse.

—description from the designer
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Hürtgen: 20 Squad to Company Level Skirmish Scenarios
description:
Hürtgen contains 20 historical scenarios based on the first three months of the battle in the Hürtgen Forest, (September—November 1944).

Although not conjoined in campaign fashion, these scenarios will, nevertheless, allow players to gain insight into a titanic struggle that consumed thousands of souls in exchange for a negligible military gain.

—description from the designer
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: La Fièré: 12 Scenarios that Chronicle the Battle for La Fièré
description:
La Fièré contains 12 skirmish and company level scenarios that may be played with 6-54mm miniatures.

It chronicles the combat experience of the 82nd Airborne Division from the early hours of 6 June 1944 through the capture of Manoir de La Fièré and the vital bridge across the Merderet River.

—description from the designer
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: The Varvarivskyi Bridge
description: The Varvarivskyi Bridge is a scenario opposing DEVGRU and Ukrainian Nationalists to Spetsnaz and Ukrainian Separatists.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Final Combat: Medal of Honor – Skirmish Scenarios Vol. 2
description:
Medal of Honor Skirmish Scenarios Vol. 2 continues the immensely popular series that allows the player to recreate the heroic exploits of Second World War, Western European medal recipients.

Can you replicate their uncommon valor above and beyond the call of duty?

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Micro Melee: Battle of Prokhorovka – 13 Company Level Scenarios Based Upon the Southern Pincer at Kursk
description:
Micro Melee: Battle of Prokhorovka contains 13 company level scenarios that chronicle the action south of the Kursk salient from 10–12 July 1943.

Although these scenarios are written for Micro Melee, they should translate well to most rules designed for company sized engagements of WWII.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Micro Melee: Black Watch – II Canadian Corps at Normandy in 15 Company Level Scenarios
description:
Micro Melee: Black Watch contains 15 company level scenarios that chronicle the II Canadian Corps' struggle during Operation Spring.

It also features one of Canada's most celebrated battalions, The Black Watch, as they stormed Verrières Ridge that fateful day on 25 July 1944.

Although written for Micro Melee, it will translate well to most company level rules.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Micro Melee: Boot Camp – Light company level WWII scenarios
description:
Boot Camp comprises a series of eight scenarios that introduce players to the Micro Melee system in digestible portions without players having to read the entire rule book before getting into action.

This book also includes appendices that contain already prepared unit sheets and quick reference tables to reduce the preparation time for each scenario.

Not a Micro Melee player?
No problem, each of the historical company-level scenarios can be translated easily into other systems.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Micro Melee: Bourguébus Ridge – 16 company level scenarios that chronicle the 11th Armored Division's experience during Operation Goodwood
description:
Micro Melee: Bourguébus Ridge chronicles the combat experience of the British 11th Armored Division on 18 and 19 July, 1944 during Operation Goodwood.

The story is told in 16 scenarios that should translate well to most company level rules.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Operation Bagration: The 1944 Soviet Offensive – Skirmish Scenarios for Final Combat
description:
On June 22, 1944, three years to the day after Germany's 1941 invasion of the Soviet Union, the Red Army launched a massive offensive in Byelorussia.
Code-name Operation Bagration, it climaxed five weeks later with the Red Army at the gates of Warsaw.

This book contains 10 scenarios that chronicle the great Soviet summer offensive of 1944.

Although designed for use with Final Combat, these scenarios will translate well to other skirmish rules.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Operation Stryker Denial: 12 Scenarios based on the Seige of Sadr City
description:
Operation Stryker Denial
contains 12 scenarios that depict the US Army's effort to eliminate the Jaish al-Mahdi Militia's ability to shell the green zone from nearby Sadr City.

It takes place in the spring of 2008 and highlights the 1st Squadron, 2nd Stryker Calvary Regiment's combat experience.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Peleliu: Operation Stalemate II – Eleven Skirmish Scenarios that Chronicle the 1st Marine Division Fight for Peleliu
description:
Peleliu: Operation Stalemate II

contains eleven skirmish scenarios that chronicle the experience of the 1st Marine Division during the bloody battle for Peleliu in September of 1944.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Rhodesian Bush War: 10 Skirmish and Company Level Wargame Scenarios
description:
Rhodesian Bush War contains 10 scenarios based upon the Rhodesian Civil War (1964-80).

The book is not designed for any particular rules set and uses generic troop quality, leadership and weapons skills.

Although largely fictional, the scenarios are inspired by Faan Martin and Dan Tharp's memoirs.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Rising Sun: Operation Galvanic – Company Level Scenarios that Chronicle the 2nd Marine Division's Struggle at Tarawa
description:
Rising Sun: Operation Galvanic

Written for Micro Melee and company level engagements, this book is the second in the Rising Sun series.

It examines the 2nd Marine Division's struggle at Tarawa in 12 scenarios.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Final Combat: Skirmish Scenarios
description:
Final Combat Skirmish Scenarios is a collection of twelve scenarios that are designed to be played with Final Combat.

However, they are adaptable to many WWII skirmish rules sets.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Final Combat: Solitaire Soldiers – Ten Encounters Designed for Solo or Cooperative Play
description:
Solitaire Soldiers offers the player a WWII campaign experience that uses a role-playing format with miniatures.

It includes ten encounters that are designed to be played alone or cooperatively with a friend.

It chronicles the combat experience of a squad from the 116th Regiment of the 29th Infantry Division as they fight their way across Normandy during the summer of 1944.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Stealth Invasion: 10 Scenarios Based on the Ukrainian Crisis
description:
Stealth Invasion examines the 2014 Ukrainian Crisis through 10 modern squad to company level scenarios.

Although play-tested with SOF Warrior and Micro Melee: Modern Warfare, it is not written for a particular rules set.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Terror at Sea: A SOF Warrior Mission Pack
description:
Terror at Sea
is a SOF Warrior Mission Pack in which players take the role of special forces operatives, tasked with rescuing hostages on board a cruise ship.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: The Last Offensive: Go from Budapest to Balaton in 20 Company Level Scenarios
description:
The Last Offensive contains 20 squad to company level scenarios that examine Hitler's attempt to rescue the garrison trapped in Budapest and the final offensive near Lake Balaton.

Although it has been play-tested with Final Combat and Micro Melee, it is not designed with any particular rules set in mind.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: The Skirmish Collection: WWII Scenarios
description:
The Skirmish Collection: WWII Scenarios

This set of 10 skirmish scenarios was developed by a recognized scenario designer in the war-gaming community.

All of them have been presented at Fall In, Cold Wars, Little Wars, or Historicon and garnered eight HMGS best game awards in the process.

Although designed for Final Combat, you can play these historical scenarios with your favorite skirmish rules in any scale.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: WWII Eastern Front Skirmish Scenarios
description:
WWII Eastern Front Skirmish Scenarios is a collection of 12 miniature skirmish scenarios.

These scenarios are presented in a format that makes them easily playable with any set of rules that you may wish to use.
Playtests were made using both 20mm and 28mm figures, and rules used were Soldat, Final Combat, Arc of Fire, Face of Combat, Rules of Engagement, Battleground, Nuts, Seven Brothers, and various sets of house rules.

The scenarios included are:

Battle of the Bzura 1939 Poland
Operation Winter Storm 1942 Russia
Fall Blau 1942 Russian Caucuses
Pavlov's House 1942 Stalingrad
Stalingrad Sniper Hunt 1942 Stalingrad (The only non historical scenario)
Kharkov Must be Held 1943 Ukraine
Defending Etligen 1943 Crimea
The Battle of Krasny Bor 1943 Russia
Tempelhof Bahn Station 1945 Berlin
Lake Balaton 1945 Hungary
Breakout at Baruth 1945 Germany
Fall of Konigsberg 1945 Germany


Each scenario gives:
Historical Situation – the background to the actual action of which the skirmish game is ‘part of’. All of the scenarios are based on historical occurrences in the ‘big picture’. The action takes place as a ‘piece’ of this big picture, often revolving around some key action.

Orders of Battle and Mission Briefing - Each side is given fixed number of troops and a mission briefing, what the orders are and how to achieve your objective. It is best if only one side is privy to their mission briefing.

A Map – The maps are grid based and most tables are large if you were to play in 28mm.

Judges notes – Final Combat works best if you use a games-master and the scenarios are really geared for this. In this section they will find guidelines for running the game, how to keep it tense, when to divulge information etc. But don’t worry if you don’t use a. This section includes the ‘Special Scenario rules’, which cover a wide range of detail from special movement, artillery incoming, communications, special morale considerations etc.

Victory Conditions – Sometimes these are specific conditions that need to be met, sometimes they are a point based system.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Commonwealth Skirmish Scenarios: World War II – ETO 1940-45
description:
Commonwealth Skirmish Scenarios

This book contains 14 scenarios suitable for use with any set of WWII skirmish rules.
The scenarios are presented for use with Soldat II, but we have included a conversion chart for the following rules: Arc of Fire, BAPS, Battlefront, Battleground, Disposable Heroes, Final Combat, Nuts, and Rules of Engagement.


Operation Dynamo 1940 (British)
Operation Archery 1941 (British)
Operation Jubilee 1942 (Canadian)
Operation Perch 1944 (British)
Operation Martlet 1944 (British)
Operation Epsom 1944 (British)
Operation Windsor 1944 (Canadian)
Operation Charnwood 1944 (Canadian)
Operation Spring 1944 (Canadian)
Operation Bluecoat 1944 (British)
Operation Totalize 1944 (Canadian)
Operation Tractable 1944 (Canadian)
Operation Dragoon 1944 (British)
Operation Varsity 1945 (British)
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: WWII Skirmish Scenarios
description:
With the release of WWII Skirmish Scenarios, Britton Publishers returns to The Second World War with a vengeance.

Experience a variety of seldom done skirmishes such as a roadblock during the retreat to the Gothic line in Italy, Edson's Ridge on Guadalcanal, Lord Lovat's success during the Dieppe Raid, the Hürtgen Forest and more.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Z-Men: 10 Scenarios Based on the WWII Exploits of Australia's Z-Special Unit
description:
Z-Men seeks to chronicle the combat experience of the SOA (Special Operations – Australia) in the jungles and on the beaches of New Guinea, Timor Leste, Malaysia and Indonesia during the struggle against the Japanese from 1942-45.

Although these 10 historical scenarios were play-tested with Final Combat and Micro Melee, they can be enjoyed with most WWII squad to company level rules.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Now and Then
description:
Now and Then is more than a game, it's a tool for people who want to involve their loved ones in the process of thinking through their end of life plan and legacy – not just telling them what their wishes are once they’ve already been decided, but including them in the work of figuring it all out in the first place.

Because this can be a pretty exhausting process, both emotionally and practically, we’ve made this tool into a board game. That makes the whole experience lighter, more joyful, and easier to invite people into. Perfect for couples, families, and close friends.

—description from the designer
categories: Educational, Party Game
mechanics: Action/Event, Die Icon Resolution, Simulation, Storytelling

name: RPG Dice Quest
description:
RPG Dice Quest is a dice game were you and/or your friends play as a guild who is going through a dungeon to defeat the Overlord. Going through each room with different events that could happen in them. Collecting gold, fighting creatures, and defeating the Overlord is what you will be experiencing with every playthrough.

After having everything set up, you pick a direction to go in and then pick whichever option within that space to act upon. While moving from room to room, you can either fight and something on the floor. It's all your choice to do so.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Dice, Fantasy

name: Combat Command: The Bulge to Berlin – Army Lists for December 1944 - May 1945: European Theater
description:
Combat Command: The Bulge to Berlin adds army lists for the forces of the USSR, the British Commonwealth, Germany and the United States for the final months of the war in northern Europe for Combat Command and other similar platoon level games.
The module covers the period between December 1944 through the surrender of Germany in May 1945.
All the combatants major armor and infantry organizations are covered as well as Germany's ad hoc last defender battle groups.

It also provides rules for converting historical research for battles fought in this period into a balanced game as well as methods for setting up hypothetical battles between two evenly matched forces. A full terrain generation system is included.

Besides the orders of battle the module also includes an historical scenario, the Battle of Rodt, which illustrates how to create historical battles using this module.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Combat Command: Bagration to Budapest – Army Lists: Eastern Front June 1944 to November 1944
description:
This addition to the innovative Combat Command system includes full Army Lists for the Eastern Front from June 1944 through November 1944.
These lists allow players to recreate typical historical battalion sized units to use in tournaments or hypothetical battles.
In addition a section covers how to create well balanced battles based on actual historical match ups.
This section can be used with virtually any platoon based system.

Lists are provided for German Infantry, Panzer and Volksgrenadier Battlegroups.
The Russian lists cover Tank and Mechanized Corps as well as Rifle and Cavalry units.
In addition there are complete listings for Rumanian, Hungarian and Finish allied units.

This supplement requires at least a copy of Combat Command - the Basic Game to use.
To make full use of all features of the Army Lists a copy of the Advanced Game is also recommended.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Combat Command: Poland to Paris – Army Lists for September 1939 to July 1940
description:
This Army List Supplement covers the allied armies of Belgium, France, the Netherlands and Poland in their desperate struggle against Germany in the earliest days of World War II.

Specifically designed for Battalion level games such as Combat Command, this supplement includes complete rules for hypothetical battles between roughly evenly matched Battlegroups.
In addition it covers using the Battlegroup System to recreate historical battles.

All Battalion level units are covered from German Panzer Battalions to Dutch Marines mounted on bicycles.
Complete equipment lists cover the many rare vehicles used in this period – everything from Polish TKS tankettes to French Char B heavy tanks.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Nineveh: No Mercy
description:
Nineveh: No Mercy is a series of 5 card battles in which the player playing the red deck plays 2 cards, while the player playing the blue deck plays 3 cards. The higher total wins the battle.

Nineveh: No Mercy is based on true historical events. Starting in 626 BC, a series of civil wars have weakened the Assyrian Empire, thus emboldening occupied territories to unite in rebellion to topple the Empire. In No Mercy, the 22 red point cards represent the Assyrian army (The Wicked City of Nineveh being their capital), and the 33 blue point cards represent the coalition forces of the Babylonians, the Medes and the Persians. The Assyrian forces are more skilled and valued at 11 points per card, coalition forces are more numerous but less skilled and valued at 7 points per card. As the Assyrian general you command the 22 red point cards while your opponent commands the 33 blue point cards of the coalition forces.

There will be a series of 11 battles and the player who wins most of these battles gains a victory point. In each of these 11 battles, the Assyrian general plays 2 red cards against the coalition general’s 3 blue cards. After each conflict consisting of 11 battles, the players switch armies/colors and become the new general of the opposing army. The 1st player to win 2 victory points wins the War, thus ending the game. In case of a tie, a 3rd conflict is necessary to determine the winner.

As the Assyrian general, are you skilled enough to defeat the much larger coalition force? As the coalition general, can you overwhelm the Assyrian forces with your superior numbers?

—description from the designer
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Educational, Math, Print & Play
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Memory, Move Through Deck, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Trick-taking

name: Small Game Hunting
description:
The do gooders had largely put an end to big game hunting this was a problem until with a total disregard for the laws of physics someone created a way to shrink people to one inch in height and the sport of small game hunting was born.

Pick a few hunters and prepare to face whatever the average garden can throw at you, all you need is a handfull of 28mm figures/player and assorted model spiders, beetles and so on readily available from most toy shops.

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Eighth Edition): Codex Supplement – Raven Guard
description:
The Raven Guard are the Sons of Corax, and in the art of shadow warfare they are without equal. Theirs is the way of stealth, subterfuge and misdirection, ensuring their enemies are unaware of the true danger they face until it is far too late. Inside this 64-page hardback codex supplement, you'll find everything you need to unleash the Raven Guard in battle, plus thrilling lore and art to inspire your own collection.

Inside this book, you'll find:

The history of the Raven Guard and their dark heritage, wreathed in shadows and born from the acts of treachery during the Horus Heresy that almost wiped out the Chapter
A detailed description of Chapter organisation and iconography
A Raven Guard bestiary with a detailed background for Kayvaan Shrike
A showcase of stunningly painted Citadel miniatures
Rules for Kayvaan Shrike, Chapter Master of the Raven Guard
Stratagems, Warlord Traits, Tactical Objectives, Relics of the Ravenspire, the Umbramancy discipline, defining the ways that the Raven Guard wage war
And more!


You will need a copy of Codex: Space Marines and the Warhammer 40,000 rulebook to use the rules included in this codex supplement.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Eighth Edition): Codex Supplement – Salamanders
description:
The sons of the Great Khan are amongst the most naturally skilled warriors fighting to defend the Imperium, and fall upon their foThe Salamanders are among the noblest of the Adeptus Astartes, fighting without hesitation to defend those who cannot protect themselves. Yet this empathy belies an incredible determination in battle, for the Salamanders are masters of fire and fury, armed with masterwork wargear forged by their most skilled artificers. In this 64-page hardback codex supplement, you'll find everything you need to unleash the Salamanders in battle, plus thrilling lore and art to inspire your own collection.

Inside this book, you'll find:

The history of the Salamanders, and how they unleash the molten fury of their volcanic world upon their foes with their devastating artisan wargear
A detailed description of Chapter organisation and iconography
A Salamanders bestiary with a detailed background for Forgefather Vulkan He'stan and Captain Adrax Agatone of the 3rd Company
Rules for Vulkan He'stan and Captain Agatone
A showcase of stunningly painted Citadel miniatures
Stratagems, Warlord Traits, Tactical Objectives, Relics of Nocturne, the Promethean discipline, defining the ways that the Salamanders wage war
And more!


You will need a copy of Codex: Space Marines and the Warhammer 40,000 rulebook to use the rules included in this codex supplement.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Eighth Edition): Codex Supplement – White Scars
description:
The sons of the Great Khan are amongst the most naturally skilled warriors fighting to defend the Imperium, and fall upon their foes with unmatched speed and ferocity. Inside this 64-page hardback codex supplement, you'll find everything you need to unleash the White Scars in battle, plus thrilling lore and art to inspire your own collection.

Inside this book, you'll find:

The history of the White Scars, with a look at how they masterfully employ lightning warfare to confound and defeat their enemies
A detailed description of Chapter organisation and iconography
A White Scars bestiary with background details for every unit and Character featured
A showcase of stunningly painted Citadel miniatures
Rules for units that are only available to the White Scars Chapter and their successors
Stratagems, Warlord Traits, Tactical Objectives, Relics of Chogoris, the Stormspeaking discipline, defining the ways that the White Scars wage war
And more!


You will need a copy of Codex: Space Marines and the Warhammer 40,000 rulebook to use the rules included in this codex supplement.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Eighth Edition): Codex Supplement – Imperial Fists
description:
The Imperial Fists are the most stalwart of all Adeptus Astartes, and their stoicism in battle is legendary. When not serving in their celebrated role as Sentinels of Terra, the Imperial Fists ply the stars aboard their matchless battle station, Phalanx, to defeat the Emperor's foes wherever they may be found. Inside this 64-page hardback codex supplement, you'll find everything you need to unleash the Imperial Fists in battle, plus thrilling lore and art to inspire your own collection.

Inside this book, you'll find:

The history of the Imperial Fists and their relentless determination to live up to the exacting standards of their Primarch, Rogal Dorn
A detailed description of Chapter organisation and iconography
An Imperial Fists bestiary with a detailed background for Captain Darnath Lysander of the 1st Company and Captain Tor Garadon of the 3rd Company
Key background information on the Crimson Fists – the legendary successor Chapter of the Imperial Fists – and a bestiary of Pedro Kantor, their valiant Chapter Master
A showcase of stunningly painted Citadel miniatures
Rules for Captain Lysander, Captain Garadon and Chapter Master Pedro Kantor
Stratagems, Warlord Traits, Tactical Objectives, Relics of the Fists and the Geokinesis discipline, defining the ways that the Imperial Fists wage war
And more!


You will need a copy of Codex: Space Marines and the Warhammer 40,000 rulebook to use the rules included in this codex supplement.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Eighth Edition): Codex Supplement – Iron Hands
description:
The Iron Hands are one with the machine. They are among the most stoic and relentless of all Adeptus Astartes, ever willing to show the superiority of their bionic augmetics in battle to prove their belief that the flesh is weak. Inside this 64-page hardback codex supplement, you'll find everything you need to unleash the Iron Hands in battle, plus thrilling lore and art to inspire your own collection.

Inside this book, you'll find:

The history of the Iron Hands and their drive for cold, emotionless perfection, to cast off weakling flesh and embrace the unyielding fortitude of the machine
A detailed description of Chapter organisation and iconography
An Iron Hands bestiary with a detailed background for Iron Father Feirros, the Master of the Forge
A showcase of stunningly painted Citadel miniatures
Rules for Iron Father Feirros
Stratagems, Warlord Traits, Tactical Objectives, Relics of Medusa, the Technomancy discipline, defining the ways that the Iron Hands wage war
And more!


You will need a copy of Codex: Space Marines and the Warhammer 40,000 rulebook to use the rules included in this codex supplement.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Pic-Assiette
description:
The card game for appetizing kids!

A funny game learning how to make and complete well-balanced seasonal meals, but watch out for the SuperMenu!

Pic-Assiette ("Supermenu") is a game based on nutrition, with a simple message : it is OK to eat everything, but in a balanced way. The objective is to be the first one to create a full menu : starter, main course, side dish, desert, glass of water.

“Special” cards will spice the game up all along: SuperMenu, Berk, Whipped Cream, Disease, Birthday, …

—description from the publisher (translated)

LE JEU DE CARTES QUI OUVRE L’APPETIT !

Un jeu pour s’amuser à composer des menus variés, de saison et toujours équilibrés … mais gare au Pic-Assiette !

PIC-ASSIETTE est un jeu de cartes basé sur la nutrition pour apprendre, en s’amusant, à manger de tout et de manière équilibrée. L’objectif est d’être le premier à composer son menu varié et équilibré en moins de 7 fourchettes : entrée, plat, accompagnement, dessert et verre d’eau. Mais en composant son menu, des cartes "spéciales" viennent pimenter la sauce : Pic-Assiette, Cola, Beurk, Anniversaire, Chantilly,…

—description from the publisher
categories: Children's Game

name: Coup de pute
description:
literally translated by: whore trick

Players score points by doing dirty tricks in a specific situation by associating cards in their hands. The dirtiest one scores (decided by the current GM player). Rules also change from turn to turn.
Players keep going until one reaches 5 points.

—user summary

Le nouveau jeu by Topito : soyez la pire enflure et remportez la partie !

En associant des cartes " situation ", " personnage ", " action " et " objet ", fomentez le pire coup de pute possible : tous les coups sont permis ! Et n'oubliez pas, même les règles du jeu sont pleines de bassesses, changent à chaque situation pour plus de piment... et risquent de vous surprendre au pire moment !

Cartes Situations :
À l'enterrement de ma mamie...
Règle coup de pute de la situation : chaque joueur donne 2 cartes objet à son voisin de gauche.
C'est le jour de mon mariage...
Règle coup de pute : si un joueur prononce le mot " le ", il reçoit une pichenette.
J'ai une vilaine infection urinaire...
Règle coup de pute : le joueur le plus jeune passe son tour.

Cartes Personnages :
Ton papa chéri, Jean-Luc Mélenchon, un dealer chauve et aveugle, le gentil facteur, ta mère, ton cousin qui a été adopté...

Cartes Objets :
Ton utérus, un ticket de loto gagnant, un buste de Dany Boon, un slip sale, un iPhone neuf, un couteau mal aiguisé

Cartes Actions :
Prendre en bouche, jongler, insérer, passer au four, se moucher dans, gratter...

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: in-quest
description:
in-quest

space-age stimulation

Learn to Use the Scientific Method of Solving Problems

2 to 4 Players -- For teens and adults

Players compete to detect Errors in "Scintific Reasoning". Some are simple; some are subtle. If all players agree on the type of Error, each scores equally. But if opinions differ, the MINORITY VOTER may BOLD CHALLENGE for big rewards -- or penalties. Twenty investigations make a round. Eight rounds included.

Fun game for the curious

—description from the box
categories: Educational

name: Bingolette
description:
Each player has 7 game pieces, numbered from 2 to 8 and 28 tiles. The game pieces move around two tracks around the game board. movement is determined by a die. Each piece may change tracks once in it's movement. If a game piece lands on a numbered space, the numbers of the game piece and the space are multiplied. On the score section of the game board the result is covered with a tile.

The game ends, when 1 player has used all 28 tiles and has all his pieces in play. The winner is either the player who has covered the most spaces on the score section or the player who has covered the highest total of numbers.

—user summary
categories: Abstract Strategy, Math
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement

name: ジェム　スクランブル (Gem Scramble)
description:
In ジェム　スクランブル ("Gem Scramble"), a hex-grid board is seeded randomly with square glass tiles in 9 colors. The center hex is left empty, and each player starts with their token there. On their turn, a player moves their token in a straight line as far as they'd like, though they may not move onto or past another token. If there is a glass tile on the destination space, they collect it.

The game ends after a player has collected a certain number of tiles, which varies depending upon the player count. Points are awarded based upon collecting many tiles of one color, many tiles regardless of color, and for the gold tiles, certain extra scoring is available. The player with the most points wins.

—user summary
categories: Abstract Strategy

name: USB Cable & Connector
description: USB Cable & Connector 神経衰弱 (USB Cable & Connector Shinkei suijaku) is a card game where the cards feature different types of USB connections. The players aim to create correct connections between the cards, following the recognized USB standards.
categories: Card Game, Trivia
publishers: Jiga herutsu kōbō (じがへるつ工房)

name: Navarchus: Naval Warfare during the Punic Wars
description:
Navarchus is a miniature tabletop naval warfare game for scale 1:300

In the third century BC Rome was growing in power, but Carthage stood in the way.

The Carthaginians had controlled the Western Mediterranean for more than a century using a fleet of hundreds of war galleys. By coincidence the Romans captured one of these vessels. And because all parts of the vessel were painstakingly numbered Rome could now build its own fleet. Within 6 months Rome possessed a fleet of 120 war galleys.

The war for the Mediterranean could commence...

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Book, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame

name: Outlands: An Action Driven Miniature Skirmish Game
description:
OUTLANDS is a Sci-Fi Spaghetti Western set on the mysterious and deadly planet of Paradise.

The gameplay revolves around an Action/Reaction System that keeps both players in the game.
The unrestricted rule system allows YOU to 'Level Up' your characters, whilst training new and exciting skills.
You can make your characters the way YOU want.

Ideally suited for campaign play between a group of friends, the rules allow for one off stand alone games.

All you need to play is this rulebook, 5 models per player (ANY miniatures you already own), a tape measure and a handful of 6 sided dice.

Get ready to take your 1st exciting steps into the OUTLANDS.

The 114 page rulebook include:

A complete and comprehensive rule system explaining every aspect of OUTLANDS The Game,
50 Abilities and Special Skills,
40+ Items of Equipment.
A revolutionary weapon modification system so that no two weapons are the same.
Complete rules for creating a 'Spice Hunter' warband.


—description from the publisher
categories: American West, Book, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: El Zorro y el Condor
description:
The "Zorro" (fox) and the Condor is a game that narrates/recreates the story of 4 chachawarmi who must travel from the coast to their village in the mountains. In their journey they must choose between the way of the Condor (which represents knowledge) and the way of the Zorror (which represents fortune). The winner is the chawarmi who has the largest flock of llamas after the trip.

This is an bilingual educational game (Spanish/Aymara) based on Aymara legends/myths of the altiplano (north of Chile, Peru and Bolivia).

—user summary
categories: Unspecified
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Au Son du Clairon
description:
Au Son du Clairon is an evolution of the Billy Yank rule system to the Franco-Prussian War.

It also includes an expansion for the Russo-Turkish War of 1877-1878.

Published in French

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Stat Protocol
description:
Stat Protocol was designed by medical professionals who still have a sense of humor. In Stat Protocol, each player is a doctor at a hospital which has been inundated with sick patients! Players randomly select patients from a deck of cards who each have descriptions of their care, special instructions and length of stay. Patients are drawn randomly and play is impacted by the event cards and choices that the players (doctors) make with "drug" tokens as well as the number rolled on the dice. Players may choose to discharge patients or remove them from ICU depending on their game strategy. Don't worry -- you don't need a medical degree to play this game!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Humor, Medical
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Command Cards

name: Outlands: Legends – How To Be A Badass
description:
OUTLANDS LEGENDS: How To Be A Badass!!! is a mini-supplement for OUTLANDS.

Outlands Legends is an achievement bolt-on system that allows your warbands earned extra credits and bonuses to Heroic and Special Actions.

Be A Legend. Be A BADASS!!!!!

—description from the publisher
categories: American West, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Outlands: Mini Expansion 1 – The Noob
description:
The Noob is the 1st Mini-Expansion For OUTLANDS.

This rulebook will allow you to recruit The Noob for your warband.

Explain the training process and 'On The Job Training' experience.

Most importantly it will allow you to deploy a maximum of 6 models instead of the normal 5.

—description from the publisher
categories: American West, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: With Pike and Musket: Sixteenth- and Seventeenth- Century Battles for the Wargamer
description:
With Pike and Musket: Sixteenth- and Seventeenth- Century Battles for the Wargamer is a book that contains Wesencraft's 16th and 17th Century Wargaming rules plus Twenty-eight scenarios from the English Civil War.

The English Civil War is not a satisfactory name as it started in Scotland and spread to Ireland before reaching England. This classic book arms the reader with a working knowledge of the weapons and their uses, then presents suggested rules of play which will enable the table-top general to manoeuvre and fight in the manner of Charles I, Rupert, Essex, Cromwell, and the rest.

No less than twenty-seven battles of the period are described, including the numbers engaged, types of troops, battle maps and objectives. More than three hundred years after the dust of battle has settled, once again the New Model Army faces Newcastle's Whitecoats across a low valley. The outcome will depend upon the ability of the reader. Run out the guns and let the battle commence!

—description from the publisher

Introduction rules to the ECW with miniatures.

IGOUGO type rules
Individually based figures
27 scenarios (21 for ECW)
categories: Book, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation
publishers: Elmfield Press, The History of Wargaming Project

name: Wayfarer Tactics
description:
Wayfarer Tactics is dynamic, modular miniature wargaming system

With these rules, you use models from your collection to enact skirmished, large-scale battles, or party-centered dungeon crawls. Based loosely on our Wayfarer multiverse setting, you can stage your battles in worlds of magic-rich high fantasy, far flung intergalactic sci-fi, or anything in between.


Any genre! Fantasy, Modern, Steampunk, whatever!
Any model! Whatever kind of miniatures you collect, you can use them!
Tell your story! The engine let's you customize your own characters and forces!


—description from back of the book
categories: Book, Fantasy, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Coverage, Measurement Movement

name: A Perfect Sheet of Flame: American Civil War Miniature Wargame Rules
description:
American Civil War miniature wargame rules.

This is the most recent version of a series of miniature wargame rules that have been developed over a long period of time.

—description from the publisher
categories: American Civil War, Book, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Simulation

name: Astra Imperia: Space Combat Simluations
description:
Astra Imperia is a tabletop wargame.

Expand and explore space around you.

Exploit worlds and exterminate your enemies.

Rules include tactical combat, including ship building and strategic empire building

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Rebels and Yankees: Quick Play Rules for Wargaming the American Civil War
description:
Rebels and Yankees have been designed to introduce new players into wargaming in American Civil War and provide more experienced gamers a simple more relaxed way of enjoying the period without the complexities and depth of match play.
These rules are not written to provide a purist simulation of the period, but a game with a flavor for the period.

Rebel and Yankees uses 1 base width (BW) to equal 40 yds with 80 men deployed in two ranks. Several bases would make up a regiment unit depending on the regiments size. Base Widths (BW) are used also in the game for movement and range distances. Where players wish to use figures instead of the bases. If that is the case, then for distances use an inch instead of a base width. Calculate dice on number of figures in the front rank instead of the number of bases. For 15mm a base would be around 40mm and in 25/28mm a base width would be around 60mm.

To play the games all you need are six-sided dice (D6), your own models based in a common way between the two forces, terrain to represent the landscape of your battlefield and a ruler.
categories: American Civil War, Book, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Bee First
description:
In Bee First, be the first person to move all your bees from the garden into the hive to win, avoiding predatory wasps and bad weather.

Bee First is a dice game with math option for children and families.

Two versions are available for different ages.
Ages 3-6 use single die rolls to move bees.
Ages 5+ use two dice where math equations control movement.

—description from the publisher
categories: Children's Game, Math
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid

name: Chef de Char: 1944-1945
description:
Chef de Char is a beer and pretzel ruleset to simulate tank combats.
Each player represents a tank leader and gives orders to his crew, those are then executed.
—user summary

Chef de Char est une règle 'apéritif' rapide et létale. L'idée n'est pas de faire une règle pointue de simulation mais une règle qui peut, tout à la fois servir à faire découvrir les jeux de stratégie et permettre de passer un bon moment de jeu. Ce n'est pas une règle historique à proprement parlé, l'histoire est présente car la règle intègre les caractéristiques des chars de l'époque.

Cette règle est très simple à prendre ne main et en 2 à trois tours la mécanique est acquise.
Il y a 3 formats de jeux. Patrouille avec 5 chars par camp, Peloton avec 7 et compagnie avec 12 chars. En fonction du format chaque joueur dispose d'un nombre de point de commandement qu'il dépense pour réaliser un maximum de 3 actions.
Le joueur est le chef du char actif. Il faut imaginer que le chef de char donne ces ordres à son équipage (le joueur énonce à haute voix ce qu'il va faire), les ordres sont reçus par l'équipage (le joueur dépense ses points de commandement), l'équipage exécute les ordres (le joueur réalise les actions énoncées).
L'activation d'un char est faite par tirage au sort si bien que les deux joueurs doivent être attentif à ce qui se passe.La stratégie tient alors autant dans le placement sur le terrain, que dans la gestion des points de commandement.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Turn Order: Random

name: Warzoom
description:
Warzoom is a skirmish ruleset for small battles in major conflicts of the first half of the 20th century.
Scale independent where 1 mini represents 1 man, it offers 3 modes of play:

fast game
mini-campaign
grand-campaign


Warzoom est une règle de jeux d’escarmouche avec figurines destinée à vous faire revivre de grands conflits sur de petites batailles. Adaptés à tous types d’échelles et dotés d’un système innovant d’évolution du terrain de jeu, aucune partie ne ressemblera à la précédente.

Dans ce livre, vous trouverez toutes les règles nécessaires pour rejouer des conflits de la première moitié du 20ème siècle, mais également :

Des règles de budget pour créer votre propre groupe de combat
Un système d’expérience simple pour vos soldats
Des scénarios indépendants ou pour débuter une mini campagne
Des règles d'actions héroïques pour pimenter les parties !
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Avalon La Búsqueda del Grial
description:
Avalon The Grail Quest is a semi-operational board game for 3 to 6 players, with mechanics of worker placement (in this case Knights), obtaining points, and building a resource pool.

Brief review of the game. Each player with their Knights must perform actions with them depending on the resources obtained in their resource pool (in this case called energies that can be of 4 types: Combat, Diplomacy, Exploration and Teson) that are going to determine what types of actions you can Perform each turn. The actions available are numerous: battle enemies, explore places, enliven diplomatic relations, rescue ladies, participate in tournaments, all this to be the player with the most Honor (PV) that he obtains at the end of the game. But all this in addition cooperating with the opponents so that the enemies of the kingdom do not destroy it using a Damage Table that if it reaches the maximum all players will lose, thus adding a little cooperation to the competition.
Unfold your board and create your deck. Your goal is to defeat the Pantheon of your opponent to survive!

Avalon is a board game that aims to represent the comings and goings of the Knights of the Round Board in their quest for the Holy Grail.

—description from the designer

Avalon. La Búsqueda del Grial, es un juego de mesa semicooperativo para 2 a 5 jugadores, con mecánicas de colocación de trabajadores (en este caso Caballeros), obtención de puntos, y construcción de una bolsa de recursos.

Breve reseña del juego. Cada jugador con sus Caballeros debe realizar acciones con ellos dependiendo de los recursos obtenidos en su bolsa de recursos (en este caso llamados energías que pueden ser de 4 tipos: Combate, Diplomacia, Exploración y Tesón) que van vana determinar que tipos de acciones puedes realizar cada turno. Las acciones disponibles son numerosas: batallar enemigos, explorar lugares, avivar las relaciones diplomáticas, rescatar a damas, participar en torneos, todo ello para ser el jugador que más Honor (PV) que consiga al final de la partida. Pero todo esto además cooperando con los oponentes para que los enemigos del reino no lo destruyan usando para ello una Tabla de Daños que si llega al máximo todos los jugadores perderán, añadiendo así a la competición un poco de cooperación.
Despliega tu tablero y crea tu mazo. !!Tu objetivo es derrotar el Panteón de tu oponente para sobrevivir!!

Avalon es un juego de tablero que pretende representar las idas y venidas de los Caballeros de la Tablera Redonda en su búsqueda del Santo Grial.

—description from the designer (Spanish)
categories: Fantasy, Mythology

name: Chinese Nationalist Army: Manchuria and Burma 1937-1945
description:
Flames of war compatible force list supplement to BattleFront Flames of War game.

A copy of FoW is required to use this book

Covering the Chinese Nationalist Forces fighting the Japanese from 1937-1945.

A companion to the Imperial Japanese Army Handbook Manchuria & SE Asia 1940-1945

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Math Tac Toe
description:
Math Tac Toe is a mathematical dice game where two to four players use simple equations using only the die roll numbers 1 through 6 to control territory and gain points.

This lasercut wooden game comes with a 6x6 game board with four integrated scoring tracks, 36 two-sided tiles and a pair of dice. The tiles have one of 19 numbers on one side and an arrow on the flip side.

On each turn, a player will…

Roll both dice
Formulate two to four math equations using both numbers
Flip any tile that matches that matches the answer to one of the mathematical equations based on the two numbers rolled.
Align the arrow to point to the player
Score one point if three or more arrows face the player.


Play until someone hits 15 points,

Examples of math equations using die faces:
1+6=7 6x5=30 7-3=4 8÷2=4

The only possible mathematical answers for a pair of dice are: 1-12, 15, 16, 18, 20, 24, 30 and 36.

—description from the publisher
categories: Educational, Math

name: Monoch
description: Monoch is an abstract strategy game in which black and white blocks are combined. The goal is to be the first player to connect both ends of the blocks (Obi) in your color while meeting the building requirements.
categories: Abstract Strategy

name: Chef de Char: Opération Desert Sabre Daguet
description:
Chef de Char Guerre du Golfe is a supplement for Chef de Char on the 2nd Gulf War.

Additions:

rules (for helicopters, missiles, etc...)
vehicles (Iraqi- US - British - French)
helicopters
scenarios


—description from publisher, published in French
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement

name: Iron Cross: 6mm Miniature Wargame System in WWII – Core Rules
description:
The game Iron Cross was born out of the desire of a group of “wargamers” from the 70s / 80s to simulate their historical battles from WWII, made in the past with maps and tokens, using this time miniatures and 3D scenarios suitable to represent small and medium scale tactical actions.
We started in 2004, with the launch of our 1st — edition and in the following two years, with the publication of several modules for the system.

The system stopped in 2007, due to some problems with the miniatures and the need to rewrite the rules, since they were already well changed, due to the publication of several articles and modules by us. We left the game in the public hands for a long time, and in this year 2020, we are back in action.

These Rules cover:

USA, Soviet Union, Germany and Brazil Armies in WW2
Infantry and Tanks
4 game scenarios
Markers for 3d printing
Player Aids
categories: Book, Miniatures, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: Rustik Racing: Travel
description: Players throw the dice in turns. Following precise rules, they move their pegs from station to station on the race track until one player reaches station 12.
categories: Sports

name: Heroes & Treasure: Arena
description:
Heroes & Treasure: Arena is a card game for kids and adults that simplifies the traditional one-on-one combat game. It's the perfect introduction to combat card games for people who aren't experts. It is standalone and does not require any experience with the Heroes & Treasure Family RPG.

There are no booster packs to buy, no strategy guides to study, no decks that need building. You can jump right in and enjoy the game.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Fantasy
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Move Through Deck

name: Riff-Raff
description:
The players roll the die to move their 6 discs about the board. The players start with 1 disc on space A of their color. On the roll of an even number another disc is put into play. If a player lands on another disc or a stack of discs, that player captures the stack by putting his or her disc on top of the stack. If a player has captured at least 2 discs, he may return that stack of disks to his home-base (A) to keep them safe. The game ends when there is only one active color of discs left on the board. The winner is the player who captured the most Discs.

—user summary
categories: Abstract Strategy
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: StarDust
description:
StarDust is a tabletop miniatures game of spaceship combat.

It is an easy-to-play system meant for friendly games using whatever miniatures you have handy.

Eight-sided dice are required and you'll also need some space to play and a tape measure.

This edition includes full rules, ship details, a counter sheet, a quick reference sheet, and four scenarios to get you started.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: StarDust: Ground
description:
StarDust: Ground is a tabletop miniatures wargame designed for 15mm models but suitable for 6mm.

Use any miniatures you already own and some d8 dice.

Enjoy gaming for gaming's sake!

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Rubber and Lead: Furious Fast Racing
description:
Rubber and Lead is a miniatures car racing game.

Vehicles are armed with a mix of weapons, but at the end of the day, it's all about who gets across the finish line first!

You will need cars, some dice and a track to race on in addition to these rules.

—description from the publisher
categories: Miniatures, Racing

name: Planes and Parachutes: The Caterpillar Club – Gaming Rules for WWII Dogfight
description:
THE CATERPILLAR CLUB

The average cockpit temperature in a WWII plane shot down reportedly increased from a comfortable 20 degrees to 3,000 degrees centigrade in a matter of a few seconds; escape was virtually impossible.

These set of rules are designed to re-enact the glorious one on one air combat (Dog fighting) during the WWII period between the Spitfire and the ME109.

GAME REQUIREMENTS


Two, six sided dices (D6)
Two paper clips (for altitude and speed bar)
Plane Stats Card (Blanks provided for photocopying)
Plane Manoeuvre cards. (To be cut out)
Two or more 1/300-scale planes.


AND A PINCH OF IMAGINATION!

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Simulation

name: Imperial Japanese Army: Manchuria & SE Asia 1940-1945
description:
The Complete Army Handbook on Imperial Japanese Forces is the database to allow you to field a Japanese force in your Flames of War (The WW2 tabletop miniatures game) games.

Armed with this book you can conquer the plains of Manchuria, invade Tibet, attack the British in Hong Kong, Shanghai, Malaysia, Singapore and Burma.

Dominate SE Asia with your forces and take the pacific War to new, unexplored, heights!

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Fire Fight! Vietnam 1965-1975 Skirmish Rules
description:
FIRE FIGHT! Vietnam Skirmish Rules 1965-1975 can be used for any scale from 15mm right up to 1:35th!

Ideal for Platoon up to Company sized encounters (Battalion if you have the room!) from 1960 right through to the end of the war in 1975; but can be used beyond -such as the war with China and the invasion of Cambodia --or even further afield to the Middle East, '67 and '73 wars?

This massive book (227 pages!) has a background section, comprehensive rules section covering everything from firing, wepaons, concealement, cover, tactics, greandes, air launched nasties, flamethrowers, mortars, artillery, forward observers, radios, improvised explosives and booby traps, vehicles from 50cc bikes right up to main battle tanks such as the M48a1 and the T54/55!!
Also included are optional/advanced rules for things such as animals, village dogs, weather and infiltration amongst other things!

And if this wasn't enough includes a comprehensive TO&E section covering the US Army/USMC, the ARVN, the PLAF (VC main Force and VC Local Force) and the PAVN (NVA)...
and did I mention helicopters? yes they are covered!
From the UH-1B, UH-1D and of course the COBRA GUNSHIP!!!

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Vietnam War, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: PACIFIC! War in the Pacific 1937-1945: Japanese and US Marine Corps Forces
description:
Flames of War compliant supplement detailing the Japanese and USMC Forces for the Pacific Theatre of WW2, 1937 to 1945. Includes special rules on bunkers, detailed order of battle for IJN forces from the invasion of China in '37 to defence of the Home Islands in '45.

Including engineering rules, obstacles and comprehensive rules on bunkers, obstacles, kamikaze attacks, banzai charges and desperate defenders rules.

Detailed TO&E for the USMC from D-Series, E-Series and finally F-Series organisation
-rules for amphibious assaults, engineers, ship-to-shore bombardments and a whole host more!

Fully illustrated with pictures, photographs and a comprehensive rules and order of battle section make this an invaluable addition to your FoW collection.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Armed Forces of Nuevo Colorado: Volume One – Esercito di Stado and Marines, Pere to Perez
description:
