With this book you can re-create a Nuevo Colorado armed force, from the 32nd Air cavalry with their UH-1D and Cobra helicopters, right through to the 28th Armoured Regiment with their assortment of Russian and American armour, including T-62 tanks, M-24's, M-48's and T-55's! Field artillery to support your conscript troops, battle across the jungle, the scorching desert wastes and the urban environment as you hunt down and engage the Contras and bring them to justice at the mercy of your rifles! bring in air support in the form of Phantom II flying out of Bocca Gracia and blast the rebel's!

Also included is the complete TO&E for the Marine Infantry Regiments, the regular Marines (pre-cursors to so many coup's) and the Amphibious Assault Marines
-the riverine forces with their fleet of landing craft and 'swift' patrol boats;
details of all vehicles and types abound alongside a comprehensive historical background to this troubled Central American country.
deploy the UNIT (paramilitary death squads) the Esercito, the Policia nacional and the Local Defence Forceand strike terror in the Contras hearts!
Call for reinforcements from the Mechanised Regiments aboard their MpT-s3 half tracks (license built M5/M3 half tracks in NC) or the 5th cavalry with their M-113's and organic tank companies!

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Ne Plus Ultra +: Rules for playing Miniature Battles Set in the High Baroque Period
description:
Ne Plus Ultra + fast play rules are an evolution of the Ne Plus Ultra rules from NDC Wargames

Initially designed for 15mm.
categories: Age of Reason, Book, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation, Turn Order: Random

name: NOBODY
description:
Game includes rules for 4 classical rules of Draughts and the new game NOBODY. Gameplay is on a regular board of Chess/Draught. It`s a huge wooden board and big wooden pieces.
One player starts on his first two rows filled with 16 playing pieces in one color. The other player has nothing and is called the NOBODY. One player has to move as much pieces as possible to the two rows of the opposite by using moves similar to Draught. In his turn Nobody can do nothing, or move a piece just one square, or make a special three-step-move to catch pieces by using the pawns of the other player.
Player with most pieces off or on the board wins.

—user summary
categories: Abstract Strategy

name: RUN! The Card Game
description:
RUN! is the card game in which players simulate hikers running from a ravenous grizzly bear. In order to win, you don’t need to be the fastest player—you just need to be faster than the slowest player!

Stay alive each round by being as quick as possible. The higher the point total in your hand each round, the faster you will be! Each player starts with three cards and three life chips. The game is played in rounds, with players taking turns picking up and discarding cards to try to achieve the best hand possible. Cards represent escape variables, ranging from -2 to +7. Once a player believes he has a winning hand, he hits the table and yells “RUN!”—at which point the remaining players take one last turn to try to improve their hands before concluding the round. Players then reveal their cards and use any Sabotage Cards or other Specialty Cards in their hand to trip up the other players and/or boost their own chances of survival. The player with the lowest (slowest) hand must feed a life chip to the hungry bear. Play continues in rounds until just one player is left standing and is declared the winner!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Humor

name: TOP JOB Africa
description:
TOP JOB is a card game where you team up professionals to launch businesses in 5 different industries. Team up a nurse, a surgeon, a cleaner and a manager and you have a hospital! But be careful... other players may try to steal your cards, hire your crew or send you to pay extra taxes!

Gather the best team following the needs of your Business Partner (personal goal card) and once a player has launched 3 businesses, it's time to score! The player with the highest victory points wins.

THE 1st GAME ABOUT BUSINESS
THAT’S ONLY ABOUT PEOPLE

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game

name: Trivial Pursuit: Rock & Pop Edition (Travel)
description:
Part of the Parker Travel series.

A twp person (or team) travel version of Trivial Pursuit. The carrying case splits into tow halves, each containing 50 trivia cards, and an affixed scoring piece to hold eared wedges. It also includes a die with 6 colors on it, to randomly determine which question is next asked.

The categories are: Blue- Top of the Pops, Pink- Born in the USA, Yellow- Great British Hitmakers, Brown- Passing Fads, Green- No Number Ones, and Orange- Juke Box Jive.
categories: Travel, Trivia

name: That Embattled Isle: Seven Battles from the History of England 60 AD to 1282 AD
description:
That Embattled Isle
is a set of seven detailed historical scenarios for De Bellis Antiquitatis (DBA 2.2.) that can be enjoyed as a set in a group or convention setting, or played one at a time by enthusiasts.

The battles trace a variety of foreign invasions of Britain and resistance against them from earliest recorded history with the Romans through the 13th century.

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Spelldancer: The Mage Wars – Fantasy Wargame Rules
description:
Mage-wars
is a fantasy wargame designed to work equally well in 15mm or 25-30mm.

Compatible with miniatures from a wide range of manufacturers and designed to give the players the freedom and flexibility to let their imaginations run free.

Tactics and formations play an important role in winning a battle, and will often swing the odds in favour of he more cunning player rather than the largest forces.

With an easy to use magic system and rules for customizing character models that will enable you to produce individual and unique heroes, mages and officers.

The rules can easily be used to fight small skirmishes of just a few models each up to massed battles between armies fielding thousands of troops.
The discipline and morale rules enable well motivated, disciplined troops to fend off much larger but more poorly lead opponents.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Ohio Valley Skirmish
description:
Ohio Valley Skirmish
is a miniatures table top wargaming rule set for simulating American Civil War combat.

This rule set is usable for armies from a single regiment to multiple corps per side.

—description from the publisher
categories: American Civil War, Book, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Sgt Ligloo: Règle d'escarmouches, période Napoléonnienne
description:
Sgt. Ligloo: Napoleonic Skirmish Rules

For 20/28 mm

Each player controls one of more group of 7/12 men each.

Scale:
1 mini = 1 man
1 cm = 1 m
1 turn = 1 min

— published in French
categories: Book, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Sgt Ligloo Goes To Hollywood!
description:
Sgt Ligloo Goes To Hollywood ! is an expansion for Sgt. Ligloo covering the French intervention in Mexico and the American Civil War.

For 15, 20, 25/28 mm miniatures

Each player controls one of more group of 7/12 men each.

Scale:
1 mini = 1 man
1 cm = 1 m
1 turn = 1 min
categories: American Civil War, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Пять Слов (Five Words)
description:
A game about fencing with a long sword according to the teachings of Johann Lichtenauer (kunst der Fechten or KdF).

At the beginning of the game you will need to create your deck with fencing techniques, choose the characteristics of a fighter and your sword. Then you start your battle.

First, at the Zufechten distance - you select a hat card and you can strengthen it with another card to increase the strike speed. When planning your action, you will see part of the opponent’s cards, and he will see part of your cards. Therefore, you can predict his actions or try to confuse him and bluff. Players plan all actions at the same time.
When a hit card is selected, players reveal their cards and compare the speed. Anyone who turns out to be faster becomes an attacking player (in terms of Kdf - he has a Vorschlag).

Further, the battle continues at a distance of Krieg. Players also choose a hit and its speed. When choosing, you need to consider the position of your sword and the position of the opponent’s sword, as well as how much the opponent puts pressure on the sword (Fullen, in KdF).

Further, the fighters find themselves in the Ringen distance and apply deadly wrestling techniques.

During the battle, the player may get wound or injured. Wounds limit the choice of cards and the player’s overall stamina. Injuries reduce the number of cards in the hand. The game goes up to 5 wounds or 3 injuries.

Also in the game there is a campaign mode with light legacy elements. Throughout the campaign you will take part in tournaments (fechtschule) in different cities. Between battles, you can upgrade your fighter, buy swords and heal wounds. The winner of the campaign receives the title of master of fencing and can use special "master’s" techniques.

The game is available in PNP version and is distributed free of charge. You can also play at Tabletopia and Tabletop Simulator.

So far, only Russian version available, sorry.

Карточная игра про историческое фехтование.

В 14-15 веках на территории Священной римской Империи жил Иоганн Лихтенауэр. Он собирал приёмы и техники фехтования на различном оружии. Позднее его ученики написали множество книг на основе его учения. Часть этих фехтовальных манускриптов дошли до наших дней. В игре «Пять Слов» вы будете фехтовать на длинных мечах по учению Иоганна Лихтенауэра.

Игра основана на реальных текстах и приёмах немецких фехтовальных мастеров прошлого. Изображения также взяты из исторических манускриптов.

Карточная игра про фехтование длинным мечом в традиции Иоганна Лихтенауэра (kunst der Fechten или KdF).
В начале игры вам нужно будет создать свою колоду с фехтовальными приёмами, выбрать характеристики бойца и свой меч. Затем вы начинаете своё бой.

Сначала на дистанции Zufechten – вы выбираете карту удара и можете усилить её другой картой, чтобы увеличить скорость удара. При планировании своего действия вы будете видеть часть карт противника, а он будет видеть часть ваших карт. Поэтому вы сможете предсказывать его действия или попытаться запутать его и блефовать. Все действия игроки планирует одновременно.

Когда карта удара выбрана, игроки вскрывают свои карты и сравнивают скорость. Тот, кто оказался быстрее становится атакующим игроком (в терминах Kdf - у него Vorschlag).
Далее бой продолжается на дистанции Krieg. Игроки также выбирают удар и его скорость. При выборе вам нужно учитывать положение своего меча и положение меча противника, а также как сильно противник давит на меч (Fullen, в KdF).
Далее бойцы оказываются на дистанции Ringen и применяют смертельные техники борьбы.

На протяжении сражения игрок может получить Рану или Травму. Раны ограничивают выбор карт и общую выносливость игрока. Травмы уменьшают количество карт в руке. Игра идёт до 5 ран или 3х травм.

Также в игре есть режим кампании с лёгкими элементами легаси. На протяжении кампании вы будете принимать участие в турнирах (fechtschule) в разных городах. Между боями вы сможете улучшать своего бойца, покупать мечи и лечить раны.

Победитель кампании получает титул мастера фехтования и может использовать специальные «мастерские» техники.

Включает в себя дополнение «Десятка мечей».
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Fighting, Medieval, Print & Play, Renaissance, Wargame

name: BTW: La Guerra
description:
La Guerra is the lead game in the Between the Wars game series.

Currently in development, the game will have at least 4 countersheets (and probably more), 3 map segments, a very pretty box and the usual TKC refinements, ranging from a cut down TSWW rules set to lovely shiny dice.

Covering the Spanish Civil War, the game will include a grand campaign module, as well as a variety of learning scenarios and game modules, ranging from simple air missions to the Battle of the Ebro.
categories: Civil War, Wargame, World War II

name: TSWW: Liberation
description:
Liberation is the TSWW Game covering the Western Allied liberation of Nazi occupied Europe.

Commencing in July of 1943, play to force Italy out of the war, and then stab into the “soft underbelly of Europe” or launch a hail mary assault in 1943 on the French Coast. Smash the Nazis in France and drive deep into Germany with a successful post Overlord breakout… Can you hang on long enough in the West to defeat the Western Allies and possibly free up enough firepower to save the Reich? Doubtful – but its the only hope for a Germany on the verge of collapse in 1944….

With 14 maps, and a minimum of 5600 counters (quite probably more – the RAF alone will be 2 sheets, as will the Royal Navy) over 20 sheets, Liberation finalises the first generation of TSWW Games in the West. Development is at an advanced stage, with only USAAF and USN OBs to be researched, along with the Repubblica Sociale Italiana which is already part researched.

Map art is at an advanced stage, relying as it does on the heavily revised mapping for Mare Nostrum, Barbarossa and Blitzkrieg II. Art snippets will appear in due course in our Blog!

The various modules and scenarios will commence with small learning ones designed to ease your way into the TSWW system with minimal fuss, and will progress through smaller modules handling the invasion of Sicily (Operation Husky), the Gothic Line, and Anzio, then into France via Overlord and Neptune, Avalanche (the invasion of the South of France) finally concluding with the Wacht am Rhein and the final breakouts into the depths of Nazi Germany for the land aficionados out there, along with the strategic bombing campaign undertaken by the RAF and USAAF against the Reich for those of you who must fly everywhere!

Major campaigns will include Italy, North West Europe and of course the usual massive Grand Campaign module handling the entire Western Allied liberation of Europe.
You too can be Patton or Montgomery on the one hand, or Von Rundsted or Kesselring on the other.

Space permitting Liberation will also include a major what if campaign designed to explore Winston Churchill’s desired approach to Germany… through the Ljubljana gap and into Southern Germany, heading off the Soviet advance from the East, and fulfilling the promise made by Chamberlain to defend Poland…
categories: Wargame, World War II

name: TSWW: I Shall Return
description:
I Shall Return, researched and developed by Dennis Dubberley who is a global expert on the campaign, is the TSWW game dealing with the Philippines Campaigns during The Second World War. Commencing with the Japanese attacks on the US forces in the Philippines in December of 1941, I Shall Return ends with the Japanese Surrender in August of 1945.

With 10 maps at 15 miles to the hex, as well as strategic mapping as necessary, 12 countersheets and a very pretty box showing General Douglas MacArthur striding ashore as he returned to the Islands as promised, I Shall Return fills in the gap between Day of Infamy and Singapore in the game mapping, and concludes the early war period in the Pacific Theatre (excepting China of course).

As ever, within the box will be a slew of learning scenarios, game modules and the Grand Campaign, with everything from the fall of Corregidor to the mammoth naval battles surrounding the Leyte Gulf Landings, I Shall Return provides a one box solution to the the Philippines campaign.

Dennis has also asked us (which we have agreed with alacrity) to include the projected US invasion of Formosa (Taiwan) in the game box… as usual the what ifs just keep coming with TSWW!

—description from the publisher
categories: Wargame, World War II

name: Office Decathlon
description:
It’s time to PLAY outside the box with Office Decathlon - a series of Olympic-inspired physical and mental challenges where you can show the office who’s boss!

Choose from events like Office Chair Bobsled, Coffee Cup Relay or Pencil Javelin for team building, icebreakers and pure enjoyment!

Individual players or teams compete in 10 different events using everyday office supplies. Each event is scored and the overall first, second and third place winners are draped in gold, silver and bronze medals in an award ceremony - creating podiums and playing patriotic background music is highly encouraged!

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Humor, Party Game

name: TSWW: Operation Watchtower
description:
Operation Watchtower is the all encompassing operational game covering The SW PAC theatre of WW2.

Commencing with the 1941-42 Japanese drive to the South West, aimed at cutting Allied supply routes to Australia, the game continues through the desperate US led counter attack at Guadalcanal and the Australian troops clinging on for their very existence at Port Moresby through the climactic and bloody naval battles in the Coral Sea, Bismarck Sea, The Eastern Solomons and in Iron Bottom Sound, to the eventual Allied drive north towards the Japanese bastion at Rabaul.

The game will ship with 12 countersheets (3360 counters), covering all the forces involved in the campaign from start to bloody finish… It fits between Day of Infamy and Singapore!, and links directly to both of these titles, as well, of course, as I Shall Return and the final TSWW Pacific series title Kamikaze….

With 21 new style maps, with the same exceptional plasticised finish as Operation Merkur, the game will include New Britain, New Guinea, The Solomon Islands, Truk, and Noumea on map. As usual the maps will split enabling you to enjoy the game in parts as well as on the large combined map area. It is likely that additional Strategic Mapping will enhance your play further – watch the updates on the blog for more as the game moves towards completion!

Orders of Battle will include the usual TSWW refinements, including modules for the major land and naval battles, a variety of what if options and so forth.

Rules and charts will be to the normal TSWW standard.

—description from the publisher
categories: Wargame, World War II

name: TSWW: Kamikaze
description:
Kamikaze is the last TSWWV1 Series Title

With a minimum of 12 Counter sheets (and probably 16 – this is going to be a BIG game) and 20-22 map sheets (14-18 15 mile maps, 2-4 strategic maps) the game picks up the NPAC and CPAC campaigns right were Day of Infamy leaves off.

The campaign starts in November of 1943 with the initial landings on Makin and Tarawa, moving through the Marshall Islands to the Marianas and finally the invasion of Okinawa in 1945.

Additionally the game will include Operation Downfall – the proposed invasion of Japan which will presume that the A-Bomb programme was retained as a last resort (or was late)….

Clearly we will include various learning scenarios plus a variety of modules in the game covering the key elements of the long hard drive towards the Japanese home islands as well, plus some what if items as they are developed.

—description from the publisher
categories: Wargame, World War II

name: TSWW: The China Incident
description:
—Description from the publisher:

Commencing in 1937 and ending with the official end of the Chinese Civil war in 1949 the game will be designed to link into the BTW “Korea” game… as well as the PTO titles of TSWW, and as such is going to be a monster game to be matched by few others.

In the really rather pretty box will be a variety of delectable components for your perusal and play! These include:

25 maps [Note that TSWW maps are smaller than standard size] covering most of Mainland China, bits of Machuria <sic> and the Eastern USSR, plus parts of Korea and areas of the Japanese home Islands.
20 counter sheets. On these will be a full Nationalist, Communist and Warlord Chinese OB with the best research into these forces we can assemble, plus snap shots into the Soviet OB up to 1941, and then a full Soviet PTO OB to fit in with Barbarossa and Vengeance. Western Allied forces are likely to be limited at least in the first instance during research to the assets deployed to China – so the flying tigers, USAAF assets for the most part.


We will also put together the 1944-49 or 50 US intervention OB for ground forces and if space permits may impose upon the team to concoct a what if USA Invades China optional OB. Space will be at a premium with 5-700 Chinese “divisions” to contend with! Optional Chinese forces will be provided to illustrate the difference in capability ownership of a land route – preferably from a port with a rail line would have made to the Chinese forces in the field.

TSWW System rules – including the rapidly to become infamous “you are a drug dealer” rule…. Without specific areas of China both sides struggled for money as these areas were the prime Opium growing zones. In addition a series of corruption rules and “cross forces” trading systems will also be worked out to show how the Chinese and Japanese essentially co-existed for extended periods of time. There are a few other things we want to show – but they can remain secret for a while!
Grand Campaign Chinese, Japanese, Western Allied OBs.
At Start book. In this there will be a slew of modules – ranging from small scale things to teach you how to play the game to major operations ranging from the capture of Shanghai, the assault on Nanking, Nomonhan/Khalkin Gol, Suixian-Zaoyang, Changsha, Guangzi and Zaoyi; the Manchurian Strategic Offensive Operation, and then the key elements of the Chinese civil war. We hope to provide 20 or so modules and scenarios in the box which I think is a good target.
Charts
UIC
Dice – the usual 2 x D10s…
A very pretty box.
categories: Wargame, World War II

name: Antesignani: Règles de jeu avec figurines pour batailles antiques
description:
Antesignani is a miniature wargame ruleset for the Ancient-Medieval period.
It favors playability, reduction of litigious cases and adaptability to all types of basing, minis scales and play area.

Antesignani est une règle pour la période antique/médiévale privilégiant la jouabilité, la réduction a minima des situations litigieuses, et l’adaptabilité à tous types de soclage, d’échelles et de surface de jeu.
categories: Ancient, Book, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Family Quiz: The Game of Classic Family Fun
description:
The appointed Quiz master picks 8 categories from 10 in the main section and 10 questions from 2 of the mini categories giving a total of 100 questions.

The game is played in sections with a joker being used to get double points for the round. a score board is provided to keep tally.

—user summary
categories: Trivia

name: Don't Wake Oscar!
description:
"Don't wake Oscar the Grouch" is the name of the game in which players collect rubbish from the playground while Oscar snoozes in his bin.

Playing as Big Bird, Cookie Monster, Elmo, and Count von Count, players try to fill their rubbish bin before a pop-up plastic figure of Oscar the Grouch pops out of his trash can.

Young children will delight in this game of color matching, shape sorting and suspense as they try to be the first to fill their bin. But beware, if Oscar awakes during a player's turn, back the rubbish goes until the next turn.

The first child to fill his bin is the winner.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Watch with Mother: Board Game
description:
A fun- filled race and collect game featuring delightful colour puzzle pictures of those old Watch with mother favourites; The flowerpot men, Andy pandy, The woodentops and Rag Tag and Bobtail.

The game is simple yet fun to play and introduces colour, shape and number recognition to younger people.

—description from the back of the box
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Doin' The Most
description:
Doin' The Most is a creativity based competition with a drinking aspect to make it funnier and weirder as you go.

The judge rolls the dice and draws from 1 of 3 corresponding decks (verbal, physical, crazy). Every card has a different challenge and one by one, each person competes to impress the current judge. The funniest/best player wins the card, while everyone else drinks. The judge duties then rotate to the left and the process repeats. The first player to five cards wins the game.

DTM is like a combination of Scattergories, Balderdash, charades, short-form improv, and King's Cup.

—description from the designer
categories: Mature / Adult

name: Seacom
description: Seacom is a game of naval conquest for 2 players, that combines elements of popular deckbuilding and dueling card games with a strong focus on balanced gameplay and heavy interaction. The winner is decided by reducing your opponent's supply points to 0. There are many ways to achieve this, but the path you choose is your own.
categories: Card Game, Nautical, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Take That

name: Dino Hatchers
description:
Dino Hatchers transports you to the prehistoric continent of Pangea on your quest to retrieve a rare species of stolen dinosaur egg!

On your journey, you will befriend many dinosaur companions each with unique skills and abilities who will assist you on your quest!

Avoid the many traps that litter your path whilst eluding the gaze of the dreaded MADmatician, or you'll be Dino chow in no time!

Dino Hatchers is a 2-4 player game, lasting between 30-45 minutes. The game consists of mild strategy, and is suitable for players upwards of 8 years old. The game requires a smart device - the centrepiece of the board is a downloadable app, available from the Apple App Store or Google Play Store.

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Fantasy, Party Game, Prehistoric
mechanics: Lose a Turn, Move Through Deck, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Gran Chaco 1932/1935
description:
Gran Chaco 1932/1935 is a regimental scale Miniature wargame rules for the War of the Gran Chaco between Bolivia and Paraguay from 1932 to 1935.

For 15-28mm miniatures.

Gran Chaco 1932/1935 est une règle de jeu avec figurines pour la Guerre du Chaco (1932/1935) opposant la Bolivie au Paraguay.
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Zone of Control

name: Braves Bataillons: règle Second Empire
description:
Braves Bataillons: règle Second Empire is a Regimental scale Miniature wargame ruleset for the French Second Empire from the Crimean War to the Franco-Prussian War. In French

For 10-28mm miniatures.

Braves Bataillons: règle Second Empire
Règle de jeu avec figurines pour le Second Empire, de la Crimée à la Guerre de 70
categories: Book, Miniatures, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Turn Order: Random

name: Salo Espada Sagrada Juego de Mesa Mitos y Leyendas
description:
Board game adaptation of the entire classic Espada Sagrada set of Mitos y Leyendas (Myths and Legends CCG)

This limited edition game has all necessary accessories (playmats, coin, hourglass) to have a 2, 3 or 4 player game based on the 20 year old strategy collectible card game. This version has all 340 cards from the Espada Sagrada era.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mythology

name: Salo Dominios de Ra Juego de Mesa Mitos y Leyendas
description:
Board game adaptation of the entire classic Dominios de Ra set of Mitos y Leyendas (Myths and Legends CCG)

This limited edition game has all necessary accessories (playmats, coin, hourglass) to have a 2, 3 or 4 player game based on the 20 year old strategy collectible card game. This version has all 340 cards from the Dominios de Ra era.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mythology

name: Nur keine Aufregung
description:
Each player sets his 4 pawns on the starting spaces (1-4) of his color. Movement is determined by a die. On the roll of a 6 a pawn may be moved from a starting space. On spaces 1-9 pawns of the same color may not pass each other by.

On the red spaces pawns may be thrown out if a pawn of another color is arriving. Thrown out pawns are set on space 9 and the player has to pay 1 coin into the jackpot (2 coins if his pawn already stands on space 9). Pawns on yellow spaces are safe, but their player has to pay 1 coin to another player arriving with a pawn on the same space. Pawns of the same color may never stand on the same space, expect for space 9.

The first player to get his 4 pawns around the game board and back to spaces 1-4 wins the game and the jackpot.

—user summary
categories: Unspecified
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Reise nach Jerusalem
description:
Each player has an starting amount of 12 points and choses one of the available starting spaces. Movement is determined by a die.

If a player gets on a numbered space, he refers to the corresponding number near the border of the game board and follows the rules printed there. As a result he may lose or gain points.

If a player reaches an occupied space, he has to draw a trivia card About the history of Israel and answer the question printed there. If he answers correctly, he may advance 5 spaces. If he does'nt know the answer he has to go 10 spaces back and loses 10 points.

The first player to reach space 50 (Jerusalem) wins the game and is proclaimed major of Jerusalem. The player with the most points gets to be prime minister of Israel.

—user summary
categories: Educational, Religious, Travel, Trivia
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: King and Ace Cricket
description:
This is a two-player game with a standard 52 card deck where two players compete against each other in a simulated cricket match.

A coin flip decides who bats or bowls first and play begins by drawing six cards. The aim is to play a card that's higher than your opponents.

If the bowler's card is higher, a dot ball or a wicket happens. If the batter's card is higher, the batter scores that many runs or causes a wicket. Otherwise if tied, there is an automatic dot ball.

The innings ends after a predetermined amount of overs, or ten wickets, then the players change sides. Standard cricket scoring rules decide who wins. A standard cricket scoresheet can be used to score the game.

The card values are Ace to 4 scoring one run, 5 to 7 scoring two runs, 8 scoring three, 9 to 10 scoring a four, Jack and Queen scoring a six, and finally, a King being a wicket, no matter who plays it.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Sports
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Simulation, Turn Order: Pass Order

name: La Petite Mort: Goodie Bûcheron
description:
A goodie tile for La Petite Mort, picturing a very clumsy lumberjack.
This tile is a character card played as a basic game tile, with the Darwin Arward weakness, and zero soul point.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Murder/Mystery
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Simultaneous Action Selection, Storytelling

name: Das Katzenspiel
description:
Content: 36 picture cards, 2 dice

The picture cards have the shape of a sitting cat. On the back is a dice symbol with 1 to 6 die pips. The front shows one or more cats. Some cards show a bag or food or another motif.

At the begin of the game all cards are ordered by their dice symbol and each pile is shuffled. Then the players roll dice for to receive the top card of the corresponding pile until all cards are distributed. If a player rolls a die symbol, which does not have any cards left, they do not receive any card.

As soon all cards are distributed, the players turn their cards over. Each player needs a bag of food to feed their cats. If a player has no food they have to trade their card with the most cats with another player to receive a bag of food. The player with the cat king requires an additional bag of food. The player with the most cats wins the game. The cat king scores 7 points.
categories: Animals, Children's Game

name: Folclore
description:
Folclore is a Mexican party game consisting of fourteen different cards (3 cards each, with 3 different colors). Each card has been illustrated by a different Mexican artist.

Each player has a set of hand cards. At the start of a round, there is a market phase in which players can trade with others by calling out color offers or requests, trading one card against one other card. Trading happens simultaneously. When one player has either only cards of one color in their hand, or a set of all three cards of a kind (in all three different colors), they win the round. The winner can hand out two of the cards they used to win the round to two other players as challenge cards. The challenges are written on the card and can either require the receiver to perform an action immediately, or to continue playing the game while speaking in a certain way, or other such handicaps.
The winner of a round also claims tokens from the center of the table. When these run out, the game ends.
categories: Card Game, Party Game

name: Broken: The Card Game
description:
Broken is a card game for 1-5 players. In the game you slip into the role of a publisher who sells board games on Kickstarter, and if possible does not deliver them. The golden rule is: having money comes from keeping money. So you play your cards in a way that buy the most profitable games possible and do not have to produce them. But be careful, because the other players have the same goal.

During the game, players take turns to play an excuse card that matches the card that is on top of the discard pile. The closer their card matches, the more money they get. Players can play sets of the same excuse to get greater rewards.
categories: Card Game, Humor

name: Kruiswoordspel
description:
Kruiswoordspel is a game for "2 or more" players in which words are formed from 13 dice with letters on them. The slogan in English is "Fun With Letters". On each player's turn, they roll the dice using the provided cup, and try to form as many interconnected words as possible from the top-facing letters, before the provided sand timer runs out (approximately 4 minutes). Point values of the used letters are added up (double-counting any that are used in two words), and the values of any unused letters are subtracted. Any disputed words are settled by the player who went first, the "leader" - either by looking it up in a dictionary of his/her choice, or "deciding himself" whether to accept the word. After a "prearranged number of rounds", the player with the highest total score is the winner.

Differences from the more-well-known Scrabble Crossword Cubes game include:

13 dice rather than 14
different combinations of letters on them (e.g. all dice have a mixture of vowels and consonants on them, vs most of the vowels being together on four dice that have no consonants)
different points values (e.g. F=3 vs 4, H=2 vs 4, K=4 vs 5, V=3 vs 4, X=6 vs 8)
dispute resolution is not necessarily based on a standard dictionary
types of words to be excluded are not specified
Scrabble Crossword Cubes includes a second set of rules in which words of specific lengths must be spelled


—user summary
categories: Dice, Word Game

name: Riding to the Sea
description:
Holding his head up for a flag of all the free, Love-light of Spain—hurrah! Death-light of Africa! Don Juan of Austria iIs riding to the sea!

Riding to the Sea is an operational set of campaign rules for Cannon, Cross and Crescent fast play Renaissance naval rules.

The rules use an area movement system and an abstracted “Strength Point" system to represent port garrisons and troops engaged in amphibious operations; this can be replaced with troop stands for use with Renaissance land rules.

An example campaign setting based on the Aegean Sea is also included.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Pike and Shot, Renaissance, Wargame

name: トラピジスタ (Trapezista)
description:
The trick-taking game トラピジスタ (Trapezista) was one of the finalists in the 2017 Trick Taking Party design competition in Japan.

In the game, players take on the role of trapeze artists and try not to fall or drop the other players. The game uses a subset of a standard deck of playing cards, including two jokers, and a board. The game is a standard "must follow" trick taking game, that incentivizes which players you win tricks before and after.

After four rounds, the player with the most points wins.

—user summary
categories: Card Game

name: Záhadné Případy
description:
Is the killer really a gardener again? Did Filip Mazaný rob Mrs. Sad or was it Lukáš Lapka?

Will you solve these mysterious cases together with Inspector Čmuchal? Mainly pay attention to details, they often tell you!
The game contains 54 cases including their solution and rules in the Czech language.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Do you like to solve various puzzles, quizzes and mysteries? Brain game - Mysterious cases perfectly practice your brain threads! Make sure you are smart enough to outsmart your opponents. But beware - it's not as easy a task as it may seem. The mysteries of this fun game are so rolled out that they really can't sleep!
The aim of the game is to correctly solve the intricate mysterious cases, whose text is written on the cards. If the answer is correct, the player keeps this card, otherwise he returns it. The player who first solves five puzzles correctly, thus collecting five cards, wins and can enjoy the deserved victory. The game develops logical thinking and patience and is suitable for children from the age of ten.

—user summary

Je vrahem opravdu opět zahradník? Okradl Filip Mazaný paní Smutnou nebo to byl Lukáš Lapka?

Vyřešíte společně s inspektorem Čmuchalem tyto záhadné případy? Hlavně si všímejte detailů, ty vám mnohdy napoví!
Hra obsahuje 54 případů včetně jejich řešení a pravidla v českém jazyce.

—description from the publisher
categories: Deduction

name: Choirs Are Horrible
description:
Because as awesome as choir is, it's also kind of horrible.

Bass notes you can only hit during allergy season. Illegal photocopies of music. Singing with so much phlegm your throat is like a flute filled with gravy. Celebrate all the things that make choir special in this hilarious and snarky card game for die-hard choir geeks! Designed to be high school appropriate, your students will stay in the choir room to play this game, instead of doing drugs. It's that good, and you might save a life.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Humor, Music, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Orchestras Are Awful
description:
Dead strings. Bridge collapse. Suzuki Book 3. Not enough rosin. There are so many orchestral annoyances that make this otherwise awesome activity absolutely awful. But it's okay, because now you can vent about them all with your friends, and then get back to playing Nimrod or Hoedown whatever your favorite piece is at the moment. Play Orchestras Are Awful, the newest card game from Truly Horrible Things. It's much cheaper than therapy.
​
This game was written by violinists, primarily, so you immediately know two things: their goal was perfection, and they are certain they achieved it. It is meant to be enjoyed by high school orchestra students, but will be enjoyed even more by their directors. Get a few sets to keep the kids occupied when they are hanging out in the orchestra room before school. You've got stuff to do.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Humor, Music, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Theatre Is Tragic
description:
Ok theater kids...we heard you. A smelly costume. Unblended make up. Being tricked into naming the Scottish play. So many things about the thing we love are terrible things. So hey, why not play cards?


396 cards
high school appropriate
Ages 14+
Perfect for classrooms, cast parties, tech rehearsals, and any time you should be working on lines.


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Trivial Pursuit: The Shakespeare Edition
description:
Exclusively produced for The Shakespeare Birthplace Trust, this exciting new edition has 600 questions based on the life and the works of William Shakespeare.

This handy game requires no board, can be played on the go, as a card game, carried in its bite-size wedge case or can be added to your existing Trivial Pursuit board game, with its own spare wedge holder.

Test your trivia with the following topics: Comedies, Histories, Tragedies, Characters, Biography and Legacy.
categories: Trivia

name: Secret Hunters
description:
Mega City a Moloch of a city was flashy, loud and dirty. Life was hard and survival was complicated. If you knew the right people in Mega City it was easier. If you did what you were told, it was also easy. But the easiest way was to simply not stand out, become invisible, merge with the haze of the city and stay out of everything. What do I care? That’s the way it is. Many of the young people didn't mind, they were just interested in having fun, being cool and being able to do what they wanted to do. Why should one then interfere with the stress that the old people made for themselves. Until, yes, until you faced reality, staring at you brutally and cruelly, punching you in the face, breaking your bones or snuffing out your lights.
That reality was a man whom everybody only referred to as ”The Baron”, the crime lord who controlled everything in Mega City. His army of henchmen was everywhere and enforced his will with unlimited brutality and cruelty.
In Secret Hunters, each player leads a group of young people who have formed a gang with the goal of overthrowing The Baron. They all share the fate of having been brutally abused by The Baron and his henchmen. To achieve their goal are not choosy with their methods. They hack terminals, crack safes, bribe the followers of the mystery man, but they would never use weapons. Each gang consists of 4 specialists. A hacker, a safecracker, a spy and a biker. Using the action board and 4 action tokens, the characters are guided through Mega City, but, The Baron does not just watch as his weaknesses uncovered, his henchmen strike mercilessly. Four pieces of evidence need to be found and presented to the court in order to take out The Baron, but to find out which four pieces of evidence they are, the players need to collect clues they get from informants, as to where relevant safes and terminals are located which may contain possible evidence. The gang which has collected all four pieces of evidence and manages to take them to court wins the game and is referred to by the others as the real Secret Hunters.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Science Fiction, Spies/Secret Agents

name: Air Combat: Rules for Wargames
description: Air Combat are rules for miniature wargames.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Rules for Wargames: The American Civil War
description: Miniature wargame rules
categories: American Civil War, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Rules for Wargames: World War II – Infantry Combat
description: Miniature wargame rules
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Rules for Wargames: The Colonial Wars
description: Miniature Wargame Rules
categories: Book, Miniatures, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Western: Battles in the Old West 1830-85
description:
Western rules that cover the battles of the Old West.

These replace the 1992 Hey you in the Jail set. We usually update rules after about 10 years.
These rules are designed for games wherein the figures operate in groups. They are not a skirmish set .

WESTERN is an historical game (the word "faction" is not used)
There are ten force options (Mexicans, Plains Indians, townsfolk, posse, Gunmen, army, workers, cattlemen....).

A typical force in 15mm would use 100 figures (about 50 in 25mm) put into 5 groups.
5 x 3 table.
All mechanisms uses the table grid (6 inch squares for 15mm, 8" for 25mm etc).

The rules will use the usual wire bound "lay flat" PP style.
The signature PP grid system is also used. Western is full of new ideas and elegant processes.

As usual the play sheets and battle sheet swill be "down loadable" free of charge on the PP website.
categories: American Indian Wars, American West, Book, Miniatures, Wargame

name: PBI: Company Commander Edition – A Game of WW2 Company Combat
description:
PBI (Poor Bloody Infantry) is a Miniatures wargame ruleset for WW2 company level gaming.

For 10 to 25 mm miniatures.

PBI is designed to allow fast playing games that finish in a couple of hours.

PBI uses a terrain map made from grid squares (6") so no measuring is needed.

It is a complete game system, including:

scenario generator,
points,
victory schedule.


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Cruel Seas: Campaign Pack
description: Originally part of Warlord Games D-Day 75th Anniversary Campaign, these Cruel Seas scenarios allow you to re-enact, or repel, the D-Day landings and battle across the channel for naval supremacy.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Trivial Pursuit: National Edition (UK)
description:
Part of the Parker Travel series.

A twp person (or team) travel version of Trivial Pursuit. The carrying case splits into tow halves, each containing 50 trivia cards, and an affixed scoring piece to hold eared wedges. It also includes a die with 6 colors on it, to randomly determine which question is next asked.

The categories are: Blue- Tourist Traps, Pink- Historical Heritage, Yellow- Arts & Crafts, Brown- Out & About, Green- The Rat Race, and Orange- Sports & Fitness.
categories: Trivia

name: Trivial Pursuit: Games and Leisure Edition
description:
Part of the Parker Travel series.

A twp person (or team) travel version of Trivial Pursuit. The carrying case splits into tow halves, each containing 50 trivia cards, and an affixed scoring piece to hold eared wedges. It also includes a die with 6 colors on it, to randomly determine which question is next asked.

The categories are: Blue- Music, Music, Music, Pink- Down the Pub, Yellow- Home Entertainment, Brown- Sports & Fitness, Green- Lazing, and Orange- Pay to Enjoy.
categories: Trivia

name: ノーティス (Notice)
description:
The trick-taking game ノーティス (Notice) was originally part of the 2014 Trick Taking Party, and later rule revisions occurred in 2015 and 2018.

The game follows the usual "must follow" trick-taking rules, with a random determination of trump. Players earn points from predicting how many tricks two hands will win. Players are dealt one hand, record in secret how many tricks they expect the hand to win, and then pass that hand to another player. (The specific player the hand is passed to depends upon the round number and player count.) Players then record how many tricks they expect the new hand they've received will win. This second hand is the hand the player will play the round with.

The game occurs over a number of rounds, and players receive points for each trick won and the accuracy of their bids.

—user summary
categories: Card Game

name: Play the Franco-Prussian War 1870-1871
description:
Project made possible by the great and beautiful collection of Gianpaolo Bistulfi, who in many years of modelling career has personally painted thousands of toy soldiers.
Now these soldiers will be at your disposal to obtain, with little effort, entire armies of battalions of infantry, squadrons of cavalry, batteries of cannons, houses and buildings, trees and much more material needed to create the scenes of your battle.
We also explain tricks and modes for a good assembly of the pieces, as well as the official rules for playing wargame. All in 50 pages full of hundreds of soldiers supplied in the standard scale of 25/28mm that you can, for personal use only, photocopy on thicker cardboard and thus get armed with the desired size.

So what are you waiting for?

Wear the general commander’s shoulder pads, equip yourself with a capable table, a practical ruler to measure, a pair of dice and get ready to lead hundreds or thousands of armed in epic and exciting battles of history!

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Delvers of the Forgotten Forest
description:
Delvers of the Forgotten Forest is a medium weight dice-as-workers game that mixes push your luck with light euro elements. In this game, you will be hiring dice (called delvers) to venture into the forgotten forest and return with knowledge and artifacts. Beware though, the deeper into the forest you go, the more you will be exposed to the corruptions of the forest, and the harder it will be to retrieve your delvers. As more and more delvers enter, the monsters of the forest will awaken to hinder the players. The player who has acquired the most knowledge by the end of the game wins.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Dice, Fantasy
mechanics: Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Fight Fight
description:
Players fight each others characters with spells, treasures, magical items and heavy weapons/armor in this fun and fast (30 min) drafting game for 2-4 players.

Fight Fight is a battle drafting game where players control two characters in front of them. At the end of every round, each of your characters will fight their neighboring opponents character to your left and right.

Each round you will draft one card from the pile passed to you, then all players will simultaneously play one of three total cards in hand and then the cards played will resolve...


Draft Spells to mess with your opponents or give yourself advantages!
Draft Treasure cards to out wit your adversaries and take the ever growing treasure pool in the center of the table!
Draft End Game Scoring cards to maximize your strategies during the game!
Most importantly, draft Magical Items and Heavy Weapons and Armor because at the end of every round, your characters each have to Fight Fight!


—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Card Game, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Take That

name: Junk Driver
description:
Junk Driver is a demolition derby racing game for 2-5 players that takes 45-60 minutes to play. First you draft cards from a selection of engines, weapons, and rocket boosters. Then you race around a track and the first to complete three laps, or the last one standing, wins.

It is set in the far future where racers from all quadrants of the galaxy come together to compete in this annual event. Tiny fairies, demon worshipers, and muscle car enthusiasts all come together to smash together parts from different manufacturers to make something resembling a car.

Gameplay involves everyone zooming around the track taking actions to shift lanes, do drifts, and fire the wide array of weaponry available to them. The game also uses an energy system where actions can be super-charged through a resource gained at the start of the race.

—description from the designer
categories: Fighting, Racing, Science Fiction

name: Suns of Chronos
description:
You and your people emerge from a glistening fog into a sprawling world much like your own, yet...fabricated? At your backs lie the unending silver dunes you came from. To the east and west stand massive walls that could only be the work of an intelligence much greater than your own. And crackling over the horizon is a massive storm that pulses with an otherworldly glow. Your resources are low, time is short...and you are not alone.

In Suns of Chronos, control one of four races and explore a world full of strange lifeforms and mysterious artifacts. Manage your people and your time wisely, between exploiting the wonders of Chronos - such as the time-defying "sunstones" - and thwarting those who get in your way. Be wary, however. Besides your rivals, Chronos contains entities of its own that will challenge not only your people, but the very fabric of time upon which you depend.

On the machine world of Chronos, those who carry out the will of their people best will go on to see a new universe. The rest will be lost to the sands of time.

—description from the publisher
categories: Civilization, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Steam Wars
description:
Built lean, strong, powerful and simple, yet packed with enough Steampunk imagination to get any heart beating like clockwork, Steam Wars is the card game that War was meant to be. Play whole hands of aether-powered heat ray artillery units with support against your foe’s pitiful legions of fusiliers armed with pneumatic cannons, then watch them burn under the force of your might. Clutch your cards in fear as your enemy reveals a hand of steam-mortar emplacements, then bombards your heat-ray artillery into oblivion. Wield a mixed force, sacrifice the weak to distract your enemy, then power on to victory, and all this in about a half an hour! With Steam Wars, you’ll have to use strategy and cunning to overwhelm your foes, forcing them to run through cards until they clutch the last one and sit gibbering as you crush them.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Science Fiction

name: Sea Wars
description: Sea Wars: Light wargame intended for the age ranges of 10 and older.
categories: Book, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Histories of War: Empire & Hordes – Western Europe 50 BC - 500 AD
description:
Histories Of War is a series of historical wargames rules designed to allow players to recreate battles of the period using miniature soldiers or counters on a scenic battlefield.
The system puts the player in the role of a general of large armies and the rules are designed to represent the action occurring simultaneously.

Empire & Hordes pits the army of the Roman Empire against the Barbarian Hordes in central Europe between 50 BC and 500 AD.

Can you re-write the histories of war?

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Book, Miniatures, Wargame

name: In Country: Grand Tactical Combat In the Vietnam War
description:
In Country is a Table-top game designed to bring fast and decisive Vietnam War combat from the company level up to the battalion, if desired.

With these rules, players will be able to simulate the small skirmishes, reconnaissance missions, and large scale battles that made up one of the longest wars in American history.

Includes:

Unit Statistics Charts,
Campaign Considerations,
Painting guide with simple steps to help get new painters started,
Scenario section with 3 scenarios


For 6 to 15 mm miniatures

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Vietnam War, Wargame
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Surface Fire: Naval Combat in World War Two
description:
Surface Fire - Naval Combat in World War 2 is a table-top game designed to simulate the naval engagements that took place all around the globe during World War 2 (from 1939-1945).

The rules have been structured to enable new gamers to readily understand and enjoy playing the game.

Designed for 1/2400th scale ships and planes
1 mini = 1 ship
1 planes base = 1 squadron
1 turn = 10 min

These rules include:

Naval Data sheets,
Templates,
100+ markers


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Nautical, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: Ashigaru: Samurai Combat in the Age of the Country at War
description:
Ashigaru is a table-top game designed to replicate the samurai combat that took place during the time of the Sengoku Jidai (Age of the Country at War) through the Tokugawa period of Japan (1500-1650).
With these rules, players will be able to simulate the skirmishes that made up the longest period of internal conflict in Japan’s history.

Includes:

Statistics for 26 weapons,
80 Wounded markers,
a Painting guide with simple


steps to help get new painters started,

Scenario section with 4 scenarios.


Designed for 15-25mm miniatures

Scale:
1 turn = 1'
1" = 5 m (15mm)

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: High Noon: Cowboy Skirmish Combat in the American Old West
description:
High Noon is a fast-paced skirmish game intended to replicate the gun fights, duels, and showdowns that took place in the American Old West from roughly 1840 to 1900.

These rules are intended for 25mm or 28mm figures.

This rules set contains:

character sheets,
scenarios,
80+ markers and templates,
quick play sheets, and
guns statistics for 30 weapons.
categories: American West, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Pirates
description:
Pirates is the exciting game of beer drinking and treasure hunting you can play with your whole family.

Dodge aliens, British, tigers, and the mighty Sasquatch in the quest to be the best.

But watch out, because Black Beard the pirate will be out for blood!

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Fantasy, Miniatures, Pirates, Wargame

name: Boney the Dinosaur
description:
Boney the Dinosaur is the exciting table top game of beer drinking and paleontology you can play with the whole family. Out wit rattlesnakes, police, angry natives, and the mighty Sasquatch in the quest to be the best.

But watch out, because Boney will be out for revenge!

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Animals, Book, Exploration, Miniatures

name: Jowls
description:
JOWLS is the exciting table top game of scuba diving and beer that you can play with your whole family.

Swim through red algae, seaweed, and dodge moray eels and the mighty Sasquatch in the quest to be the best.

But watch out, because JOWLS is always hungry!

—description from the publisher

38 page rulebook includes 52 random Event Cards
categories: Adventure, Animals, Book, Miniatures, Nautical

name: Spelling Bees
description:
Spelling Bees is a lasercut literacy game for the family. Each player is a bee that follows invisible paths along flower petals to collect letters and turn them into words.

The game comes with 19 hexagonal flower tiles, each with six letters. The tiles rotate and can be moved, allowing words to be formed from adjacent, contiguous letters.

The board comes with a built-in scoring tracks for six bees (players).

Can be played solitaire.

Can be played in any Roman-based language: English, French, Spanish, Italian, Portuguese.

—description from the publisher
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Word Game

name: Art of Command: Rules for Wargaming Large Scale Napoleonic Battles
description:
The Liphook Historical Wargames Group was formed in 2000 to refight Napoleon’s major battles during their 200th anniversary year. During the last 16 years the group has successfully fought over 38 battles, which have included Wagram, Salamanca, Borodino, Leipzig and Waterloo, using its own, home-grown set of specially designed rules.

Art of Command evolved from the group’s desire to refight big, multiplayer battles. The set aim was to simulate the confusion and impact the chain of command has on such major engagements through the interaction of players representing the various commanders from brigade through divisions and corps to army level. The objective is to replicate the historical ebb and flow of battle at battalion, squadron and battery level, refight them over an accurately contoured, scaled model and complete them in a day.

The group initially tested existing, commercial rule sets but felt that these were designed for small table engagements lasting a couple of hours or larger games with brigades being the smallest units represented. It was concluded that we needed rules that would encompass command, communications and control functions. Rules that would enable us to coordinate and accommodate a large group of commanders refighting battles the size of Waterloo, but still represent battalions and squadrons on the wargame table. We believe Art of Command fulfills this need and the fact that the group successfully completed almost all the battles in a day is a testament to the robust nature of the rules and the thorough testing which has taken place.

We recommend Art of Command to those wargamers who wish to simulate a major Napoleonic, multiplayer battle in a day. We hope that you find their simplicity and resultant speed of play beneficial in recreating your own big battles and, above all, recreate the fun and excitement of a hobby that we all enjoy.

Scale:
1 fig (inf.-cav.) = 50/60 men
1 gun = 1 gun
Ground Scale: 1/1000 for 25/28 mm (half for 15mm)
each Game Period: 10-15 min real time

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Deer Lord!: Emotional Rollercoaster Flirty & Mean
description:
Expansion to Deer Lord! a party card game with duels and bizarre 'things' for you to 'do' without being exposed by the other players.

Set them up just to knock them down! Showers of compliments and meaningful glances with flirty, torrents of insults and ego bruisers with mean. Prepare to have a lot of mixed feelings.

This dual expansion is quite naughty, so play with friends who can stand mind games... Not suitable for minors.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Spiel mit Früchten
description:
All fruits are put on the plate in middle of the table. The players spin the arrow and take the indicated number of fruits from the plate.

When all fruits are taken, the arrow is spinned again. The player who has the most pieces of the indicated fruit wins the game.

—user summary
categories: Children's Game

name: Combat Action Command: WWII Miniatures Rules
description:
Combat Action Command simulates a platoon, several platoons, or a force as large as a company battling another platoon or company.
CAC is more of a simulation than a game.
CAC was created as a tool for gamers, historians and the military to simulate and study small unit combat -- and to have fun.

Command a platoon up to a company
Geared for 15mm, but can use 10mm, 12mm, and 20mm figures -- no rebasing
Each Team stand equals one troop squad or single tank, vehicle, or gun
Asymmetric turn sequence with CAC interrupt allows you to size up the situation, seize initiative, and coordinate small unit tactics
Clever Data Cards for each unique Team account for training, morale, experience, and weaponry -- you spend more time commanding, not counting
Includes 24 Data cards covering major US, German, and Soviet units, plus artillery, aircraft, AA, snipers, HQs, mortars, and speciality weapons like Molotov cocktails and balanced scenarios
Points system for tournaments and balanced scenarios
Two 1944 scenarios included:
Saving Private Ryland (West Front) and
Saving Field Marshall Model (East Front)

Requires six-sided dice, twenty-sided dice, a scatter die, and a ruler
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: For Queen and Planet: Supplemental Rules – The Martian Punitive Expedition 1901
description:
A planet to be conquered, vengeance to be wreaked and glory to be won. That is the motivation of the commander of the Martian Punitive Expedition of 1901.

With these rules, you can take the role of the British commander tasked by the Queen with taking the fight to the Cephalopod invaders of Earth. You have been given three Ether flyers and the best soldiers the British Empire could muster and you are headed to Mars to do the Queen’s bidding.

Q&P is designed to balance the mass and ferocity of the local races of Mars against the technology and training of the Colonial powers and to provide a fair and reasonable struggle for both imperial General and Martian Odwar.

This rule set does include the following:

All rules necessary to play a VSF version of the game.
An alternative timeline for VSF genre play.
Unit lists detailing British, Imperial Red Martian, Black Martian, Green Martian and Cephalopod forces.
A eight-scenario campaign that will allow you to play your way through the British Punitive Expedition to Mars in 1901 from the initial encounters with Red Martian Miltia forces all the way through to the final destruction of the British forces on Mars.
A blank unit command sheet.


CAMPAIGN SCENARIOS:
Each of the scenarios in this rulebook is written to be fought as a pure VSF battle. The theme for this scenario book is fairly light-hearted and many of the scenarios are spun out from scenes from movies, that you will likely recognize. So enjoy and have fun.

The Martian Punitive Expedition Scenarios:

Hit the Red Shores – Dec 21, 1901 British vs. Red Askari (local Imperial militia)
Low Plains Drifters – Apr 12, 1902 – Green Martians with British allies vs. Imperial Martians
A Canal Too Far – Jun 4, 1902 - British vs. Imperial Martians
The Imperials Strike Back – Oct 3, 1902 – Imperial Martians vs. British
Imperial Indigestion – Nov 1, 1902 – British/Imperials vs. Black Martians/Cephalopods
It Ain’t Easy Being Green – Mar 15, 1903 – British/Imperials vs. Green Martians/Cephalopods
The Martian Candidate – Jul 17, 1903 – British/Imperials vs. Black/Green Martians
The Last Days of HMS Astra - Dec 19, 1903 - British vs. Imperials


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Post-Napoleonic, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: For Queen and Planet: Supplemental Rules – Campaign Theme: The Boxer Rebellion 1900
description:
An ancient nation, a powerful military and thousands of fanatical anti-foreign Boxers are arrayed against a handful of troops from eight nations. The foreign legations are under siege and foreigners are being murdered.

You have no choice, but to take the forces at hand, face the overwhelming enemy on the field of battle and either prevail or be annihilated.

For Queen and Planet is a fast-play battalion level colonial and VSF rule set. This supplement recreates many of the most famous and less known battles of the Boxer Rebellion. For example, early in the rebellion the Qing Chinese tried to snuff out the rebellion, there were major and epic battles in Manchuria between the Russians and the Qing.

While the focus of this suplement is the Seymour and Gaslee Expeditions, this supplement opens the door wider to shine a light on other players in the conflict (including one VSF scenario that postulates the Emperor Dowager has called on the 'Martians' of The War of the Worlds fame for assistance}.

The Boxer Rebellion Scenarios:

Imperial Disfavor – May 14, 1900 – Qing vs. Boxer
A Failed Advance – June 18, 1900 - Seymour Expedition vs. Kansu Braves/Boxer
The Relief at Hsi-Ku Armory – June 25, 1900 – Seymour Expedition vs. Qing/Boxer
The Battle of Daku (Taku) Forts– June 17–18, 1900 - Allies vs. Qing
The Battle of Tientsin– July 13-14, 1900 – Eight Nations vs. Qing/Boxers
The Battles of Pei-Tsang and Yangtsun – August 5-6, 1900 – Eight Nations vs. Qing/Boxer
In Pursuit of Foreign Devils (VSF) – June 28, 1900 – Eight Nation vs. Qing/Boxer/Cephalopod
Battles Along the Amur – June 28, 1900 – Qing vs. Russians


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Post-Napoleonic, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Champions Coliseum
description:
After slumbering for 1000 years, the great wizard Magnus awoke to a shattered world. What was once a single, connected world had become four distinct continents. With the aim of finding heroes with the ability to connect the world once again, Magnus departed towards the ice continent Frirna by airship. It was only then that he learned of an invisible force referred to as the Corruption that had turned some of the world’s greatest heroes against one another…

Champions Coliseum is a 2-4 player competitive card game where you select a party of characters and fight until only one party remains. With 24 characters, 20 unique items, and 15 events, every match is a completely new experience!

Players begin by selecting characters for their party in a draft pick setting. Once the game begins, players take turns by using actions with a character. The game progresses until only one player has characters remaining alive.

Champions Coliseum’s strategy comes through masterful use of elemental abilities, positioning, items, and events. Elemental abilities deal double damage to opposing elements—however, this means that each element’s weakest target is also its biggest threat. Characters placed in the back row cannot be attacked until the character in front of them is defeated, meaning that weaker characters are often placed in the back. Items and events are dealt randomly each round, adding a hint of chance to the strategic gameplay.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Black Seas: Royal Navy 3rd Rates of Renown
description:
This box set outfits you with three Royal Navy Third-Rate-Ships-of-the-line. Building upon the superb third rate plastic sprues, the box contains additional metal components to make the following famous vessels, all of which were present at the Battle of Trafalgar!

HMS Bellerophon - This 74 gun third rate has a long and storied history, serving during the French Revolutionary and Napoleonic Wars. Whilst most of this time was spent on blockades or convoy escort duties, she distinguished herself in three fleet actions: The Glorious First of June, the Battle of the Nile, and the Battle of Trafalgar. At Trafalgar, she fought an embittered battle against both Spanish and French ships and suffered heavy losses including the death of her Captain, John Cooke.

After Trafalgar, she resumed blockade duties around France, as well as performing more escort duties in North America between 1813 and 1814. Assigned to blockade Rochefort in 1815, HMS Bellepheron was the vessel on which Napoleon came aboard to officially surrender to the British following his defeat at Waterloo (finding his escape to America blocked).

HMS Revenge - Launched on 13 April 1805, HMS Revenge was a 74-gun third rate. She was one of a larger class of 74s with 24-pounder guns on the upper deck rather than the more common 18-pounders.

Newly commissioned, and under the command of Captain Robert Moorsom, she served at the Battle of Trafalgar in Admiral Collingwood's column. She would continue to serve until 1842.

HMS Tonnant - An 80-gun third-rate of the Royal Navy, she was originally the lead ship of the French Tonnant class captured by the British at the Siege of Toulon (August 1793), recaptured by the French at the break of the Siege (December 1793) and subsequently recaptured by Horatio Nelson's fleet at Aboukir Bay during the Battle of the Nile (1 August 1798). She would go on to fight at the Battle of Trafalgar against the French.

Tonnant was the flagship of Vice-Admiral Sir Alexander Cochrane over the majority of the Chesapeake Bay campaigns as part of the War of 1812. Of particular note, Francis Scott Key dined aboard the Tonnant as part of a prisoner release negotiation. As a result of their inferred knowledge of the forthcoming attack on Baltimore at Fort McHenry. As a result, he and his fellows were not allowed to return until after the attack. It was in witnessing the bombardment of Fort McHenry that Key wrote the poem 'Defence of Fort M'Henry' later to become "The Star Spangled Banner".

—description from publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Nautical, Wargame

name: Black Seas: French Navy 3rd Rates of Renown
description:
This box set outfits you with three French Navy Third-Rate-Ships-of-the-line. Building upon the superb third rate plastic sprues, the box contains additional metal components to make the following famous vessels, all of which were present at the Battle of Trafalgar!

Indomptable- A Tonnant-class 80-gun ship of the line, Indomptable was laid down in 1788 and saw active service from 1791. In her first engagement at The Glorious First of June she lost her mast and had to be towed back to Brest.

Under the command of Admirable Villeneuve she went to sea as part of a large fleet bound for the West Indies, but returned for Europe upon news that Nelson had arrived there. In the Battle of Cape Finisterre, a violent artillery exchange was halted by thick fog, an exhausted French fleet thus anchored in Ferrol before sailing on to Cadiz. Admiral Villeneuve, with his command under threat, vowed to meet the British at the Cape of Trafalgar.

At Trafalgar, Indomptable was part of the Spanish line, engaging Vice Admiral Collingwood's flagship HMS Royal Sovereign, as well as HMS Belleisle, HMS Revenge, HMS Dreadnought and HMS Thunderer. Drifting downwind, and out of range, she turned back towards Cadiz but got caught in a rescue operation for Bucentaure which had struck a reef. The following night, Indomptable was caught in a storm and carried onto rocks offshore from Cadiz. Only 150 (of between 100 and 1400 men) are estimated to have survived the wreck.

Formidable- an 80-gun Tonnant-class ship of the line of the French Navy, she was briefly named Figuieres, but this was restored to Formidable prior to her launch at Toulon on 31 May 1795. She participated in the Battle of Algeciras, the Battle of Cape Finisterre and the Battle of Trafalgar - in which she served as the flagship of Rear-Admiral Pierre Dumanoir le Pelley in the six-ship vanguard of the French fleet.

She was captured by the British at the Battle of Cape Ortegal on 4 November 1805. Renamed HMS Brave whilst in service of the Royal Navy, she was eventually sold to be broken up in 1816.

Argonaute- a 74-gun ship of the line of the French Navy. Under Vice-amiral Villaret de Joyeuse, she took part in the expedition to Saint-Domingue in 1802. She took part in the Battle of Trafalgar but managed to return to Cadiz. She could not leave port due to heavy damage and the British blockade, she was eventually exchanged for the Spanish ship Vencedor in December 1806. At this point, she was renamed Argonauta, but was never recommissioned.

—description from publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Nautical, Wargame

name: Black Seas: Spanish Navy 3rd Rates of Renown
description:
This box set outfits you with three Spanish Navy Third-Rate-Ships-of-the-line. Building upon the superb third rate plastic sprues, the box contains additional metal components to make the following famous vessels, all of which were present at the Battle of Trafalgar!

Monarca - a 74-gun third rate ship of the line belonging to the Montañés-class. Her main guns were arranged over two complete decks, with 28 24-pounder cannons on her lower deck and 30 18-pounders on the upper, in addition to 12 8-pounders and 4 8-pounders on her quarterdeck and forecastle respectively.

Under the command of Captain Teodoro Argumosa, she took part in the Battle of Trafalgar, in which she suffered heavy damage at the hands of HMS Bellerophon. 55 Royal Marines boarded and captured her, but one night later the survivors overpowered their captors and set them adrift in the storm. 3 days after the battle, the survivors had decided to attempt repairs to return to Cadiz but were pursued by HMS Leviathan (which had picked up the adrift marines). She ran aground on 28 October near Huelva and was destroyed by HMS Naiad to prevent her restoration.

Argonauta - an 80-gun third rate ship of the line, she was the last of the Montañés-class of ships (of which there were four). On 25 August 1800, she fought off the British Ferrol expedition as part of Joaquin Moreno's squadron.

Subsequently, she fought at the Battle of Cape Finisterre, and as part of Federico Gravina's second squadron at Trafalgar. Captured at the latter battle, she was taken in tow by HMS Poyphemus, but was abandoned due to the storm which followed the battle On 24 October HMS Defiance rescued survivors and attempted to re-establish a tow unsuccessfully. The Argonauta sank 6 days later, its survivors landing at Algeciras the next day.

San Justo - a 74-gun ship of the line, San Justo was launched 11 November 1779. She participated in such actions as the Battle of Cape St Vincent, and the Siege of Gibraltar. She later participated in the battle of Trafalgar, managing to escape destruction. She was eventually broken up at Cartagena in 1828.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Nautical, Wargame

name: Black Seas: USS Essex
description:
The USS Essex was a 36-gun frigate that participated in the Quasi-War with France, the First Barbary War, and the War of 1812. She was very successful in disrupting British whaling in the Pacific, before being captured in 1814, and re-purposed as the HMS Essex under the Royal Navy.

Launched on 30 September 1799, she was armed with short ranged carronades that could not hope to match the range of 18 or 24 pounder naval guns. The US Navy accepted her nevertheless and under the captaincy of Edward Preble, holding the distinction of being the first US Naval ship to cross the Equator in early 1800.

The first Barbary War saw duties shift to the Mediterranean, with blockading and convoy escort duties at Gibraltar as well as participating in the Battle of Deme (27 April 1805).

After the declaration of the War of 1812, USS Essex achieved major success in disrupting British whaling activities in the Pacific under the command of Captain David Porter. From February 1813, over the course of a year, Porter successfully captured 12 British Whalers, and 360 prisoners, whilst sailing around Cape Horn and cruising the Pacific.

However, On 28 March 1814 at the battle of Valparaiso, Porter was forced to surrender to the frigate HMS Phoebe and the sloop-of-war HMS Cherub when Essex became too disabled to offer any resistance. Of the 12 ships Porter had captured, only one returned to the United States; seven returned to British control, three were sunk, and the Chilean.

As HMS Essex, she was reclassed as a 42-gun ship, serving as a troopship in 1819, and hulked in 1823 to serve as a prison ship in Cork initially, and Kingstown from 1824 until 1834.

When used as part of a US Navy fleet in Black Seas, the special rules pay tribute to its successful run in capturing whaling vessels. When making boarding actions with the USS Essex, the benefits from a +2 modifier.

—description from publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Nautical, Wargame

name: Chef de Char: Campagnes d'Afrique et d'Europe
description:
Chef de Char is a beer and pretzel ruleset to simulate tank combats.
Each player represents a tank leader and gives orders to his crew, those are then executed.
For 10 to 28 mm minis
5-12 vehicles per side.
