This version add corrections to v1 as well as additions for the War in North Africa
—description from the publisher (translated

Chef de Char est une règle rapide de combats entres blindés, simple à appréhender. La règle s'adresse autant aux joueurs confirmés qu'aux novices. Chaque joueur incarne, au moment où il active un de ses blindés, le chef du char actif. Il donne à son équipage des ordres qui sont ensuite exécutés. Une partie est jouable en 45 minutes par deux à quatre joueurs.
La règle couvre les théâtres d'opérations d'Afrique du nord (1940/1943) et d'Europe (à partir de 43).
La règle décrit le profil des principaux chars utilisés sur ces théâtres d’opérations par les nations suivantes, France, Italie, Allemagne, Angleterre, USA, Russie.
—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Turn Order: Random

name: Wir fahren U-Bahn
description:
The players have to get their trains (colored discs) from one end of a train line to the other. Movement is determined by a die. If a train gets on a cross section it has to change lines and the player has to try to get back to his original line.

The first player to get to the end of his line wins the game.

—user summary
categories: Trains
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Balyna Baseball
description:
A very rare and unusual game within the Balyna series of 1950s sports games. The main games were football and cricket however Balyna also produced baseball, tennis and golf games too.
Played on a roll out pitch with small plastic figures, a metal ball rolling chute and a metal batting gantry.
The highlight of the game is the superb marked out baseball diamond pitch.

—user summary
categories: Sports

name: Choirs Are Horrible: Choir Directors Only Expansion Deck
description:
Choir directors, we know your singers are why you love what you do, and that they're also why you drink. This red-band, 54-card expansion deck is meant to be shuffled into the main card game to create a decidely more mature gaming experience. There's cussin', y'all. Hide it from the kids, someplace they won't ever look. Maybe the music library?

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Music, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Band Is Horrible: Band Directors Only Expansion Deck
description:
Now in stock! Let's just say it: band directors can be horrible people. Who can blame them? They have to deal with that one damn freshman. They have to figure out why that mute is sticky. They have to wait until after school hours to get "band director drunk." This red-band expansion deck is meant to be shuffled into the main card game to create a decidely more mature gaming experience. There's cussin', y'all. Hide it from the kids, someplace they won't ever look. Maybe their instrument locker?

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Music, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Band Is Horrible: Band Assistant Directors Only Expansion Deck
description:
Another Horrible Expansion Deck - Band Assistants Directors Only!- 54 brand new cards!- Adult content, juvenile humor- Ages 18+- If it were any more authentic, it would be just as good as the original Band Directors Expansion Deck, only cheaper to get. LMAO no, it's the same price: $16.99

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Music, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Choirs Are Horrible: Contemporary A Cappella Expansion Deck
description:
Another Horrible Expansion Deck!
Contemporary A Capella! - A new expansion deck for Choirs Are Horrible

54 brand new cards!
High school appropriate
Ages 14+
Perfect for classrooms, tours, or when waiting whie they figure out where the feedback is coming from.


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Music, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Orchestras Are Awful: Orchestra Directors Only Expansion Deck
description:
Orchestra directors can be horrible people, and with good reason. They drink because of F holes, and not the fun kind. This red-band, 54-card expansion deck is meant to be shuffled into the main card game to create a decidely more mature gaming experience. There's cussin', y'all. Hide it from the kids, someplace they won't ever look. Maybe their instrument locker?

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Music, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Kingdoms: The Board Game
description:
The player(s) travel around a modular board, unveiling different Landscape Tiles as they go. Different terrains allow you to build different buildings, such as a Forest being a good place to build a Sawmill. The player(s) gather various resources in order to expand their Kingdom and construct more advanced buildings.

As the player(s) progress, they will be able to recruit and equip an army to defend their newly forged Kingdom. This is necessary, as during the game they will also be drawing from a deck of cards. These cards will be of two different types; Enemy Cards and Event Cards. The former will detail the forces gathering at your borders, ready to invade, while the latter will add a little spice to your game in the form of random events. These range from mine collapses, fires, floods, plague or occasionally something not so bad.

Once the deck of cards has run out, the time for building is over. From that point on it is a do or die final battle against your enemies. Have you prepared enough to survive? Or will your Kingdom crumble to dust?

—description from the designer
categories: City Building

name: Red Stars & Crosses: Eastern Front 1941 - 45
description:
Red Stars and Crosses is an Eastern Front 1941-45 campaign expansion for Stars & Crosses Revised Edition 1.2, the game of WW2 company-level combat in 6mm scale.

You will need a copy of the core rules to play.
This expansion includes rules for dust clouds, digging in, flares, antitank ditches, and extreme weather hazards.

Unit counters are included for Soviet units, plus new German units. Four scenarios are included.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Red Star, White Lights: Volume 1 of the Other Fire Series
description:
In an alternate 1985, Soviet tanks rolled across the West German border…but that wasn’t the only battleground the Superpowers came to blows.
One of these battlegrounds was Scandinavia. This scenario pack is Volume 1 of a new series meant to address the question “What is occurring in these “Other Fires” of the Third World War.
The scenarios cover tank battles, small commando raids meant to shape the fate of nations, and everything in between!

Contents of Volume 1:

12 scenarios for a variety of rules systems (tested with Ambush Alley and Arc of Fire, but playable with any rules set)
Meticulously researched Squad and Platoon-level tables of organization and equipment for Norway, Sweden, and Finland, as well as the British Royal Marine Commandos and Soviet VDV, with input from the veterans themselves!
Suggestions for special rules meant to reflect the conditions of the far north.
Notes for where to find miniatures suitable for games with these scenarios!


Come explore some of the other fighting that might have broken out in a Third World War, and see what might have happened if the Red Star advanced south under the White Lights!

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Taiping Era: Tabletop Wargame Rules for Land Conflict in 19th Century China
description:
Taiping Era is a set of rules to cover conflict in China in the middle of the 19th Century. As such they are intended to cover both the Taiping Rebellion and the Opium Wars. It should be possible to fight both actions between native Chinese/Manchu forces such as in the early days of the Taiping Rebellion as well as actions involving full European forces and also the “Ever Victorious Army”.

Given this aim the rules must allow for armies of dissimilar size and armament. Chinese armies were well organised but had equipment and training substantially unchanged since the 17th Century when the Manchu Qing dynasty established itself in China.

—user summary
categories: Book, Miniatures, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Ellen's Games Blindfolded Musical Chairs Game
description:
Ellen's Games Blindfolded Musical Chairs Game


INSPIRED BY THE ELLEN SHOW: This game of finding a seat while blindfolded is inspired by the Blindfolded Musical Chairs challenge played on the Ellen DeGeneres Show and Game of Games



DANCE IN PLACE: Players bust out their best dance moves to the music, while the host secretly places seats around them. Get ready for lots of laughs as players compete to find their seat



DANCE, DROP, SEARCH: While blindfolded, players dance to the music, drop when it stops, then fumble around to find their seat. The game is over when one player claims the last seat


FUN PARTY GAME: Fans of The Ellen DeGeneres Show and Game of Games can give any party a boost with this Blindfolded Musical Chairs game. It's great fun for friends and family ages 10 and up

Love Ellen's Games? This Blindfolded Musical Chairs game is a laugh-out-loud, active game inspired by the hilarious musical chairs challenge she plays on TV. One player is in charge of the music and setting up the disc-shaped seats. The other players put on blindfolds, and bust out their best dance moves when the music starts. When the host stops the music, players crawl around to find a seat. Anyone left without a seat is out. Repeat until 2 players are left and only 1 finds the last seat!

—description from the publisher
categories: Electronic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Party Game

name: Uber Soldat!: For The Fatherland! Expansion
description:
On the Frontline, the Germans have a new weapon...the new Machine Krieger! First the Allies saw the MK.I Uber Soldat but did not know that it was just to keep the Allies busy until the new MK.IIs arrived.

The Uber Soldat is now on the move, armed with the new MG45g and firing heavy caliber rounds which are able to penetrate buildings, trees, and walls. Or the new flamethrower, which is also able to fire a toxic gas as well as flames! Nowhere is safe on the battlefield when the MK.IIs arrive!

Now you can reinforce your German forces with some hard-hitting fire power and hit your enemies hard to take Germany back--For the Fatherland!

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II

name: Pot the question
description:
The ultimate question game with over 100,000 questions.
Answer the grades questions to "pot" the balls - 1 point for a red upto 7 points for a black. "pot as many balls as possible to out "pot" your opponents. Choose the degree of difficulty of questions according to your own knowledge over a wide range of subjects.
categories: Trivia

name: House of Cards
description:
The game is set in a haunted house. Cards are used to represent different rooms of the house, and players explore and react to events that take place in the rooms.

House of Cards requires a token for each player, 2 decks of standard playing cards (jokers optional), and 3 sets of tokens (50 "ghost" tokens, 26 "relic" tokens, and 75 "luck" counters).

One deck is shuffled, with about half the cards (chosen randomly) facing up, then dealt in a grid (the larger the grid, the longer the game). Cards are given relic and ghost tokens based on their suit. The second deck is shuffled normally and hands are dealt to the players.

The player can play cards to collect "luck" counters, move through the house, discovering rooms, collecting relics, and fighting ghosts and other players. Once the target number of relics are collected, the winner is decided.
categories: Card Game, Exploration

name: With Sword and Shield: Fantasy Mass Combat Rules
description:
With Sword and Shield is a miniatures game of mass combat, set in any world you wish to imagine!
Field armies composed of unruly hordes, stalwart men-at-arms, thundering cavalry, fantastic creatures, gigantic constructs, great war engines, powerful wizards, iconic heroes and brave leaders in an attempt to crush your opponents on the field of battle.

The game uses simple differential mechanics to determine combat outcomes, and pass/fail/critical failure gradients for casting spells.
Casualties are removed in ranks, or individual bases for characters, and units that fails to recover from Command Hits may rout from play.

With Sword and Shield supports miniature scales from 3mm up to ‘heroic’ 28mm, and includes:

Rules reflecting troop order, formations, and maneuvers
Provisions for horde, skirmish, elite, large and enormous creatures, flying, constructs and war engine unit types
Characters in the form of Leaders, Heroes, Mages, Wild Mages, Necromancers and Ecclesiasts
Dozens of unit and character attributes that create a unique feel and purpose for each unit in play
87 Spells and Rituals with which to harass and destroy your enemies
Six standard scenarios, scalable to the size of game you wish to play
An average game length of 2-3 hours.
Complete rules and guidelines for creating your own units and armies
Six complete army lists to get you started playing right away – Elves, Humans, Dwarves, Orcs, Beastmen and Undead – plus unit profiles for summoned creatures and elementals
Game reference charts, markers, and blank unit cards for your own creations


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Strike Legion: The VICAR Project
description:
The first time I saw one was when I was evacuated from the Death Valley camp. I didn’t get to see it up close; since it wasn’t one of ours, that’s probably a good thing - I’d already be dead. It was probably 5-6 miles away from my vantage point, and it looked like a city block had sprouted treads and guns and started moving. I later learned that these weren’t proper VICAR units - there weren’t any in the initial invasion force - but VIPRs, and that some VICAR units are even larger.

The VICAR Project is an expansion for use with the Strike Legion Tactical gaming system that introduces Oversized Vehicles into your tactical gaming battles, along with rules for campaign gaming using the Strike Legion Tactical system. Included in this volume:

Complete rules for using Oversized Vehicles (Signatures -5 to -12 in game terms), along with construction routines for creating your own monster tanks
74 Data Cards representing some of the VICAR, VIPR and conventional combat equipment and personnel units of the North American Union, the Russian Federation, and the People’s Republic of China for use in tabletop games set in an alternate near future
Complete rules for map-based Campaign Games involving ground, naval, air and space-based support forces, including guidelines for resolving combat actions, simple supply rules, and refitting the troops between battles
3 Campaign scenarios: Highland Battle, Ringworld, and Archipelago, with each scenario progressively introducing additional campaign gaming elements
Two sample Campaign Game force rosters with complete force lists for use in the Highland Battle Campaign Scenario
Multiple optional rules for players wanting to incorporate a little more detail into their campaign games
34 additional Data Cards and force organization information for three of the forces introduced in the Strike Legion Tactical Rules Compendium (the Earth Protectorate, the 5th Russik mercenary force, and the alien Derali) that provide more rounded forces for use in the Campaign Scenarios included in the book
9 new tactical battle scenarios that can be called into use under specific Campaign Game situations, or played as stand-alone scenarios
Various Campaign Game forms, markers and charts
Many hours of enjoyable, intense gaming experiences with your gaming group


—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Task Force Zeta: Volume 2 – Fleet Auxiliaries
description:
You've learned how to defeat your enemies on the distant borders of The Empire, commanded powerful warships and fighter wings in battle, and lived to tell your tales in the officer's lounge. But none of your accomplishments would have been possible were it not for a plethora of supporting troops, supply tenders, repair vessels, and starbases along your route to the enemy's front door. Time to give them their due.

Task Force Zeta Volume Two: Fleet Auxiliaries brings these forces and more to your tabletop space battles. This volume includes:

Numerous optional rules, including boarding combat, ramming attacks, combat/long-range scouts, docking, towing, explosions, shipboard fires, and more!
New classes of vessels, including starbases and ground installations, transport ships and shuttles, Exosuit and Mecha-based fighter squadrons, and Oversized vessels that have no theoretical limit in their size and capacities during their construction.
Six new weapon characteristics that expand the capabilities of existing weapons classes, Unconventional Weapons to conduct specific forms of electronic attacks against the enemy, mine warfare rules, and Organic ship hulls to represent bio-mechanoid ships.
29 new and expanded systems that can be added to ships of any size, including teleporters, tractors beams, grappling hooks, troop, cargo, and passenger bays, deployment systems for troop transports, and more. A number of new systems are geared towards preparing your vessels for campaign-style gaming.
Rules for interacting with planetary bodies, wormholes, jumpgates, and combat in hyperspace (which is always a risky undertaking).
Construction section additions that allow players to create ships using all of the new options, keeping Task Force Zeta at the forefront of space combat games with the largest number of possibilities for unit creation.
50 new pre-designed vessels, including a selection of ships from two original forces - the Omani Imperium and the Rikai'ishi'i Empire.
Six new tactical scenarios that include pirate attacks against convoys and Q-ships, weapons testbeds, salvage operations, starbase assaults, and more!
Complete rules for running a tactical campaign game, including a fully-developed campaign scenario with attendant map. A blank star sector map for creating your own campaign game set-ups is also included.
A section devoted to Joint Strike Operations, allowing players to run planetary invasion scenarios by combining Task Force Zeta with our popular Strike Legion tactical game series, and a complete Joint Strike Operations scenario featuring the Omani vs. the Rikai'ishi'i in space and on the ground. New Strike Legion Data Cards to represent a portion of these forces are also included.
A secondary download containing the basic background information, Data Cards, and ground unit formations for the Omani and Rikai'ishi'i from Strike Legion: Skunk Works.


—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Task Force Zeta: Fleet Pack 1 – Flesh and Steel
description:
Task Force Zeta: Flesh and Steel pits the forces of mankind's United Colonies against the Cyberon, a race of mechanical constructs, in sweeping fleet engagements across the known universe.
This Fleet Pack includes:

A background history that describes the basic setting and the conflicts of the First and Second Wars between the United Colonies and the Cyberon;
Data Cards for 37 capital and escort vessels, along with a dozen fighter and shuttlecraft, in a new (and far more attractive) data card format;
A section with basic descriptions of each ship and fighter class in this Fleet Pack, along with availability charts for fighting pick-up games with 'historically accurate' forces;
A short selection of special rules to better reflect this universe (that can also be adopted for any game of Task Force Zeta);
Two battle scenarios;
Two Tactical Campaign Games, including a CG map, terrain notes for each of the 22 star systems on the map, and the addition of simple resource management to replace fleet losses during a Tactical CG;
Suggestions on where to find appropriate miniatures to better reflect the vessels of the combatants on your tabletop.


—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Mars Memorandum: A Solitaire Strategic Game About Mars Colonization
description:
"Mars is there, waiting to be reached."
Buzz Aldrin
Live the dangers and challenges of colonizing Mars in our Mars Memorandum strategy game!

Mars Memorandum is a solitaire strategic game, where it simulates the creation of a colony in Martian soil. The main objective of the player is to develop and maintain a population of 2000 settlers despite the problems and possible natural events.

Game Components:

1 Rules booklet
1 board with Mars map
1 Recon Manual
Resource and Facilities Markers
General Control Board of the Colony
1 player aid
3d models for print


You need also 1 six-sided dice (d6). You can borrow from another game.

Mars Memorandum is a game of resource management, reasoning and luck.
The goal is to build and maintain a Martian colony for 2000 inhabitants in 30 game turns. The player should rely heavily on his reasoning to develop the full potency of the colony in all its aspects.
categories: Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction

name: Children's Forte Trivia Cards
description:
The third set of trivia cards in the Forte line. The box contains a playing guide, a six-colored die, and 363 trivia cards (2,178 questions). It's designed to be played on its own, or with "other popular trivia games".

The categories with corresponding color are: Green - Fun & Games, Orange - History & People, Blue - Fairy Tales & Legends, Brown - The Sciences, Pink - Music, Movies, & TV, Yellow - Fair Play.
categories: Trivia

name: Airship race round the world
description:
Roll-and-move boardgame themed around a circumnavigation air race. The centre of the board features a world map, highlighting the British Empire, and shows a race route form Melbourne to London via SE Asia and the Middle East, and returning to Melbourne via the Americas and East Asia. The actual game track is around the edge of the board, and consists of 60 spaces. 18 spaces feature vignettes of famous cities along the route, with penalties or bonus to apply to the players landing on them.

—user summary
categories: Aviation / Flight, Racing

name: Dice Rolling Freaks
description:
Dice Rolling Freaks is an FREE Adventure Game that works well with a LOT of dice.
Standard 6-sided dice.

Throughout the game, players' characters will work together (hopefuly!) to explore and survive an Interdimensional Dungeon, filled with bizarre monsters, lethal traps and unreal artifacts.

The general goal of the game is survival!!!

Characters start with 3 Character Dice, representing their equipment and abilities. These dice will be rolled frequently so their identities will change!

Tunnel Dice are used to map out the dungeon as the group explores, revealing surprising twists and turns, secret rooms and chambers, and monster encounters!

Encounters are cross-referenced with a simple online Monster List, and combat is fast and furious!

Advanced level of Dice Rolling Freaks includes Treasure Orbs, Unnatural Dead-Ends, Curses and more! DRF is always evolving with new rules and features!

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Maze

name: Divorcio Express
description:
A card game where we represent young recently graduated lawyers, who aspire to obtain the only vacancy of this monstrous company called Divorcios Express. Your only mission is to resolve divorces as quickly as possible and making your client have the least possible losses.
I play with a lot of interaction between players, steal and punish your competitors.
The game consists of 112 cards and 15 pawns in 5 different colors, 3 per player.
Includes 3 game modes:
Fast mode: approximately 7 minutes
Standard size: 25/30 minutes approx.
Advanced mode: 35/40 minutes approx.

In this card game you can perform three different actions or repeat them.
Draw a card from another player's hand.
Take a card from the deck or the card that is face up.
Play Divorce lawsuit.
Draw until you have 10 cards.
Discard a maximum of 5 cards and draw the same amount discarded.

The game ends when the draw deck is finished.

The player with the most prestige points wins, if they all end in negative points nobody wins the game.

Black-bordered cards are there to thwart the plans of the owner.
the cards with a red border are there to frustrate the rest of the players.
The green bordered cards are the cards you will play in your divorce lawsuit.
Cards with a gold border grant many points at the end of the game if you have them in hand at the end of the game (But be careful, fewer cards in hand are less cards to play and win points or to hinder other players)
Cards with a white border are only used in Advanced mode and provide the player who places his pawn on it with a special ability during that turn, a player cannot place on the same white card two turns in a row.

Un juego de cartas donde representamos a jóvenes abogados recién titulados, que aspiran a conseguir la única vacante de esta monstruosa empresa llamada Divorcios Express. Tu única misión es resolver divorcios de la manera más rápida posible y haciendo que tu cliente tenga las menos pérdidas posibles.
Juego con muchísima interacción entre jugadores, roba y castiga a tus competidores.
El juego se compone de 112 cartes y 15 peones en 5 colores diferentes, 3 por jugador.
Incluye 3 modos de juego:
Modo rapido: 7 minutos aproximadamente
Mado standard: 25/30 minutos aprox.
Modo avanzado: 35/40 minutos aprox.

En este juego de cartas puedes realizar tres acciones diferentes o repetirlas.
Robar una carta de la mano de otro jugador.
Coger una carta del mazo o la carta que esta boca arriba.
Jugar Demanda de divorcio.
Robar hasta tener 10 cartas.
Descartar de un máximo de 5 cartas y robar la misma cantidad descartada.

El juego termina cuando se acaba el mazo de robo.

Gana el jugador con más puntos de prestigio, si todos acaban en puntos negativos nadie gana la partida.

Las cartas con borde negro estan para frustrar los planes del que las posee.
las cartas con borde rojo están para frustrar al resto de jugadores.
Las cartas con borde verde son las cartas que jugaras en tu demanda de divorcio.
Las cartas con borde dorado otorgan muchos puntos al final de la partida si las tienes en la mano al finalizar el juego (Pero cuidado, menos cartas en mano son menos cartas para jugar y ganar puntos o para entorpecer a otros jugadores)
Las cartas con borde blanco solo se usan en el modo Avanzado y proporcionan al jugador que coloca su peón sobre ella una habilidad especial durante ese turno, un jugador no puede colocarse en una misma carta blanca dos turnos seguidos.
categories: Party Game

name: Prism
description:
A trick-taking card game played with a 52-card deck in seven color strands numbered 2-7 and three types of wild card named INFRA-RED, ULTRAVIOLET, and SPECTRUM. One color strand is used per player.

Players are dealt 7 cards with a 3 card blind, and then take turns bidding based on how many tricks they think they can win. Highest bidder gets the blind and must win as many tricks as he bid. The highest bidder gains or loses points according to a formula based on whether he won his bid. Other players can also score points for winning tricks. First player to 100 points wins.
categories: Card Game

name: Medieval Royale
description:
Sharpen your swords, shurikens, and wits to try to be the last-one-standing in this asymetrical, simultaneous, take-that BATTLE ROYALE board game for 4-9 players.

Watch out, the PLAGUE is closing in!

Set-up:

Players choose a unique battler (Peasant, Princess, Ninja, Highwayman, and more, each with their own abilities, health (shown by heart tokens), and weapon deck).
Choose a location where their battler will start on an ever shrinking medieval world.


GAMEPLAY:
The game is played over 12 short rounds each consisting of four phases:

PLAGUE- a plague card is revealed and placed in the displayed location. Any battler in that area loses one health (heart token).

COIN- a coin token in flipped over and placed in the specified location. The first battler to get to this location adds a unique weapon to their common weapons. But if two or more players arrive at the same time, a battle ensues and only the last person in that location gets the reward...

MOVEMENT- Each player secretly chooses one of their four movement tokens that specify direction of travel or if they want to stay where they are. All tokens are revealed at the same time and the players move into position for...

BATTLE- Battler may play a weapon to injur other battlers nearby. Some weapons damage battlers in the immediate location, some damage battlers in consecutive locations, and some have other advantages like damaging someone elsewhere on the map or getting more health.

When a battler is defeated (by losing all of their health), they are eliminated and the rival who dealt the final bow gets of of their remaining weapons.

More:
Medieval Royale takes 30-40 minutes from set-up till final triumph. Players are usually not eliminated until the last few rounds, so that eliminated players don't have to wait long to jump in on another game. Many games take longer and longer as rounds go on, but MR actually gets shorter and shorter, since fewer locations and weapons force a quick ending.

Characters, their abilities, and artwork is based on Of Knights and Ninjas- a medieval card game for 2-6 players that blurs the line between party and strategy game.

—description from the designer
categories: Fighting, Medieval, Party Game, Wargame
mechanics: Hand Management, Hidden Movement, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Great War East 1914: A Scenario Book For Command Decision – Test of Battle
description:
Winston Churchill wrote a book about the eastern front of the Great War, The Unknown War.
One-hundred years later, the events and drama of the Great War in the East are still largely unknown.

This scenario book presents battles on the eastern front of the Great War during the campaigns of 1914.

The ten scenarios focus on maneuver warfare; Austrian, German, and Russian divisional orders of battle are included.
This supplement uses the CDTOB rules, but slightly modifies them to better represent the nature of ground combat in 1914.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I

name: Command Decision: Test of Battle – The Death of Glory: France 1914
description:
"... a drama never surpassed," so wrote Winston Churchill about the Marne Campaign of 1914.
The Death of Glory - France 1914 presents battles of the Marne Campaign for Command Decision - Test of Battle.

This scenario book contains:

a foreward by Greg Novak,
a campaign overview,
special rules for 1914 battlefields,
ten scenarios,
orders-of-battle,
Battle Group lists for Test of Battle, and
weapons data sheets.


Fog-of-War cards for the Marne battlefields and an annotated bibliography are also included.

The scenarios focus on maneuver battles, not trench warfare.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I

name: Command Decision: Test of Battle – Armies of October: Armies & Weapons 1973 Arab-Israeli War
description:
In October of 1973 the Arab armies of Egypt, Syria, and almost a dozen other states launched a surprise attack against the Israeli- occupied territories in the Sinai and Golan Heights.

The October War, the Yom Kippur War, the Ramadan War - all these names described the largest and hardest-fought war in the long history of the Arab-Israeli conflict.
Never was there a conflict of this scope, featuring this much back-and-forth maneuver, or such dramatic turns of fortune.

For the wargamer, this conflict provides armies more balanced in equipment and capabilities than any other mid-east war. It also saw the first widespread use of wire-guided antitank missiles and the first major generation of post-World War Two armored vehicles.

The Armies of October is the most comprehensive study of the belligerent armies available under a single cover. For the armies of Israeli, Egypt, Syria, Iraq, Jordan, Morocco, Tunisia, Algeria, Libya, Kuwait, Saudi Arabia, and the Palestinian Liberation Army The Armies of October features:

Army organization
Doctrinal strengths and weaknesses
Detailed notes on equipment holdings
Order of battle down to the battalion level


For 'Command Decision players we also include game organizations from division to battalion level and a complete list of weapons and combat vehicles with all game statistics.

The October War provides a unique conflict for study and gaming, a blend of the logical development of World War Two weapon systems encountering the early examples of late-century military technology in the form of wire-guided missiles, extensive mechanization throughout the force structure, and omnipresent light antitank weapons. The Armies of October is the indispensable guide to exploring that conflict.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Command Decision: Test of Battle – The Return: Leyte October 1944
description:
The Return: Leyte October 1944

On the 20th of October American forces landed on the Island of Leyte, fulfilling General Douglas MacArthur's promise to return to the Philippines. This booklet contains campaign rules covering strategic movement, weather and beach assaults for the capture of Leyte by the American 6th Army. Optional rules are also included for MacArthur's original plan using the Australian 6th Division.

Included are orders of battle for American, Japanese and Australian forces as well as a random battlefield generator for the Pacific theatre, optional night attack rules and new fog of war cards that capture the flavour of war in the Pacific.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Blitzkrieg Legions: Dark Beginnings
description:
Blitzkrieg Legions Dark Beginnings

The armies of the first three campaigns of World War II are detailed with Orders of Battle, TO&Es, and ratings of the unusual vehicles, guns, and aircraft which made these early fights so interesting.
The Nomonhom/Khalkin Gol incident, the Polish Campaign, and the Winter War are covered. Forces include Japan, the Soviet Union, Mongolia, Germany, Slovakia, Poland, and Finland.

Who says you need Tigers to have a good time?
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Command Decision: Test of Battle – Blitzkrieg Legions: Fall of the West
description:
Blitzkrieg Legions: Fall of the West

The book provides detailed orders of battle and unit organizations for Command Decision, including notes on variations in equipment and readiness of the different divisions, of all three major belligerents in the 1940 campaign.


The French: Probably the most varied army of World War II, both in terms of organizational types and spread of proficiency, from crack pre-war regular and colonial divisions to the hapless B-Reservists.
The Germans: Fresh from the hard lessons of the Polish Campaign, the Germans had settled on a clear doctrine and simplified army organization.
The British: Small but tough, the BEF could be the tie-breaker in the coming clash.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Robot Like You
description:
Over a hundred years have passed since the humans have disappeared from the face of planet earth. Until now, robots have coexisted peacefully. But news that the earth's fuel has been running low, and greed for the fuel paired with fear of ending up in a junkyard has thrown the robots into a frenzy.

To survive, you spend your time foraging for parts with which to build weapons and force fields for protection.

Robot Ridge is a fast-paced, take that card game with several unique mechanics including custom designed robots, machine building to improve abilities, and scheming against enemy robots (see below).

Set-up:
Players choose three cards to build their unique robot- head, body, and feet (or foot).

Gameplay:
On your turn, draft two cards from the junkyard and then play your cards in order to build shields, steal cards from other robots, or blow them to bits.

As your robot gets damaged, you will lose abilities to play certain cards. Damaged feet mean you can't explore to find robot parts to repair your robot. A damaged body means you can't shoot at opponent robots.

Scheming. As fewer and fewer cards in your hand can be played due to your damaged robot, you can still use them to "scheme" against other robots. To scheme, place a card face down in front of them. Once three cards (from you or other robots) have been schemed against them, they must immediately take damage to part of their robot. Of course, if they happen to think, they get to remove the cards schemed against them and put them into their hand to use later... possibly against you!

The last robot standing wins!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Party Game, Wargame
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Command Decision: Test of Battle – Red Steel: Soviet Armored and Mobile Forces in World War II 1939-1945
description:
Red Steel

Regardless of what rule system you play with, this supplement is the indispensable and definitive guide to the Soviet armored and mobile forces in World War II.


TO&E charts for all Soviet mobile (tank, mechanized, and cavalry) corps, divisions, and separate brigades and regiments in World War II, including organizational and equipment changes.
Overview of Soviet tactical doctrine, training, and combat effectiveness - including the role of pre-war theorists such as Tukhachevsky, and the Great Purge.
Complete list of all Soviet tank and mechanized divisions at the outbreak of Barbarossa, with actual tank strength (in game terms) by tank type.
Revised and expanded Soviet data charts.
Aircraft ratings for all Soviet combat aircraft in the west.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Oh My Garden
description:
The Perfect Card Game for the Whole Family!

The cards represent either hungry bunnies or your trusty dog. The Goal is to get rid of all your cards and to save your Garden!

The round starts by you kicking a bunny from your Garden and giving it to your opponent. Then the opponent blocks incoming bunnies by either using a stronger bunny by using a dog. Each time your opponent blocks, it opens up more avenues for you to give them bunnies!

If all bunnies are blocked, then the round is over. If even 1 gets through, then your opponent picks up all the cards and skips their turn!

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game
mechanics: Action/Event, Hand Management, Lose a Turn, Stat Check Resolution

name: The Campaigns in India During the Seven Years War 1756-1764
description:
The Campaigns in India during the Seven Years War 1756-1764 is a guide for wargamers.

It includes:

an historical background
nine historical scenarios with details and rules for Volley & Bayonet:
Plassey;
Condore;
Wandiwash;
Patna;
Panipat;
Pondicherry;
Katwa;
Sooty and
Buxar.

Details on painting and forming armies
categories: Age of Reason, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: From Oars to Cannons: Rules for fighting ship to ship from 480BC to 1571 AD
description:
From Oars to Cannons are rules for combat with Merrimack Old Glory Shipyard brand Naval Miniatures from Ancients - 500 BC to Renaissance - 1570 AD.

The rules are for use with Cog Wars, Galley Wars, Dragon Wars and Lepanto Wars.
categories: Ancient, Book, Medieval, Miniatures, Nautical, Renaissance, Wargame

name: Run the Guns: Volume II – Birth of the Broadside
description: Run the Guns - Volume II - Birth of the Broadside is a set of rules for the Armada period, fighting naval battles from the late 1500's - 1650
categories: Book, Miniatures, Nautical, Pike and Shot, Renaissance, Wargame

name: Buccaneers, Broadswords & Blunderbuss
description:
Buccaneers, Broadswords and Blunderbuss

Rules and scenarios for gaming in the Golden Age of Piracy
categories: Book, Miniatures, Nautical, Pike and Shot, Pirates, Wargame

name: Der Flugplatzspatz nahm auf dem Flugblatt Platz
description:
Title roughly translates to "The airfield sparrow took a seat on the flyer" and is a tongue-twister memo game.

Philip Waechter is one of Germany's leading children's book illustrators. He created drawings for old as well as new tongue-twisters and jawbreakers which are perfectly fit for quick speakers. Actors oftentimes use tongue-twisters for warming up; in this game, where a text card and a picture card create a pair, the players have to articulate jawbreakers like „Flamingos tragen freitags Fischflossenflipflops" loudly and clearly. A fun and entertaining game for the whole family.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Memory, Party Game, Puzzle, Word Game

name: Wargamers Collectible Rule Book
description:
Introductory rules for the Wargamers core game. Covers everything needed to play.
To cover all, from historical battles, zombies, super hero's, cop and gangster, the old west and science fiction space battle.

This is a list of rules explaining the game counters, turns, games with or without boards...

Each genre will have special rules exclusive to that genre.
categories: American West, Book, Fantasy, Science Fiction, Wargame, Zombies

name: The Undead Wargamers Supplement
description:
The Wargamers rule set for the Undead Hordes.
Battle for survival.

Team with others or attempt to go solo.

In the Undead series, all counters are individuals not units.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: 3rd Generation Warfare: Cold War Data Book 1950-1991
description:
3rd Generation Warfare is a set of Modern Wargaming rules for Combined Arms Conflict.

This first data book covers the Cold war.

With army lists and hundreds of vehicle stats for all the NATO members and the Soviet Union.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Smooth & Rifled: The Napoleonic Wars
description:
The Napoleonic Wars is the first Napoleonic supplement for Smooth & Rifled.

It includes lists for

France,
Austria,
Prussia,
Russia and
Great Britain.


Spain, Portugal and Italy are included in the second supplement.

ADDITIONAL RULES

Bayonets. Re-loading a Muzzle loading musket takes longer if bayonet is fixed. Add 1 to re-loading time when bayonet is fixed. Miniatures are supposed to start the game with unfixed bayonets. Bayonets can be fixed with one action, it can be also a Group Action.

Lance. Lance is a melee weapon. It gives one re-roll in melee if charged but up to 2 re-rolls if on charge.

Marksmen. Marksmen cannot perform Group Fire or reloading as a Group.

Feared. Feared works like Feroucious.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Smooth & Rifled: The Napoleonic Wars – Part 2. The Peninsula
description:
Smooth & Rifled: The Napoleonic Wars - part 2. The Peninsula

Second Napoleonic supplement for Smooth & Rifled.

With Spanish and Portuguese armies.

ADDITIONAL RULES
Bayonets - Re-loading a Muzzle loading musket takes longer if bayonet is fixed. Add 1 to re-loading time when bayonet is fixed. Miniatures are supposed to start the game with unfixed bayonets. Bayonets can be fixed with one action, it can be also a Group Action.

Lance. Lance is a melee weapon. It gives one re-roll in melee if charged but up to 2 re-rolls if on charge

Marksmen. Marksmen cannot perform Group Fire.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Whiteout
description:
Whiteout is a solo / co-operative play miniatures game of survival while trying to achieve the government’s nefarious aims. You are challenged with completing your mission while both the enemy and the environment try their best to kill you.
The game is played on a 4x6 board of 1’ square squares. The scale is abstracted and each square represents a region that the characters are in. In actuality, the squares might represent a vast snowy plain, a huge crevasse field or a little area around a hut for example.

The map is expanded with a randomly determined terrain square when a character leaves the chartered area of the table, and an encounter card is revealed when entering that new area.
The board is explored until the characters reach the mission goal.

—user summary
categories: Exploration, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: Smooth & Rifled: The War of 1812
description:
War of 1812 supplement for Smooth & Rifled

With army lists for the British and American armies.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Smooth & Rifled: The French and Indian War
description:
The French and Indian War supplement for Smooth & Rifled

Includes special rules and army list for the British, French and Indians.

ADDITIONAL RULES
Scalps - Taking a scalp from a out of com-bat figure (the looser in a melee) takes 1 action. Each scalp counts 1 point for Morale Value.

Tomahawk - 10/X means that if used as a missile weapon is a one use weapon.
The figure can subsequently recover his tomahawk if the launch was successful. Removing the weapon takes 1 Action. The figure killed by this weapon should not be removed unless it is exchanged for a marker so players know where the tomahawk is when they come to recover it. Tomahawk is a melee weapon (1 reroll) if used in melee.

Wooden club and Halberd - They are melee weapon and give a reroll in melee.

Bayonets - Re-loading a Muzzle loading musket takes longer if bayonet is fixed. Add 1 to re-loading time when bayonet is fixed. Miniatures are supposed to start the game with unfixed bayonets. Bayonets can be fixed with one action, it can be also a Group Action.
categories: American Indian Wars, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Dreh' das Ding
description:
A clever-Meier-game for 2 People.

The aim of the game is to collect as many points as possible by catching opposing stones.

Each player chooses one of the colors for himself and always uses his stones with this color on top. Each player receives 27 normal stones, 2 double stones and 1 stop stone. At the start of the game, each player places two of his stones in the middle of the game board. Then one stone is used alternately and an attempt is made to capture opposing stones. Enemy stones are caught when they are in a continuous row and are enclosed on both sides by their own stone. Then the opposing stones are turned to their own color side.

The game is comparable to the well-known "Othello".
categories: Abstract Strategy

name: Smooth & Rifled: American War of Independence
description:
Smooth & Rifled: American War of Independence is a supplement for Smooth & Rifled

It adds some extra rules and army lists for the Americans and their French ally, the British.

Tomahawk - 10/X means that if used as a missile weapon is a one use weapon. The figure can subsequently recover his tomahawk if the launch was successful. Removing the weapon takes 1 Action. The figure killed by this weapon should not be removed unless it is exchanged for a marker so players know where the tomahawk is when they come to recover it. Tomahawk is a melee weapon (1 re-roll) if used in melee.

Wooden club and Halberd - They are melee weapon and give a re-roll in melee.

Bayonets - Re-loading a Muzzle loading musket takes longer if bayonet is fixed. Add 1 to re-loading time when bayonet is fixed. Miniatures are supposed to start the game with unfixed bayonets. Bayonets can be fixed with one action, it can be also a Group Action
categories: American Revolutionary War, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Smooth & Rifled: The American Civil War
description:
Smooth & Rifled: The American Civil War is an ACW supplement for Smooth & Rifled

It includes additional rules and army list for the Union and Confederacy.

ADDITIONAL RULES
Bayonets - Re-loading a Muzzle loading musket takes longer if bayonet is fixed. Add 1 to re-loading time when bayonet is fixed. Miniatures are supposed to start the game with unfixed bayonets. Bayonets can be fixed with one action, it can be also a Group Action.
categories: American Civil War, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Smooth & Rifled: In the Dark Continent
description:
Smooth & Rifled: In the Dark Continent.

Includes list and additional rules to play in the pre-colonial age in Africa, the European explorations and the tribal wars in the Dark Continent.

ADDITIONAL RULES:
Assegai - Assegai was a light spear used for a softening range attack. It can be thrown without penalty for movement only before a charge (max range 8cm, hits at 7). Aiming is allowed also for this weapon.

Spear and machete - They are melee weapons.

Shield - Shields provide light cover for shooting of bows and other throwing weapons if at 180°.

Kpinga - It is a throwing knife. 10/X means that if used as a missile weapon is a one use weapon. The figure can subsequently recover his kpinga if the launch was successful. Removing the weapon takes 1 Action. The figure killed by this weapon should not be removed unless it is exchanged for a marker so players know where the kpinga is when they come to recover it. Kpinga is a melee weapon if in melee.

Witchdoctor - A Witchdoctor works like a standard bearer and a musician at the same time. His MV is 5.

Marksmen. Marksmen cannot fire by Group
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Programm 2000
description:
Programm 2000 is so simple that children can learn and play it in minutes. However, if it is played with logic and planning, it quickly proves to be a challenging logic game.

With 36 program cards, the game plan is gradually covered like a flow chart. The individual program columns can be connected with different metal brands that the players received at the beginning of the game. As soon as any player has no program cards to lay out, the game is over. The player who has the most metal brands left wins.
categories: Unspecified

name: Smooth & Rifled: The Crimean War
description:
Smooth & Rifled: The Crimean War

This supplement includes lists for Russian Empire, France, Great Britain, Kingdom of Sardinia, and Ottoman Empire.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Bayonets, Shells & Balls!
description:
10 ACW brigade level scenarios.

These are large battles and require large tables as befits brigade level games.

Ideal for multiplayer games at the club.

To be used with Regimental level ACW ruleset

—description from the publisher
categories: American Civil War, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame

name: Across a Deadly Space
description:
10 ACW regimental scenarios from the Eastern Theatre 1861-65.

The most accurate information available on OOB's, unit strengths and weapons.
Also includes the battles of Olustee (Ocean Pond) and Honey Hill where the famous 54th Massachusetts fought.

To be used with Regimental level ACW ruleset

—description from the publisher
categories: American Civil War, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Bullets & Dirt
description:
12 ACW regimental scenarios from both Eastern and Western theatre's 1861-64.

The most accurate information available on OOB's, unit strengths and weapons.

To be used with Regimental level ACW ruleset

—description from the publisher
categories: American Civil War, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Forward The Colours!
description:
10 ACW regimental scenarios from all theatres of the American Civil War 1861-65.

Includes the epic First Bull Run the battle that ensured 4 more years of war.

To be used with Regimental level ACW ruleset

—description from the publisher
categories: American Civil War, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: In Command: Bermuda Hundred Campaign
description:
Set in April May 1864
The Bermuda Hundred is a small peninsula close to the confederate capital.

If you like big battles then this campaign should furnish them for you.

The only thing missing here is imagination.

To be used with Regimental or Brigade level ACW ruleset
categories: American Civil War, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: In Command: Elkhorn Tavern Campaign
description:
Everything you need to fight a campaign without all the headaches, minimum of paperwork, also a time scale so no one gets fed up and a conclusion is reached.

Players can concentrate on being a General instead of quartermaster, cook, every officer and private, because they are ..... In Command!

These rules are designed to be used with an empire.
To be used with Regimental level ACW ruleset

—description from the publisher
categories: American Civil War, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Kirby Smith's Confederacy
description:
10 ACW regimental scenarios from the Trans-Mississippi Theatre 1861-64.

This is an introduction to an almost forgotten part of the war between the States, you will find some challenging large and small battles in this booklet.

To be used with Regimental level ACW ruleset

—description from the publisher
categories: American Civil War, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: The Struggle of Standards: Eight battles, nine scenarios, from an age of warriors. 577 AD - 1066 AD
description:
This is a scenario booklet for large Dark Age battles from 577AD to 1066AD, it features eight battles which give nine scenarios.

There is a brief introduction to the Dark Ages and the armies which fought across Britain and Ireland during that period, you will meet Romano-British, Picts, Irish, Welsh, Northumbrians, Mercians, Saxons and Vikings.

Also you will meet the leaders, warlords and kings who were never shy at drawing cold steel, for honour, greed or property.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Die Zombie-Jägers: A Pike & Shot & Zombie Game Supplement
description:
Die Zombie-Jägers is another gaming supplement for the Pike & Shot & Zombie rules - the post post-apocalyptic Renaissance zombie survival game.

The setting is a quiet rural area as yet untouched by the undead plague.
Here life can still be hard - but in the good years an adequate living can be made. If the crops are blighted however, or the livestock fall ill, shortages are keenly felt - and cattle are beginning to die, disfigured by signs of putrefaction - even before death.
None in the village can remember seeing anything working with such ghastly haste on these precious animals.
Now fear begins its work.
Not just fear of another winter without food but fear that perhaps the first signs of the pestilence is beginning to show. First it is the animals that suffer - what next? The people? As piles of infected carcasses burn and stinking black smoke rises into the air, many begin to wonder - what has brought on this misfortune? Who is responsible for this outbreak of corruption - and who is going to stop it?

Included in this booklet are three new scenarios, two new characters, lots of new events and new zombies to try (well they're actually pretty old and mouldy now!). First of these characters is the Verdorben - corrupted individuals, obsessed by the undead menace and convinced that they can draw power from the same well-spring of evil that maintains the undead. Although these individuals may look like any other survivor, they can bring the taint of the undead and the risk of infection into any community. This insidious threat means that none can truly be trusted.

Second of these new characters are the hunters of evil and corruption - the Jägers. So fanatical are these finders of evil that the Verdorben truly fear them. Unfortunately the fanaticism of these hunters also leads to the persecution of the innocent and many have perished at the hands of the over-zealous. Exemplary behaviour and outward displays of faith are not always sufficient to withstand the questioning gaze of the Jäger. The finger of suspicion pointed by a jealous neighbour can quickly lead to denouncement, imprisonment and the terrible process of "investigation".

So these new threats are lethal indeed, be it from the hidden menace of the Verdorben or the ruthless and deadly accusations of the Jägers. Survivors may long for the days when the threat was more obvious. All that a survivor used to need was a stout leather jacket, a trusty halberd and a dozen zombies would fall decapitated before their slicing blade. Now the threat is more sinister, a whispered accusation in the wrong ear, some malicious gossip or perhaps a settling of old scores - one wrong word and the once heroic survivor can be brought low. So don your armour, buckle up your sword, shove a big heavy pistol in your belt and get ready for battle. Trust no one, especially your friends and if any Zombie -Jägers ask for help with their inquiries - think very, very carefully before answering.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Renaissance, Wargame, Zombies

name: Lost Valley Survivors: A Pike & Shot & Zombie Game Supplement
description:
The Lost Valley Survivors is the second gaming supplement for the Pike & Shot & Zombie rules and contains six new linked missions, new event cards, new armour and weapons - and lots of new zombie types to try them out on! The Lost Valley is set in a post-apocalyptic Renaissance world where rational thought and burgeoning scientific practice is being dragged back to a darker world of fear and suspicion and of course the terrifying undead plague.

Since the coming of the plague, the survivors yearn for peace and time spent away from the constant threat of der Auferstandene. The greatest menace comes from the "plague city", that deadweight of evil that burdens the living struggling to survive. Many believe that if they could only escape this land and its malevolent influence they could find peace. Constant patrols are sent out into the wider countryside, always in the hope of finding a land untainted. Dangerous and gruelling though this work is, it must be continued. A recent patrol has returned with news of a secluded valley. Quiet, unoccupied and ready for settlement, this could provide a new home for those wishing to escape. Within a few short weeks, a powerful expeditionary force has been mobilised and sets out to find this land, a land that promises peace and freedom and hope. Could this hidden valley provide shelter and a measure of protection from the harsh realities of the outside world. If this place has managed so far to escape this deadly plague, could it not hold out still further if properly organised and defended?

Only brave and dedicated survivors need apply for this mission, the risks are sure to be great but surely the rewards will be even greater!
categories: Adventure, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Renaissance, Wargame, Zombies

name: News@11: Segment – Sportsball
description:
From the "Promo Paradise" Kickstarter brought to you by The Board Game Spotlight and Board Game Exposure.

This promo is a Segment card that the Producer can give to a News Anchor to request them to speak on the subject of 'Sportsball'.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Spell Tracers
description:
Two rival Warlocks duel for the trophy of Best Wizard in the Realm.
Choose your element (fire or ice), rise your wand (a pen of different color for each player) and get ready to bring your opponent down.

On a grid (20 squares long for 19 squares wide), the two middle rows a greyed out and are considered a neutral area (no one can build anything there) but crossing is permitted. You cannot cross lines drawn by your adversary or yourself.
Each warlock begins on either side of the grid, in the middle column.

Roll a 6-sided die and execute the corresponding action:

Move 1 space in any orthogonal direction
Divide the line (the "spell") in 2 directions diagonally
Move 3 spaces by changing direction each intersection.
Move 2 spaces diagonally (in the same direction)
Block an unoccupied square
Play a Spell card


Each player has the same set of 4 Spell cards:

Fireball/Ice-ball: cancel a move.
Firewall/Ice-wall: Fill 3 squares horizontally (on you side only)
Lava hand/Freezing blizzard: Move 1 space and throw the die twice next turn.
Lava geyser/Colossal iceberg: destroy a barricade square


When a player uses their fourth card, all their cards become available again.

The first player reaching the enemy starting row wins.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Fantasy, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Plague City: A Pike & Shot & Zombie Game Supplement
description:
Plague City is the first game supplement for Pike & Shot & Zombies, the post-apocalyptic Renaissance survival game! Included in this booklet are thirteen scenarios set in the hideous and dangerous confines of the "plague city".

Once a mighty fortress and great city, perched on the banks of a broad and swift flowing river, beset from all sides by armies and looters and vagabonds. This great city succumbed to its final assault. Armies it could humiliate, besiegers it could resist, but against the cold fury of the dead it could not hold out. Thirty thousand inhabitants stared into the faces of the dead and knew that the end had come. Few escaped the slaughter...

Now the living, the survivors, shun this place. Death awaits those that return to the city, death or worse! Smoke and the stench of decay arise from this accursed place. Grey and ragged figures make their shambling progression through ruined streets in an endless quest for living flesh, their blood-caked mouths, dry, shuddering, craving. And yet some survivors look on this forbidding city as a potential source of great wealth. What use to the dead have for the riches of the church, the fine merchant houses and sumptuous palaces? Surely an expedition into this damned city would be worth it. Risky, yes - but rewarding - surely! And for players valiant enough to risk the Plague City, a host of new "event-cards" await to trip-up and challenge these survivors brave enough to enter.
categories: Adventure, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Renaissance, Wargame, Zombies

name: Rotting Renaissance Regiments: A Pike & Shot & Zombie Game Supplement
description:
Rotting Renaissance Regiments is the third gaming supplement for the Pike & Shot & Zombies rules and it contains new scenarios, new event cards and a whole bunch of new zombie types to try out. There is also a section on converting your Renaissance figures into menacing, mouldy musketeers as seen on the front cover!

Now please don't be alarmed by the sight of gun-totting zombies on the front of this supplement. We are not suggesting that these undead beasts have the wit to use these weapons properly. We are not messing with the time-honoured notion of mindless flesh-eating zombies. So rest assured, these zombies are still mindless and still flesh eating. Its just that some of them are still clinging to the weapons that they once used in life. If these guns are fired, they are most likely to miss, or hit another zombie and in any case the gun is probably being held the wrong way round! And as for the chances of reloading - you can forget it!!

Rotting Regiments describes the final descent of once proud and powerful regiments as the terrible undead plague finally takes hold. As the last shreds of humanity ebb away a residue of former prowess remains. Will these accursed warriors manage one final flourish of military excellence before the all consuming hunger for human flesh takes hold? All that the survivors can bank on is that the battle for survival remains desperate and unremitting - and is not made any easier by the arrival of Rotting Renaissance Regiments.
categories: Adventure, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Renaissance, Wargame, Zombies

name: Famous Zombies from the Past: A Pike & Shot & Zombie Game Supplement
description:
Famous Zombies from the Past is the third gaming supplement for the Pike & Shot & Zombies rules and contains eight new scenarios, new event cards and new zombie types including the new and detailed profile of the "famous" zombies - the latest deadly threat to human survival in the post-apocalyptic Renaissance world!

Will the survivors be able to cope with Zombie Cromwell, Gustavus Undead Adolphus, Festering Father Tilly, Count Putrid von Pappenheim or a host of other horrible "heroes"?

As if life wasn't tough enough in the gruelling carnage of zombie warfare - the undead have just upped their game - can the survivors rise to meet the challenge?
categories: Adventure, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Renaissance, Wargame, Zombies

name: Something Zombie This Way Comes: A Pike & Shot & Zombie Game Supplement
description:
Something Zombie This Way Comes is another gaming supplement designed for the Pike & Shot & Zombie rules.

Inside this booklet players will find four new scenarios linked by a continuous storyline and populated by a host of new characters and new threats.

For years, troupes of travelling entertainers have moved from village to town to isolated hamlet - bringing a taste of exotic excitement to otherwise dreary lives. Always eagerly anticipated by the populace, these travelling shows were less enthusiastically received by the authorities who considered them to be nothing more than an excuse for sin and debauchery. In the village of Osthof one such troupe would arrive every year, emerging in the autumn gloom, at first a twinkling of lights far along the east road, then the faint sounds of pipe and drum. By the time the caravan rolled into the village, an excited crowd of children would already have assembled to welcome these new arrivals. But since the coming of the terrible undead plague - such visits have stopped. Now such distractions have ended and the survivors must focus on the grim business of their daily lives. Or at least, that is what they thought. After some years of absence, once again the gloom of a quiet autumn evening is pierced by twinkling lights on the road. Surely this cannot signal the arrival of another travelling troupe? How would they have survived on the road? What news will they bring from the outside? What sort of trouble will they stir-up in the village? Again, the villagers await the arrival of these exotic strangers with a mixture of apprehension and excitement. Do the survivors have an innate sense about these things, a feeling of foreboding and hidden menace? Well, you can bet that the more cynical and hard-bitten survivors will view these strangers with considerable caution - alert to the threat of infection from the deadly plague that these travellers might bring. If there is the slightest risk to the community, the survivors will have to fight this new threat or face losing everything.
categories: Adventure, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Renaissance, Wargame, Zombies

name: Global Conflict Master Rules
description:
These rules are generic, in that they will be useable for any era wargame.

The rules are in pdf format and you can find them in the files section of this page.

Like me, you are likely a war gamer who owns dozens of board games spanning from the 'Age of Sail' era to modern times. You have tactical games, operational ones, and a few grand strategic monsters. Yet each play is isolated with no meaning beyond the satisfaction of winning. Each victory is unconnected to others. Not any more.

Winning any one of your tabletop games earns you or your opponent one Command Point. (Command & Control) The Points are also earned during game-play when certain events happen. For instance, the capture of a city/town earns a Point. The sinking of a major warship wins a point or successful bombing mission by heavy bombers against an enemy target wins one.

The 'Master Game' depicted by my rules can include all of your tabletop games, miniatures play, and even video games. The idea is that each play represents a battle for a specific locale in the 'outer game'. Winning any of your games, and the points that success wins, drives your forces forward. It doesn't matter what era your tabletop game is, victory earns a Command & Control Point.

For example, if the 'Master Game' is to be WW2, you will track success of each of the War Powers of that era. War Power nations would be Germany, Great Britain, USA, Commonwealth, Italy, Russia, and Japan. Even playing solitaire works, since my rules don't require an opponent for use.

If you choose to personally lead Great Britain, all the other nations would be lead by NPC characters. These are Non-Player Characters. The points they win are kept note of in your records of the 'Umbrella War'. Those Points will come back in later tabletop games to give one side or the other the benefit of a die roll modifier, or die re-rolls.

In your play you would have a Strategic Leader for each major power nation in the war. If you wish, the 'Umbrella Game' can be set in any era. Age of Sail enthusiasts will have Kings and Emperors. Civil War players could have President Lincoln and Thomas Jefferson opposing him. You could play out WW1 or WW2 history. Modern war play is also easily incorporated in my concept.

You can use NPC Officers as Operational Level commanders for army, navy, and air forces. Optionally, these officers can collect Points when they succeed in their missions. Each play of one of your games represents an engagement between two of the War Powers. That game can be a Strategic, Operational, or Tactical game - with the same effect at the end. a Command Point for the winner. If you want to track individual Operational commanders, you would assign NPC officers for both sides in each game played. Before starting a new tabletop game, you consult your notes and compare the Points for each officer.

The side or Operational officer with the higher Points wins a die roll modifier for combat in the tabletop game about to start. Command Points won are accumulated in your 'Master Game' records. Individual game-play is meaningless any more. The concept is ideal for group or club play.

—description from the designer
categories: Wargame

name: Patriots & Loyalists & Zombies
description:
More historical zombie mayhem with Patriots & Loyalists & Zombies - the zombie survival game set during the American Revolution:

The Zombie Apocalypse has moved from the Old World to the New. As a new country struggles to emerge from revolution and civil war, it's very independence is now threatened by a force savage and deadly. In deep forests and lonely outposts, amongst the piles of fallen heroes a new danger twitches into life. This terrible threat possesses a hunger that cannot be satisfied - a craving for living human flesh that knows no bounds. The dead are beginning to walk again and no one is safe. Will the old divisions of loyalty and patriotism still persist? Or will humankind bury it's differences and join forces against the undead plague? Only you can decide!

This game is based on the Pike & Shot & Zombies rules (the Renaissance post-apocalyptic survival game) but is set during the time of the American War of Independence. The rules have the same basic mechanics as the previous set but obviously have a very different historical "feel". There are of course new weapons and new characters (and unfortunately for these survivors - far less armour!) There are also new scientific ideas which may hold an explanation or a way of countering the vile undead.

But some say that the deadliest threat still comes from mankind's inexhaustible capacity to destroy itself. Will the warring parties fighting for king or independence continue their struggle or stand together against this new danger? The Zombie History of the world continues with Patriots & Loyalists & Zombies...
categories: Adventure, American Revolutionary War, Book, Horror, Miniatures, Wargame, Zombies

name: Overkill: Mind Games – Psychic Warfare Expansion
description:
Mind Games is an exciting and amusing game supplement to the OVERKILL sci-fi skirmish rules.
Mind Games unlocks a whole range of psychic powers to terrorise and take-down your opponents. This supplement contains head-popping action, crazed acolytes, incoherent mind-slaves and many other features to liven-up the post-apocalypse battlefield.

This supplement also includes three scenarios that will introduce players to the new rules and allow them to gradually hone their skills (and the skills of those unfortunates who have to tackle them).
Mind Games also contains a section that details how this new faction can be used in OVERKILL campaign games and full rules for developing and improving psychic skills.

As if the world of OVERKILL wasn't dangerous enough - now their messing with your mind!

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Ruination
description:
Ruination is a game of epic combat between individual Heroes or small groups of warriors, rogues and spell-casters in an enchanted land filled with danger and the chance for glory.

Lead your Hero on their path of destiny and challenge any that stand in your way.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Turn Order: Random

name: Running Hot!: A Sulphur Scenario
description:
It's not getting any quieter in Sulphur City!
Rival factions are still battling for control of scarce resources - and for any other excuse they can find to fight.

Running Hot! is a new scenario that sets up a challenging little encounter for two or more players - and several hours of entertaining mayhem - using the 32mm post-apocalyptic battle rules Sulphur.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Sulphur Campaign
description:
Sulphur can be used to fight enjoyable one-off SF games using easy to organise forces of varying points cost. Alternately, players can opt for a longer series of joined-up battles against an opponent where success or failure will not be determined by one encounter but by a series of battles.

This is where the Sulphur Campaign rules come in. Here players can fight a series of interlinked battles that require strategic as well as tactical thinking. Problems of supply, resources and territory will have to be dealt with as well as the more usual concerns - such as smashing-up your enemy! In a campaign game, players must build up as many resources as possible, to increase the size and strength of their faction. As the opposing group will be trying to do the same thing, players will have to deploy their forces in the most effective way to counter this threat.

Sulphur Campaign has added a lot more background detail to the Sulphur World. A lively, unusual and often grim post-apocalyptic world that covers such elements as -
Trading, Scavenging, Spoils of War, Repairs, Ammo and Food supply, Tithes and Protection Money (from bigger meaner factions), the influence of the Church (only if you have paid your tithe), Shaman, Random Events, the Calendar (seasons of the Sulphur year) and the Weather (its usually not very nice!).
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Empires: The Battle of Marathon – Historical Battle Scenario
description:
Empires: The Battle of Marathon - Historical Battle Scenarios

This supplement allows players to re-enact decisive battles from history.

This is the first historical battle scenarios for use with all Empires rulesets. For the purposes of the average tabletop-wargame, the size of actual troop numbers have been scaled down so from what were used from thousands down to a few hundred.

The Historical Battle Scenarios only use units available from the Empires rulebooks.

Suitable for all Empires rulebooks: D6, D10, D20, Diceless and Colossus.

The Battle of Marathon was fought in 490BC, during the first Persian invasion of Greece between the people of Athens (aided by Plataea) and the Persian army. Under King Darius I, this battle was the Persians first attempt to take over Greece. The out numbered Greek army defeated the Persians in the Battle of Marathon and the battle marked the turning point in the Greco-Persian Wars, showing that the Persians could be beaten in battle.
categories: Ancient, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: SabreSquadron: Rules for Company-Level Miniatures Games from the Cold War to the Digital Age
description:
Sabresquadron is a set of rules for company-level wargaming from the Cold War to the Digital Age.

The rules are fast-moving and easy to pick up, and cover all the important factors including helicopters, guided missiles, the latest armours, engineering, drones and electronic warfare, through a set of robust and consistent mechanisms.

In a period that is awash with technology Sabresquadron represents the major elements but emphasises troop quality and the importance of the right tactics - the successful commander will use technology but not be a slave to it.

Although this is a mechanized era we don't forget the infantry so one can go to Goose Green with 2 Para as well as to 73 Easting with 2ACR, and there are specific rules for urban combat.

- Publisher blurb
categories: Book, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Bratzy
description: This dice game is similar to Yahtzee using metallic-coloured dice.
categories: Dice
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Push Your Luck, Re-rolling and Locking, Set Collection

name: Marvel Spider-Sense Spider-Man Action Game
description:
The goal of the Action Game is to get rid of all cards as quickly as possible. Deal 5 cards to each player, and put the rest in a face-down stack.
