A starting card from the top of the face-down stack is turned face-up on the table. Each player takes turns playing a card on top of the face-up stack, which must match either the symbol, color, or number of the current top card in that stack. If you don't have a matching card, you have to draw from the face-down stack. There are action cards which trigger changes in the game when played. Minimum number of players is 2.

It also comes with a second set of rules for the same 32 cards, called Happy Families or Quartets. The goal of this game is to collect as many families as possible (groups of 4 cards that belong together). With 2 players, deal 10 cards to each player, and place the remaining 12 cards in a face-down stack. One player begins by asking for a certain card; they must already have at least one card from that family. If the opponent does not have that card, then the player picks up the top card from the stack, and then it is the other player's turn. Or with 3 or more players, deal out all the cards equally among the players; and a player can continue asking for cards from selected opponents until they make a mistake (asking for a card that the person asked doesn't have). Whoever collects the most sets of 4 wins.

--user summary
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: I'm Gunna Make Mince Meat Outa you!: Rules for Bar Brawling in the Old West
description: I'm Gunna Make Mince Meat Outa you! is a rule set for bar brawling in the setting of the old west. It uses a unique activation system to simulate the havoc and inconsistency of attitudes in the bar.
categories: American West, Book, Fighting, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Tigers: A Game of Paper Miniatures
description:
Tigers: A Game of Paper Miniatures is a balanced game of tabletop warfare that utilizes the economy of paper.

These easy to learn rules, and easy to make units will provide hours of gaming experience.
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Panzer Korps: Divisional Level Warfare 1936-1945 – 10th Anniversary Edition
description:
PANZER KORPS 10th Anniversary Edition allows players to recreate the World at War in Miniature from 1935 to 1945 at the Battalion level.

Players command Divisions and Brigades.
Features HRG’s Theater based Terrain Generation System.
Unique National Characteristics seamlessly managed by the rules.


Includes Advanced Rules for extra detail.
Integrates Air Power seamlessly and is a vital part of the strategy.
Use Military Police, Medical personnel, Ground Crews, Tank Recovery, Cavalry & other various support Companies as they were intended!
More rules enhancements and clarifications than the 1st Edition
No re-basing needed to play & works with most scales!
Can be used with Regiment and Division sized boardgames to resolve key battles.
Well supported with over twenty handbooks including Campaign Master System, Scenarios, & Army Books!
Comprehensive Vehicle and Aircraft National ratings and advanced rules.
Games can be concluded within 3 to 4 hours and have a clear decision!
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Dot
description:
The board made by card board is under a hard plastic foil. The board shows dozens of colored dots. The rest of the content: 2 wax pens, 1 sharpener, 1 ruler, and 1 die. 2 game rules are offered. In the easier one, each of the 2 players (sitting opposite each other on the narrow side of the board) chooses a dot to start at their base line. According to the roll of a colored die they draw a line to the dot of the corresponding color without touching any other dot. It is not allowed to cross drawn lines. The first player who reaches the opposite side wins.
The more difficult rule let one of the players start in the center of the game. Players alternatively draw lines trying to reach their base line. It is allowed to cross drawn lines.

—user summary
categories: Unspecified
mechanics: Area Movement, Connections, Line Drawing, Network and Route Building, Point to Point Movement

name: Choose One!: Fluxx or Looney Pyramids
description: A one-card promo expansion that was initially available in the Looney Labs Mammoth Fun Pack.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: ShadowSea: Conquest of the Underground World
description:
Battle to conquer a lost underground world full of ethereal magic and ancient artifacts! Players can choose from different distinct forces, human pirates and fortune hunters, dragon-men, amazonian sorceresses with savage beastmen, and others. Games are played with small sides so players do not need to invest in massive armies, just specialized warbands of personality characters and troops, and battles can be played in an hour. Take your forces into fungal forest, crumbling ruins, and dinosaur filled jungles in campaigns of multiple scenarios where each member of a warband can gain advancements as they win battles and gather treasure. But beware of wild creatures, as they have their own AI rules that allow them to hunt any model on the board. The book comes complete with all of the core rules as well as descriptions of all weapons, armor, tech artifacts, magic and special abilities for all characters and has the roster for the main forces as well as all wild creatures. In addition, the book includes a section detailing the different environments that players can explore and do battle within and descriptions of all of the different terrain types that can be encountered. Finally, there is a complete toolkit in the back that shows how to build your own custom characters or edit existing ones using a simple point calculation system.

– RULES BASED ON AWARD-WINNING SONG OF BLADES AND HEROES by Ganesha Games but with extensive additional rules, weapons, armor, technology items (akin to magic items) and new combat and movement options. ShadowSea include a detailed combat system that allows for targeting different body parts or subsystems. The activation system allows players to choose a basic free action or gamble on rolling dice for more complex actions. Game cards for miniatures are tarot sized (4.75 by 2.75 inch), giving room to include all of the descriptions of Special Abilities, Weapons, Armor and Tech Items. This means much less referencing the rulebook and faster gameplay for all. Sets of game cards can be downloaded in PDF format in the Download section of the website.

– 3D GAMEPLAY: In ShadowSea, the game a distinct three-dimensional feel with models able to climb terrain, leap across open areas and push or break scenic items. Models can also swim underwater or do battle upon boats in the Shadow Sea. The game is 100% compatible with DeepWars, so players can have full land-sea battles.

– INTENSE COMBAT, MAGIC AND TECHNOLOGY in the underground realm. Spellcasters can wield multiple magical spell types, including dimensional magic that allows unsavory spellcasters to call forth beings from the ethereal void. Scientists can discover artifacts with tremendous power or design and improve upon their own ether technology to upgrade and create new items.

– SKIRMISH WITH RPG FLAVOR: Combination of 28mm scale miniature tabletop wargame with campaign advancement and a role-playing flavor. The game can be played in single sessions of an hour, or as a campaign where warbands salvage ancient technology, design their own new tech items, enhance abilities and generally become powerful lords of the deep.

– TOURNAMENT RULES – The rulebook has an entire section on running tournaments, complete with scoring and timekeeping, as well as new Special Operations that each player gets for a scenario. The Spec-Ops are special missions that a warband can accomplish during a scenario to gain bonus Victory Points.

ShadowSea has many features that make it a flexible gaming system that is perfect for beginners but deep enough for experienced gamers.


SIMPLE RULES that can be learned in one game, using 6-sided dice for rolls for combat, physical activities, spellcasting, using ancient technology or any other action during the game.
FAST GAMES, lasting around an hour, with game models on each side alternating their turns of activation so that all players can stay in the flow of the game.
SMALL WARBANDS of 4-8 models, so that anyone can have a warband destined for glory without spending a fortune.
EASY MOVEMENT rules based on three measurement sticks.
TABLETOP PLAY allows players to build a map on any 1 meter-square surface without the need for a grid. Just add scenery and start the game.
LITTLE TO NO BOOKKEEPING! The models in a warband are represented by a basic block of two statistics and a few special abilities. Game cards come with miniatures so players have all of their abilities and rules in their hand,
MAGIC AND TECHNOLOGY interweave in the Underlands. Warbands may battle using arcane magical spells or ancient technological weapons in the mysterious underground realm.
ACTION BASED GAMEPLAY means that models have many choices of actions besides simply whacking each other across the skull. Leap chasms, climb pillars, break through walls, set explosives or try something unexpected.
SIX COMPLETE FORCES battle in their quest for ancient artifacts. Over 300 heroes, fiends, wild creatures, ethereal demons, ancient mechanical constructs and stygian monsters.
categories: Book, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Clutch
description:
Chaos meets strategy in three fast paced games.

You Bet There’s Danger

(2-4 players, 25 minutes)

Cars progress along a track by flipping cards with specific actions. Players place secret bets (numbers -3 to 5) on which color of car they think will win. As the cars get closer to the finish line, it is more evident which color seems likeliest to win. But if the car over shoots the finish line by too much, they plummet of a cliff, opening the door for a different winner. When a car has passed the finish line, total up number of bets on that color car. Highest score out of three races wins.

F1 Solo

(1 player, 10 minutes)

Try to get all four cars into a specific order by manipulating the action cards. You’ll win if none of the cards fall off the edge, and if you end with the right order of cars. Simple strategic filler…

Round Three

(3-4 players, 35 minutes)

Race around a winding track while collecting pickups, shooting other cars, laying traps, and collecting nitro. Upgrade your car for extra movement every turn. Each time a car rounds the finish line, they gain points based on the distance between them and the car in last place.

Movement is determined by flipping action cards.

—description from the designer
categories: Racing
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Predictive Bid, Race, Relative Movement

name: スーパーマーケット (Supermarket)
description:
The trick-taking game スーパーマーケット (Supermarket) was released as part of the publisher ruri ruri games' (るりるりゲームズ) Autumn 2017 box of trick-taking games, titled トリテセット1 (Trick Taking Set 1).

The game is player with a deck of 36 cards, consisting of ranks 1 to 9 in four suits. The cards also have a number of symbols on them, corresponding to the suit. The game uses a board which tracks how many symbols of each suit a player may score. Thematically, the players are determining the optimal ratios of shelving products in a supermarket, and players who exceed the position of a marker on the board have overfilled their shelves, with product falling on the floor.

These limits on the board are determined once each round. Specifically, when at least one player has played a card of the same suit as was lead, the marker is placed on the position corresponding to the highest rank of this suit played to the trick, excluding the winning card.

At the end of a hand, the player(s) who collected cards with the most symbols of each suit, without exceeding the limit, earn 1 point each. The players complete a number of rounds equal to the number of players, and the player with the most points wins.
categories: Card Game
publishers: るりるりゲームズ (ruri ruri games)

name: Matter and Antimatter
description:
Matter and Antimatter is an abstract strategy game played on a square board with a square grid; suggested board sizes are 8x8 and 18x18, rhough others can be used. Each player has enough pieces to fill the two rows nearest them at the start.

On their turn a players rolls dice, with the number being scaled to the board size; one die is suggested for the 8x8 board and three for the 18x18 board. The roll determines the number of moves that can be made; a piece can move to any of the five adjacent squares ahead or to the side of it. However, pieces can be moved on top of friendly pieces and a stack of pieces costs as many moves to go one space as the number of pieces in it.

A stack can only be moved onto an opposing stack if the latter is smaller; in this case the entire opposing stack is removed as well as an equal number of pieces from the moving stack.

The game ends when a player cannot make any possible move (in which case their opponent wins) or a player has advanced all their pieces to the other side of the board (in which case they win).

The game was first published in World Game Review #2.

—user summary
categories: Abstract Strategy

name: Latino
description:
Latino is a simple deduction game for two players. Each player creates a Latin square of the same size - 8x8 is suggested. (A Latin square of side N has the numbers 1-N appearing once in each row and once in each column; a completed Sudoku grid is a 9x9 Larin square.)

Players take turns asking for the sum of the numbers in two or three adjacent squares in a single row or column of their opponent's board. A three-square question cannot contain any of the two-square questions.

The object is to deduce the exact layout of your opponent's grid first.

The game was first described in World Game Review #2.

—user summary
categories: Deduction, Number

name: うなぎと梅干 すいかと天ぷら (Unagi Umeboshi Suika Tempura)
description:
The trick-taking game うなぎと梅干 すいかと天ぷら (Unagi Umeboshi Suika Tempura) was released as part of the publisher ruri ruri games' (るりるりゲームズ) Autumn 2017 box of trick-taking games, titled トリテセット1 (Trick Taking Set 1).

The game is player with a deck of 36 cards, consisting of ranks 1 to 9 in four suits. The game is themed around food pairings that traditionally are believed to upset one's stomach: eel and pickled plums; or watermelon and tempura.

In the game players will receive points for each pair of eel and plum cards they have collected at the end of a round, as well as each watermelon and tempura pair. Players will also be able to discard points for each 5 eel cards collected, as they have consumed enough nutrition.

At the end of a given number of rounds, the player with the most points loses.
categories: Card Game
publishers: るりるりゲームズ (ruri ruri games)

name: ShadowSea: Battle of Deepwood Forest
description:
ShadowSea – Battle of Deadwood Forest is a two-player game set in the Underlands near the Shadow Sea, where the Axibalan Empire fights against their rebellious creations, the Draconid Legion. The warbands are in search of a crumbling ancient city filled with artifacts and battle across multiple environments, from grasslands to fungal forests and raging rivers.

The set includes:

3 Axibalán Empire Models (Coszcatl, Amatzl Dragon Hunter, Ancient Sentinel Mech), 3 Draconid Legion Models (Taranis the Gray, Cobalt Salamander, Harlequin Witch Hunter), 2 RipperClaw Lizards
6 Warband model cards, 4 Creature model cards, 10 Special Operation cards, 10 plastic card sleeves
1 dry erase marker
4 Maps 18 x 24 inch
2 Warband Record Sheets, Printed status markers, Printed scenery & Wild Creature markers, Printed movement sticks
3 six-sided dice
56 page rulebook with a campaign of 8 scenarios and advancement rules for warbands between scenarios


—description from the publisher
categories: Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement

name: DeepWars: Nereids of Blood Reef – Warband Starter Set
description:
This set of four miniatures contains a battle-tested Nereid warband for DeepWars, ready for combat.
The set includes a leader to help command and coordinate the warband, a treasure seeker to help salvage artifacts, an elite guardian of the reef and an enchantress to cast powerful spells.

1 x Cymopoleia – Nereid Sorceress (30mm base)
1 x Eidothera – Nereid Captain (30mm base)
1 x Nereid guardian of the reef (30mm base)
1 x Nereid Treasure Seeker (30mm base)


(Miniatures are supplied unpainted and assembly may be required.)

The set comes with

game cards for each miniature,
printed quickstart rules set,
a sheet of game counters and
a Warband Record Sheet.


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Combat Leader: Game Component Set A
description: Combat Leader: Component Set A has German and Russian and German Volkssturm soldiers, and contains maps 1, 2, 3, 4, 5; counter sheets A, B, C, D; sheet of game markers; three scenario cards, two Reference Cards, eight scenarios (six from CL: East Front, and two from CL: Volkssturm), a four-page special rule/scenario folder, but no core rules.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Collective Hangman
description:
Collective Hangman is something of a cross between Hangman and Ghost. It can be played by two people or teams, or in theory by more than two individuals.

The game begins with a player writing a number of blanks representing a word. The players or teams then alternate asking each other if a given letter appears in the word; the opposing side may answer "yes" and fill in one blank with the letter (the letter could be asked again and another blank filled), or "no" and write the letter in the dead area. Letters in the dead area cannot appear in the word.

Unlike in Hangman there is no specific word players are trying to guess. Instead a round continues until someone challenges. If an answer is challenged, the player answering must fill in the remaining blanks with valid letters to form a word, or lose a life. If a question is challenged, the player asking must demonstrate a possible answer that would narrow down the words that could fit, or lose a life. (In either case if the challenged player succeeds the challenger loses a life.)

Rounds are played until one player or team has lost all their lives.

The game was presented in World Game Review #4.

—user summary
categories: Deduction, Word Game

name: Lachaino
description:
Lachaino is a deduction game for two players. Each player makes a chain of consecutive numbers that fills a square grid; for example, if 10x10 grids are used, each player fills a grid with the numbers 1-100 with each number adjacent to the previous one.

On a turn a player specifies a 2x2 section of the grid and the opposing player gives the product of the four numbers it contains, broken down into prime factors.

The object is to reconstruct the opponent's chain in the fewest number of guesses. If a player finds that one or both ends of the chain are ambiguous due to all four end numbers being in a 2x2 section, they may leave these undefined for a half-guess penalty each.

The game was first presented in Hopscotch #65 and then printed in World Game Review #8.

—user summary
categories: Deduction, Math, Number

name: Zombie Daze: Survivors 1
description:
Yet more Survivors trying to live in an undead world! Intended for play with the Frontline Command Skirmish Zombie Daze tabletop game. One plays music, one believes, and one just fights. As Officier Williams would say - “We all deal with it in our own way!”

This box set contains three "Survivor" characters: Tyler John (TJ) - The Teen Guitarist, Reverend Fist - The Believer, and Officer Clarence Williams–The Law

Each comes with a respective character card.

Survivors 1 is an expansion set for ZOMBIE DAZE.

A copy of ZOMBIE DAZE rules is required to play the expansion.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, Zombies

name: Inhumane Resources
description:
The HR Director has announced that in 6 months time she will be retiring and now each team leader must vie for the HR Directors Job.

Inhumane Resources is a light card game where players assume the role of a Team Leader vying for the latest promotion.

Set-up:

Shuffle the deck of resource cards and deal a hand of 7 to each player. Then place the remainder face down in the middle of the table within reach of all players.

Shuffle each numbered task deck seperately and place on the table face down in order of difficulty (1-3).

Randomly decide a starting player.

Gameplay:

Play takes place over a series of 6 round's (representing months) where one Team Leader chooses a task to complete from a varying assortment of difficulties. The harder the task, the more favour (points) rewarded. The starting player decides on one Task to take of the 3 difficulty levels and reveals it to all the players.

The task will outline requirements needed to fulfill the task. Such as:

- Computer Hacking Scandal -
Requirements: 4 IT, 1 Operations and 3 Marketing.
Reward: 8 Favour

The Team Leader must resolve this task in order to earn the Favour, however, they may call on others to help complete this task. The other players may contribute to the (hopeful) success, and ask for a share of the Favour. All players can offer their help and expertise based on resource cards they have in hand which range from Executive, Budget, IT, Operations, Marketing. However they are allowed to lie about what they can contribute.

Once all deals have been made, all players that are involved must put forward their contribution to the task face down. They are then all revealed.

If all the requirements have been met then the task is a success and the current player hands out the agreed share of Favour to the involved players.

If not all the requirements have been met then task is a failure and all involved players lose 2 Favour.

Going clockwise the next player takes their turn, choosing a Task.

Once all players have had a turn, the round is over and players replenish their hands back to 7.

Round 2 then starts, however with the player to the left of the starting player.

End of the Game:

After six rounds the player that has the most favour with the MD wins the game.

-description from publisher
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction

name: Cruel Seas: Royal Navy Vosper MTB Flotilla
description:
At the outbreak of war, Britain had 3 formed MTB flotillas, precious few to cover the world’s largest empire. But with judicious use of what were pre-war civilian boatyards and the huge resources of their empire and help from the USA, the Coastal Forces would in 1944 have 25,000 sailors in over 2000 small craft!

These Flotillas, enhanced by Commonwealth, Dutch, Norwegian, French, and other free forces sank over 400 enemy vessels, including 48 E-boats and 32 midget submarines. They also accounted for 32 axis aircraft and fired in total 1169 very expensive torpedoes. This impressive tactical achievement contributed mightily to the allied strategic successes. It ensured that Britain was not isolated for trade. It put a stranglehold on Axis Supply lines and ultimately formed a force that could not be resisted, so much so that by the D Day landings in 1944, the Kriegsmarine was impotent to resist.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: NVES
description:
NVES is an abstract game where you have to be the first to get 7 tiles of the same color, or be the majority in the maximum number of colors.
In turn the player can recover as many tiles of the same color as he wishes, if these are cleared on 2 sides. And so on until one of the two end-of-game and victory conditions is met.
NVES is a freely adapted game, not officially, of the SEVN application on iOS.

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy

name: Cruel Seas: Kriegsmarine S-Boat Flotilla
description:
The Schnellboat or ‘E Boat’ as the British Admiralty called them, E for enemy, was a truly formidable beast, in many ways incomparable in detail to the other nation’s boats.

In sheer size alone, the E boat was much, much bigger. Allied boats tended to be 70-80 feet in length, the E boat 115 feet long, and the laws of physics, though complex, favour a larger hull for speed over a shorter one.

German engineering also gave them another advantage, as when speed reached 25 knots, a crank mechanism when turned moved 2 side rudders to flare, symmetrically outward at 30 degrees, creating an air-filled hollow space, the so-called Lürssen effect. This gave three distinct advantages, greater speed, a reduction in the tell-tale wake of the speeding boat, and finally settled the boat in a more efficient plane, leaving the vessel shallower in the water, most useful in mine and torpedo infested waters and remarkable for a boat weighing in at 100 tons!

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Domino Room
description:
Domino Room is a tile laying game in which the tiles have two ends, each with a color and a dice number. The tiles visually are intended to look like corridors in a dungeon that the players' pieces are traversing.

Each turn, players may either add a tile to the dungeon (if the tile matches certain attributes of the adjoining sections); discard a tile from their hand to move their piece a number of spaces equal to the die value shown; or discard tiles from their hand and draw replacements.

There are several types of special tiles, and some have treasure. The winner is the first player to collect each of their treasure and make it to the exit tile.
categories: Unspecified
publishers: popipopo games (ぽぴぽぽゲームズ)

name: Cruel Seas: US Navy PT boat flotilla
description:
On December 7th, 1941, the US Navy could only boast 3 squadrons of motor torpedo boats, or PT boats (patrol torpedo) as they were named. PT squadron 1 was based on Pearl Harbor and the 12 boats opened fire on the incoming Japanese bombers, claiming 2 planes downed for sure and others damaged. Squadron 2 was based in Manila Bay of the Philippines and had a similar introduction to their war, shooting down a few attackers and learning that fast boats were a tricky target for bombers. Squadron 3 was in New York working up and would later see great service in Guadalcanal.

The PT boats fought all over the globe, from Pearl Harbor to the Philippines, the Adriatic and Mediterranean and also in the English Channel. They achieved many successes, particularly in the last two years of the Pacific War they accounted for many stalking float planes and many hundreds of barges which were the lifeblood of the overextended Japanese army. This barge hunting was a gruelling business and needed a certain ruthlessness on the behalf of the American crews, Japanese soldiers and sailors being loath to surrender, hence a grizzly end to many a barge crew.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Defeat the Monster Twice
description:
In Defeat the Monster Twice, players aim to defeat each monster twice. Players will have a hand of sword cards, of various values and various suits. A monster is revealed from a central deck, and it has a certain suit and a number of bats pictured on the bottom. The players are looking for those bats, as the wings can be used to make medicine, and, as such, they sell well.

After the monster is revealed, each player plays two sword cards from their hand, and the player with the highest sum wins the battle. There are bonuses for swords that match the suit of the monster, and any tied players are removed from consideration.

Each player then draws 2 cards from a central deck to replenish their hand. However, the player who played the lowest sum of swords takes one of the two swords played by the winning player and adds it to their hand.

After a certain number of monsters, each player reveals the monsters they have defeated once, and must defeat them again. These battles are on your own. In this second battle, each monster's strength is the number of bats on the card. Each player reveals 2 sword cards from their hand. If the number of bats is less than the sum of the sword cards, the player earns a number of points equal to the bats. If there are more bats than the sum of the sword cards, the player also loses a number of points equal to the bats that exceeded the sword value.

The player with the most points wins.
categories: Card Game
publishers: popipopo games (ぽぴぽぽゲームズ)

name: NuGEMS Inc
description:
Welcome new employee to NuGEMS Inc! In your new position here you and your fellow employees will be using our patented process to create artificial precious gemstones. Unfortunately many of our employees seem to be accepting bribes to create over stocks of gemstones forcing the company to sell at discount rates.

In NuGEMS Inc you'll attempt to achieve your goal while your opponents are ready to sabotage you to achieve theirs. Each turn draw a new card to your hand, then choose to either discard and redraw your hand or expand the crop of gems by playing a card in up to a 4 by 4 space.

Watch out, your fellow employees may choose to sabotage your efforts by causing some of the gem growth to explode and may even replace it with their preferred gem growth.

Once the play space has been filled the game ends and scoring begins. The player that scores the highest based on their chosen bribe wins!

OOPS!

Not all Players choose to accept bribes and will be working to achieve a balanced crop of gemstones ruining your chances of cashing in on those bribes!

—description from the designer
categories: Industry / Manufacturing

name: Corporate Sharks
description:
Welcome to the quiet pristine country of Unincorporated, a small country that's never allowed foreign corporate business within their borders. Until now. Unincorporated is quickly going bankrupt and has voted to finally allow these businesses to take root and help grow this small land into a thriving group of metropolises.

You will be taking charge of one of these opportunistic corporations looking to establish a foothold and to dominate this untouched land of new opportunity. Bid on shares of the various cities to earn big profits. Control how your corporation does business by purchasing and implementing different Corporate Structure tiles giving you new abilities, additional income and other bonuses.

Auction System
Every Round players will have the opportunity to bid on a select number of City Shares. Collections of these Shares will grant their owners additional income that came be ever increased to help you in your victory. Spend your hard earned Credits on these valuable divides to earn more credits later as you gain complete sets. There's no limit to the bidding so be careful your opponents aren't just inflating the price for you!

Buildings
The cities provide those Corporations with sets of Shares with additional Credits every Income Phase based on the buildings already built in the city by yourself or other Corporations. Make a city into a profit hub, or donate public spaces to gain Positive Public Opinion. Some buildings even provide special abilities to shareholders!

Corporate Structure
Each corporation's Structure starts with their Corporate Structure Board. It includes 1 ability unique to that corporation and 2 branches to start your Corporate Structure Tree. Buy new tiles from the Corporate Structure Store and add them to your tree of abilities and bonuses. Infrastructure Tiles will provide additional income, provide the ability to expand your tree, and help you to find Building Materials and Corporate Structure Tiles. Corporate Espionage Tiles with let you to attack and sabotage your opponents with a variety of dirty business practices. Defense Tiles will help to protect your corporation against attacks and keep the general public in your back pocket.

The Game That Plays Back!
In Corporate Sharks you aren't just playing against your corporate rivals but against the game itself. The last ditch effort of Unincorporated to allow corporations entrance hasn't gone over well with the public. Most are fearful that these conglomerates will turn their beautiful country into a giant fast food shack and are quick to boycott and protest any corporation they feel is taking advantage. To quell these annoying profit interruptions, donate public spaces, with you logo proudly displayed of course. Or use your Corporate Structure to add employee day cares to show your dedication to providing for these fine people. Keep them extremely happy and they may even help you win the game!

—description from the publisher
categories: City Building

name: A Night in the Pirates Den
description:
You and your cohorts have been around the world and pillaged the seven seas! Returning to your den the festivities begin. The ale and rum is poured and stories told. Tomorrow the plunder will be divvied up, but why wait when you can satisfy your desires tonight!

While everyone is distracted you’ll get your chance to steal the loot you want the most, just make sure you do before any of your cohorts do.

A Night in the Pirates Den combines dexterity and take-that mechanics while everyone is striving to achieve their Desires before anyone else can. Or before someone else messes up all of your plans!

—description from the publisher
categories: Pirates

name: Zombie Daze: Survivors 2
description:
Yet more Survivors trying to live in an undead world! Intended for play with the Frontline Command Skirmish Zombie Daze tabletop game.
One plays music, one protects, and one believes in being preapred. and one who just has lost his belief!

This box set contains three "Survivor" characters: Julie, the Protector, Lance, the Prepared & Leroy the Disenchanted.

Each comes with a respective character card.

Survivors 2 is an expansion set for ZOMBIE DAZE.

A copy of ZOMBIE DAZE rules is required to play the expansion.

All 28mm metal miniatures come unpainted and may require some assembly.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, Zombies

name: Stir Crazy Quarantine
description:
A single-player game of survival during a virus outbreak.

The player goes through the order of the day. First, the player flips a coin to see if they bother to get out of bed. second, the player flips a card to see if they bothered to do anything at night. If your quarantine zone gets too dirty you will get stressed out. If you get too stressed out in quarantine you will lose the game. If a player can handle the full 45-day quarantine they win!

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Print & Play

name: Orc Vs Elf: A Micro Chapbook Wargame – Ultra Simple Rules for Fast Wargaming
description:
The great Orc Horde has invaded the Elvin borders. The king has sent his best Elvin warriors to stop them. Who will win?

Orc Vs Elf is a Micro Chapbook Wargame--an ultra-light miniatures skirmish game that fits in a single folded chapbook. Simply print off the two rules pages back-to-back, fold in half, and you have a completely playable Micro Chapbook Wargame.

These rules are specially designed for solo play but may also be used as quick and simple rules for a one on one miniatures game. Combine with other Micro Chapbook Wargames for extra options!

—description from the publisher
categories: Fantasy, Miniatures, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Peur sur la Ville
description:
Miniature wargame ruleset to simulate gang wars in a modern setting or the zombie apocalypse.

- Published in French
categories: Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame, Zombies

name: Spiel der Arbeit: "Kleiner Mann, was nun...?"
description:
Each player (blue: locksmith, red: butcher, green: farmer, black: salesman) starts with a workgroup of 4 workers at the starting point B of their color. Movement is determined by a die. On the roll of a 1 the player puts a worker on the space of his color of the employment exchange (Arbeitsamt) and rolls again. If a worker gets on a corner space (factory, butchery, farmland, department store)with doesn't fit his profession, he has to return to the employment exchange. If a worker would get on an occupied space and the player occupying this space shouts: "Kleiner Mann was nun?" the arriving worker is returned to the employment exchange. If the other player isn't paying attention, his worker goes to the employment exchange.
If a worker gets on a space labor service (Arbeitsdienst)of another color, the player loses 3 turns. On a space of his color, he may immediately roll 3 times. If a worker lands on the train he advances 12 spaces or 6 spaces if he lands on the ship.
A worker who reaches the last white space in front of the employment exchange space of his color, enters space C of his color. The first player to get his whole workgroup into space C of his color wins the game.

—user summary
categories: Economic
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Курка чи яйце? (Chicken or Egg?)
description:
A game for 2 players. The players have to answer the eternal question: Which came first – the chicken or the egg?

At the beginning of the game, players choose who will play the role of chicken and egg. To win a round you have to lay out vertical, horizontal or diagonal row of three your Character tiles. The players have to lay out tiles forming 3×3 square (similar to Tic-Tac-Toe).
categories: Abstract Strategy

name: Cold War³!: Carabinieri – Italian Military Police
description:
The Carabinieri, have been deployed countless times on peacekeeping missions, & as support for the Italian Army that is deployed to Iraq and Afghanistan.
Armed with this book you can field a ‘straight up’ Carabinieri force for urban patrolling right through to a specialised Anti-Terrorist force including the famous GIS (Italian SWAT); plus the support elements such as ‘Toscana’ –Carabinieri Parachute Infantry.
You can field the Calabria and Sardinia Light Infantry Companies for anti-Mafia operations.
Sniper teams, dog teams and rapid intervention Heliborne teams!
Completing this lavish volume is the section on the Armed Forces of Italy a massive Table of Equipment & Organisation allowing you to field every known variant of mechanised, alpine, cavalry and armoured Regiments currently fielded by the Italian Army –both for deployment in a NATO ‘what if?’ scenario as well as to Iraq, Afghanistan and on any UN peacekeeping deployment such as Lebanon (1982), Somalia (1993) and so on!

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Mafia, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Stars & Lasers!!: Even More Lasers...
description:
In this Even More Lasers... supplement you will find a selection of extras that you can add to your games of Stars & Lasers.

Inside you will find two new ships, one is a ship from humanities past, the Leviathan, a super heavy battleship from the early wars, the other is the Escort Flak Boat, a ship built to counter enemy fighters and missiles.

Also included are rules for a new shield switching system that can be used to counter non-energy weapons.

You will also find the rules for using new deadly MkI Torpedoes and the fearful Nova Bomb Projector, these two new weapons systems will add some deadly firepower to your fleets.

Also included are the rules for four types of mines and how they are used in your games.

So just like the main rules, you are free to add as little or as much as you want of these extras to make your games of Stars & Lasers the way you want them to be.
—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Flames of War: All American
description:
America has entered the war and its newest branch of the army, the airborne divisions, are ready for action. Every paratrooper is a volunteer, equipped with the best equipment US industry can provide. Each paratrooper is a keenly honed weapon poised to strike at the heart of the enemy, trained to operate as a deadly team.

Field the All American US Para and Rangers Formations in Mid War (1942-1943) with Death From Above.
From Operation Torch in Algeria in 1942 to the Italian campaign.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Warlord: Saga of the Storm 4th Edition – Learn-to-Play Set
description:
Two ready-to-play decks with 50 cards each, a CHESSEX Gemini 20-sided dice, and a Quick Start Rules Sheet enclosed - everything you need to start playing with a friend.

Deep in the jungles of Ne-rubu Tabaqu drums that were silent for a thousand years can be heard again. An ancient evil is on the rise.
Honoring the new alliance between Morghen Dythanus are the Vaneris, the Queen of the Merelves sends her daughter Yvaalis up the Tabaqu Agû to find out more...
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Warlord: Saga of the Storm – Justice of the Black Sun
description:
After being thrown into the new lands of Thessyria, the armies of the Accordlands find the land ruled by a mysterious otherworldly race, The Chosen. All resistance in the once proud desert empire has been squashed by the new tyrants. All resistance? Scouts return with reports, that not everything might be as the new rulers wish. Nothrog raiders emerge from the mangrove swamps of Eban-Tarsis and in the port city of Takkaz drunken sailors tell wild stories of ghost ships drifting in the winds and strange lights under the surface. Could the rumors be true of an Elven Empire leagues under the sea?

The second expansion arc for the increasingly successful 4th Edition of the "game you already know how to play" centers around the skirmishes along the long seashore of Thessyria. It explores the Water aspect of the new elemental magic system and features the first heroes that players could win for their faction in the world-wide Winter Campaign event series.

Justice of the Black SunTwo Decks with 110 Cards and Rulebook enclosed - everything you need to start playing with a friend.
"Ships laden with horses and armored knights have arrived in Akkaz. Led by their iron-fisted Commander Kaiten the Order of the Black Sun intends to set up a new chapter and to recover from their recent losses. Watching them from the mangrove swamps of southern Eban-Tarsis Grilt Fenstalker only waits for them to bring their treasures to him. Will the might of Deverenia prevail in such unfamiliar terrain?"

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: BlueGetaway: Longing for Summer
description:
BlueGetaway is about a group of friends enjoying their summer vacation on a paradise Island. Lots of cool summer activities await them. As the island is a surfer paradise, surfing is the thing all of them want to do the most. In the beginning however, this is not so easy! First you have to visit the local surf shop and get yourself a great surfboard. Now the surfing fun can begin. The players try to qualify for surf contests which take place from time to time. The contest is then be held between the players who qualified for it. Special contest cards are used for this. Trying to win a contest is action-packed and thrilling for everyone involved. The player who won the most contests at the end of the game is the winner. But beware! Sometimes there are riptides or even a shark appears in the clear blue waters. Then you have to leave the water again. But you can prepare yourself. Put a lifeguard station on your beach so that dangerous ripcurrents can not harm you any more. Or engage with the local fishermen to catch the shark out of your waters. There are many more special effects that may happen. Some jellyfish might help you, or you can take some extra surfing training. But beware of the tropical thunderstorms which sometimes hit this paradise island! There is a lot to experience during your summer vacation - maybe even a summer romance might happen to you if you are lucky! Enjoy the summer with BlueGetaway!

BlueGetaway is a picture based card game and is not related to any specific language. It is suited for families and parties as well.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Party Game

name: Flames of War: D-Day – Global Campaign
description:
Flames of War: D-Day – Global Campaign
This campaign pack can not only be used as a supplement to the Online Campaign, but can also be played as a store campaign- perfect for a weekend tournament, or a regular Firestorm campaign at your local store or gaming club.

It can be run alongside the Global Campaign either as a focal point for the club during the Campaign, or as your own campaign on your own time.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Poochie Pretty as a Picture game
description:
Poochie Pretty as a Picture Game is a game for 2-4 players, ages 4-8, in which you use your memory and matching skills to collect photos of Poochie and her Pals to fill up your photo album.

Setup the Spinner to the side and lay out a grid of Photo cards face down. Shuffle the cards and place the cards in a 4x4 grid face down, placing the unplaceded cards in a deck next to the grid. refill cards from the deck to the grid when cards are removed. Each player places a "Photo Album" player board in front of them.
Starting with the youngest player going first.
Spin the spinner to see which of Poochie's Pals you are looking for. Then flip a card to find a match to the character you spun. If you match the spun Character, place it on your Album. If you did not match, flip the card back over. Use your memory skills to remember where cards are to find them later.
Then the next player takes their turn, repeat.

First player to fill their Photo Album with 6 Photos of Poochie and her Pals Wins. (they do not need to be unique photos to win)
categories: Children's Game, Memory

name: Play Animal
description:
A Game of Strategy.

This Fun Item is Excellent Condition - All Unpunched - Rare Find.

Object - The game plays on the natural instincts between dog,cat and mouse.

The mouse wary of the cat tries to eat cheese while the cat hunting the mouse watches for the dog.

The player who succeeds in getting all there opponent's cheeses is the winner of the game.
categories: Animals

name: Battles in Deep Space
description:
Battles in Deep Space is a two player abstract game of star ship battles. Players customize their forces by picking four ships out of the twelve options. Each ship has it's own unique move pattern, attacks with one three dice options, and some have special abilities.

On a player's turn they move one of their ship and then they may attack with a ship. The attacking ship does not have to be the moving ship. Attacks are resolved by rolling a six-sided, eight-sided, or ten-sided die. Hits are scored on a six or higher. The first player to destroy all of the other player's ships wins.

—user summary
categories: Abstract Strategy, Print & Play, Science Fiction

name: Tom Sawyer on the Mississippi
description:
Roll and move game in which you use a spinner (Wheel of Fate) for movement to move your character (Tom, Huck Finn, Aunt Polly or Jim)to move around to board. The board starts in the Village of St. Petersburgh and you will explore the adventures which Tom Sawyer had when he set out on his raft.

The first person who returns back to the Village of St. Petersburgh is the winner. You must spin the exact number to go out.

—user summary
categories: Novel-based

name: Medical Line
description:
A game to record the fight against the 2019-nCoV
A new way of identification. In the game, cards connect players closely.
Each player holds scattered information, and finally builds his own most confident route through communication. The game idea comes from "Ask for directions" in Life.

—description from the designer
categories: Medical
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Network and Route Building, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Semi-Cooperative Game, Traitor Game, Voting

name: NFL All American Football Game
description:
Football sports game put out by Standard Oil. Uses a list of offensive and defensive plays to select from to determine the play’s results. Heavy cardboard stock board. No box.

—user summary
categories: Sports

name: International Cricket: Sirf Dekhneka Nahi
description: Published in India by Prem Ratna Toys in India in August of 2017, International Cricket is tabletop simulation of the sport of cricket. This game utilizes a cloth board, a full team of players, and creative batting and pitching devices that allow dexterity and hand-eye coordination to take on a significant roll in game play.
categories: Sports

name: Zomb'Eat Them All
description:
ZETA is a really fun and strategic game, mixing deck building and miniatures of hordes of zombies.
Each player starts the game with the same deck of cards : 3 Zombistiti, 2 skels, 2 dwarves, 2 Zombie Catcher and 1 Hero action. Before starting the first turn, each player draws 5 cards. They are not allowed to draw more than 5 cards during each turn.

Each turn has 3 phases.
Market phase : Every turn, each player has to buy cards from the market, starting with the first player. All bought cards from the market are put in the discard.
Hero phase : During this phase, each player, starting with the first player, has to activate one or two heroes on the board. 2 actions are available (one more action if you have the corresponding card in hands).
Zombies phase :
During this phase, each player moves his zombies on the board, starting with the first player. Each zombie move straight away to its motion value.

Zombies are not affected by other zombies even if they are enemies. If there is a zombie finishing his movement in the same tile as another zombie, put it on the next tile. Sometimes a zombie will meet an hero. Stop the zombie in the adjacent tile to the hero and this one is wounded equal to the strength of the zombie. ALL heroes are affected by ALL zombies. This means that your heroes can be wounded by your own zombies!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Events, Semi-Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Dreadnoughts At Dawn: Washington Treaty Expansion
description:
Dreadnoughts At Dawn is aimed at WW1 and the immediately preceding years of the early 20th century.

This expansion is a “What if” expansion that covers what if the war had not ended in 1928 OR what if the Washington Treaty had never happened.
All combatants were planning and in some cases had started building the next generation of warships, especially Battleships. In reality some of these ships never left the design stage, some were scrapped and some were turned into aircraft carriers to avoid wasting the hulls.

This expansion includes additional hypothetical ships for Great Britain, Germany, The United States of America and the Empire of Japan.
Because some of the proposed ships were monsters I have introduced both a new gun calibre (colour) and a new Armour Colour; in both cases Black.
It represents 16” to 18” guns planned for these monsters and the proposed uber levels of armour some of them were to have.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War I

name: Hostage Crisis
description:
Hostage Crisis is a game about teenage love-stories in which one player is out to rescue their lover held hostage and fighting to keep alive hope. The other player will do their best to suppress the rescue attempt at all cost.

The hero will be able to choose among different personality types, stats and equipment that will determine their approach for the rescue mission.

The villain will be able to choose between different characters that impact how the hero will have to go about rescuing their lover, type of enemies and overall mission objective.

—description from the publisher
categories: Exploration, Fighting
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Cearnage
description:
Cearnage was a play-by-post combat game supporting multiple opponents in a single coliseum-style play area. Players could enter the game at any time and continued in the game until their persona was killed or remained as the sole survivor. A "turn" took place over about a one-month period - players submitted by post written turns using a semi-standard format (freeform actions and explanatory notes were allowed); the results were published in the next monthly issue of Lokasenna.

Player personas started from a base template and then were customized by spending points from a pool to gain benefits - increased characteristics, weapon or shield skills, combat skills, or armor. Once a persona was created it was placed into the combat arena and beneficial changes thereafter were quite limited - harmful changes resulted from combat.

Written player orders consisted of a movement action and a combat action - a variety of each were available. The game referee received all written orders and then determined outcomes. Some outcomes were determined by game rules; other outcomes were adjudicated by the referee.

Cearnage rules were published in Lokasenna (Issue 9 - Nov 1983) and play turns appeared from that time forward.

—user summary
categories: Fighting, Medieval
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Player Elimination, Role Playing, Take That

name: Dreams of Typhon
description:
"A Dungeon Crawl Card Game in Space"

Dreams of Typhon is a card game about exploration, cooperation, and a desperate fight for survival. Players take on the role of one of six Survivors that have been trapped on the behemoth space station Typhon as they frantically fight for their lives. Each time the game is played, the layout of Typhon Station changes. Players draw Room Cards to represent their journey through the station. Rooms have various events that could prove to be fatal and may contain a deadly monster known as an Anomaly. However, some rooms contain precious Gear that can be used to level up Survivors to increase their chance of survival.

--publisher's description
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Exploration, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Uber Soldat!: Payback! Expansion
description:
In Uber Soldat, the allied forces have become outmanned and outgunned, hardpressed to accomplish their missions.

So Payback brings much-needed and highly-anticipated reinforcements for the allied forces.

With the Payback box set you will receive additional U.S. troops and equipment in addition to two extra character cards to add suitable miniatures as you see fit.

Add some more hard-hitting fire power to your U.S. forces!

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II

name: Sea Change
description:
Sea Change is a card-laying spatial puzzle for 2 players. It’s a bit like poker reimagined as a strategic, swingy, cutthroat match-3 game.

All you’ll need to play are a standard 52-card deck, some tokens (poker chips, meeples, etc.), and the goal board and 16 goal cards that can be printed and cut out.

In Sea Change, you compete to fulfill poker “hands” – straights, flushes, at the like - in particular geometric arrangements. Say, four cards of the same suit in an “L”. Harder hands will net you more points, but your opponent will also be angling to complete the same goals.

On top of that, each card value has a special power that alters the game rules in interesting ways!
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Puzzle

name: Mano-a-Mano: A Rowdy Time in the Old West
description:
Mano-a-Mano is a fast, universal game system that can be used for skirmish or role playing games.

It is mainly concerned with movement, combat, morale, and other connected actions, with lots of detail on gambling, travelling, swag...it's all there.
The rest is left to your imagination.
So, you can rob the town bank, chase banditos as part of a posse, or fight off an Apache war party.

If you want to use these rules for skirmish combat only, the section at the end covers character types, eliminating the need to generate individual characters, and a high speed combat system.
So, if you want to re-fight little big horn, you won't be bogged down with the Role Playing parts of the game.

Materials needed to play are:

two six sided,
one twenty sided dice,
figures for your characters,
and any terrain you may want to use (either lead or paper figures will do just fine),
Rulers,
tape measures,
and pencils will come in handy.


Once you have all that stuff t'gether, git you a few good fellers in one spot, and git to makin' fun.

—description from the publisher
categories: American West, Book, Fighting, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing

name: Beneath a Moonlit Sky: Nightfighter Air Combat Rules Supplement
description:
A supplemental set of Night Fighter rules for WW2 air combat.

Beneath a Moonlit Sky is a supplemental system for use with hex based table top air combat games. To date, the game has been tested with Knight's Cross and Above the Clouds. But it should work equally as well with Check Six, Hunters in the Sky, or any other hex based system.

The rules hereafter describe hidden movement and radar tracking using early Ground Control Intercept and Air Intercept radar systems.

With just enough uncertainty added to give the feel of fighting in the dark, hunters and intruders make their way through the night sky, tracking incoming bombers intent on hitting their targets.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Fire and Maneuver: v4.1 – Infantry Skirmish Combat in World War 2
description:
The Second World War saw many new innovations to combat: new weapons from jets to atomic bombs, new tactics and doctrine, and innovations which replaced many old traditions.
But through it all, the infantryman remained the one indispensable item on the battlefield.
Even with all the invention and innovation, without the individual doughboy, war still could not be won.

Fire and Maneuver is a 1 to 1 scale game recreating the ground combat of the War.
No mass tank battles, no ship to ship combat on the high seas, no dog fights at 20,000 feet.
Just men clawing their way through no-mans land to get to the enemy.

Each figure represents one soldier, one tank, one gun.
The Scale is small, one inch = 2 yards.
The combat is fierce, even hand to hand.
Each tactical move turn lasts only six to thirty seconds, but those few seconds can mean the difference between life and death, victory or defeat.

The game scale works best with 20mm figures (1/72 scale), but will work equally well with 15mm or 28mm.
Included are two sample scenarios to get you started, as well as charts and stats for most of the common weapons in use through out the later stages of the war.
The average table size for play is 4x8 feet, about the size of a ping pong table.

Turn Sequence:

Morale Phase
Suppressive Fire Phase
Move / Spot Phase
Defensive Fire Phase
Combat Phase


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Fire and Maneuver: v4.1 – Into the Abyss: The Invasion of Poland, 1939 – Platoon Orders, Vehicles, and Scenarios
description:
Into the Abyss is the first supplement to the Fire and Maneuver skirmish rule system.

Covering the 1939 invasion of Poland, it brings in new squads, weapons, and vehicles from the early days of World War 2.

This is not a stand alone, and a copy of Fire and Maneuver is needed to play.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Motorsport
description:
Motorsport is a deck building game for 1-4 players that captures the frenzy of automotive competition.

You will compete against your fellow drivers to build the most competitive car, as quickly as possible. The goal is to win Events, such as drag races, car shows, drift competitions, autocrosses, and circuit races. The first player to win enough Events to claim seven Trophy Points wins the game.

You play with a personal deck which you will add to and expand as the game progresses. Your deck starts pretty weak, but each card you add to it will make it stronger! You will build your deck the same way you would build a car: by deciding what your goal is and purchasing Mods that support that goal.

The gameplay in Motorsport revolves around four Upgrade Types: Speed, Style, Handling, and Traction. Vehicles have stats for each Type, Mods belong to and support specific Types, and the winner of Events is determined by Vehicle Upgrade Type stats. You can choose which of the four Types you want to focus on, depending on your play style!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Racing

name: Blitzkrieg in the West 1940: 50 Wargame Scenarios – Volume I: German - French
description:
50 historical wargaming scenarios for miniatures featuring battles between the French and German armies in Belgium and France in May-June 1940.

Each scenario is complete and includes the original 1940 map the battle was fought over, the actual troops involved and the missions they had. These are not vague approximations but researched historical simulations.

Optimised for wargaming rules that use one stand = one platoon but easily converted.
Games range from small encounters to large set piece battles.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Blitzkrieg in the West 1940: 50 Wargame Scenarios – Volume II: German - British
description:
50 historical wargaming scenarios for miniatures featuring battles between the British and German armies in Belgium and France in May-June 1940.

These are all original scenarios. Each scenario is complete and includes the original 1940 map the battle was fought over, the actual troops involved and the missions they had. These are not vague approximations but researched historical simulations.

Optimised for wargaming rules that use one stand = one platoon but easily converted.
Games range from small encounters to large set piece battles.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Blitzkrieg in the West 1940: 50 Wargame Scenarios – Volume III: German - Dutch
description:
50 historical wargaming scenarios for miniatures featuring battles between the Dutch and German armies in The Netherlands in May 1940.

These are all original scenarios. Each scenario is complete and includes the original 1940 map the battle was fought over, the actual troops involved and the missions they had. These are not vague approximations but researched historical simulations. The campaign in The Netherlands lasted only five days but featured a very wide variety of tactical actions including parachute operations, assault river crossings, and commando raids. These are all faithfully captured in this volume.

Optimised for wargaming rules that use one stand = one platoon but easily converted.
Games range from small encounters to large set piece battles.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Blitzkrieg in the West 1940: 42 Wargame Scenarios – Volume IV: Belgian - German
description:
42 historical wargaming scenarios for miniatures featuring battles between the Belgians and German armies in Belgium in May 1940.

These are all original scenarios. Each scenario is complete and includes the original 1940 map the battle was fought over, the actual troops involved and the missions they had. These are not vague approximations but researched historical simulations. The 18-day campaign in Belgium is given scant study but featured bitter fighting in a wide variety of tactical actions. This volume of scenarios features battles rarely studied and pays tribute to the Belgian's gallant and often over looked efforts.

Optimised for wargaming rules that use one stand = one platoon but easily converted.
Games range from small encounters to large set piece battles.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Rebel Yell, Yankee Hurrah!
description:
10 ACW regimental scenarios from the Western Theatre 1861-64.

The most accurate information available on OOB's, unit strengths and weapons.

—description from the publisher
categories: American Civil War, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Under Construction
description: Under Construction is a roll'n write that puts you in the shoes of builders. Using the dice they will have to make the most points by judiciously placing the figures in the buildings, in order to finish first to get the bonuses. One page game.
categories: City Building, Print & Play

name: Triocolor
description:
Trioocolor is a confrontation game for 2 players. Players will have to get points on each column of cards by defeating their opponent with the elements and combinations.
There are 3 versions with different boxes: Hollowtrio, Robotrio and Dragotrio
categories: Fantasy, Fighting, Science Fiction

name: Assassin's Crisis
description:
All players are ASSASSINS!

Use Assassinate, Track, and Hide cards, To survive the psychological battle of killing and killing!

This game is an analog game in which everyone becomes an assassin and plays against other players.

You can win by assassinating other player three times, but you must also think that they will assassinate you.

Use the Assassinate card to try to assassinate other players, the Track card to ensure assassination, and the Hide card to aim at the counter while preventing assassination from other players, to aim to win the game.

—description from the designer
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction

name: Cot cot Panik
description:
In this game, you have to make a chicken coop by placing fences on the board.
You also have to exclude the fox.
The cards are available in 3 levels.

—user summary

Brain teaser. The henhouse is under attack from the fox in this brain-teaser for one or two players! Who will be the first to work out where to put the barriers to protect the hens from the marauding fox? A game of tactics and thought that also requires a touch of speed!

—description from the back of the box
categories: Puzzle

name: Battle of Burnwood
description:
Requires 1 standard dice and some counters for players.

Battle of Burnwood is an intro fantasy board game, with a blend of strategy, luck, chance and chaotic fun. With wild Wolves, greedy Goblins, swashbuckling Pirates and awesome Assassins, its a dangerous place indeed.

Each player is a gang leader of 5 Character cards, racing to collect Objects and be the first to complete their Quest. However, as the game progresses, the world can become more hazardous as random folk up for a battle can end up being placed around the various locations on the play map.

With 44 unique Characters, 18 specialized Objects and 24 overlapping Quests, game play is different and exciting every time!

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Children's Game, Dice, Fantasy, Fighting, Math, Medieval, Memory, Pirates, Print & Play
mechanics: Advantage Token, Dice Rolling, Different Dice Movement, Finale Ending, Hand Management, Increase Value of Unchosen Resources, Kill Steal, Negotiation, Open Drafting, Pick-up and Deliver, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Semi-Cooperative Game, Trading

name: Hero Master: An Epic Game of Epic Fails – Indecent Exposure Promo
description:
A promo card, which was available from Promo Paradise Kickstarter.

Flavor Text: Martyn the dandy always dressed to impress, with puffy sleeves, tight corsets and bell-toed shoes. It did mean he was prone to epic wardrobe malfunctions, which weren't popular in tight dungeon corridors.

Game Text: Reveal your hand to the other Heroes.

Card Type: Critical Fail
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Above the Clouds!: Resolution 181
description:
Resolution 181 is an expansion for the Above the Clouds! air-combat miniature wargame rules.

It covers the Arab-Israeli conflict from 1948-1983.

Resolution 181 is intended to provide enough background information for Above the Clouds! aficionados to generate interesting missions set in the various clashes of the Arab-Israeli conflict.
This conflict has varied over time including all-out warfare involving the very survival of the Israeli state, lower-level conflicts involving mere one-off raids, and even sustained air combat attrition campaigns.

The early conflicts (the 1948 and 1956 wars) can be played using Above the Clouds! alone, but the remaining conflicts represented in Resolution 181 will require players to have the Missile Age expansion.
Resolution 181 consists of three major parts, a timeline to familiarize gamers with the background of the conflict, a section breaking down the major conflicts and the forces which were available to the participants, and the game components required for using your miniatures to fight in these conflicts.


Game components include 53 APDs (12 of which were previously published in other expansions) and 26 APD variants, some of which are:

F-84F Thunderstreak (“Super Hog”)
F-15 Eagle
F-16 Falcon
Hawker Hunter
DeHavilland Vampire, FB.5
DeHavilland Venom / Sea Venom
Mystere IVa
Mirage III / Mirage V
Mirage F.1
MiG-23 “Flogger”
MiG-25 “Foxbat”
Su-7 “Fitter”
Su-17/20/22 “Fitter”
Tu-16 “Badger"
S-199 Mezek (“Mule”),
Kfir (“Cub”)
Nesher


Air-to-air missile systems include Shafrir, Python, R.530, AA-2, AA-7, AIM-7 and AIM-9 (a total of 18 models/versions).

Air Defense system include SA-2, SA-3, SA-6, Roland and HAWK SAM systems; as well as ZSU-23/4 and ZSU-57/2 anti-aircraft guns.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: World Conflict: Modern Combat
description:
The primary goal of this game design was to reimagine the classic board games "Risk" and "Axis & Allies" by targeting and replacing or eliminating their least enjoyed mechanics and elements, while retaining and building around their best qualities (particularly "Risk".

The game is played on a map of Earth, including all seven continents, broken into 8 different land "Regions" and 6 ocean "Regions". Similar to Risk or A&A, players control factions and compete for power, influence, and resources and use dice to resolve conflicts.

Unlike the parent games, Global War embraces a multi-purpose card system whereby new reinforcements can be claimed OR players can interact and modify dice rolls - even on other player's turns.

Also unlike the parent games, Global War has a "double elimination" mechanic; where a newly eliminated faction enters a "Piracy" stage - where they can utilize the game's built-in naval warfare mechanics to continue influencing the final outcome of the game (and potentially still win!)

The game also has a variety of selectable win conditions and is semi-modular to allow for simpler, quick strategic gameplay, or more complex, longer games that have a similar feel to classic wargaming.

—description from the designer
categories: Political, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Alliances, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Interrupts, Moving Multiple Units, Player Elimination, Variable Set-up, Victory Points as a Resource, Zone of Control

name: ARTributes
description:
Players take turns drawing pictures based on chosen descriptive words. The rest of the players or teams try to guess what the picture is to win points. The person or team that reaches 15 points first wins.

Skills Focus : Vocabulary & Language Use, Imagination & Creativity
categories: Party Game

name: Comic Book Crisis
description:
Comic Book Crisis is a cooperative worker placement/action game for 1-4 players that can be played on ANY comic book thanks to a patent-pending method.

You play as a member of the heroic B-TEAM, superheroes who attempt to thwart an evil villain's plot. Place your hero's poses onto the comic page, collect resources, and spend them to activate your powers against the villain and their henchmen! If you can work together against the forces of evil before the story reaches its end, you WIN!

Comic Book Crisis comes with four superheroes, each with their own unique pose tokens and deck of power cards. The game also comes with several villains, each of increasing difficulty and their own deck of schemes.

Comic Book Crisis comes with an EXCLUSIVE comic book but the most exciting feature is that thanks to a patent-pending method, COMIC BOOK CRISIS can be played on ANY comic book ever published! You can literally play hundreds of thousands of games of Comic Book Crisis and never have the same experience twice!

—description from the designer
categories: Comic Book / Strip
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Worker Placement

name: Rallye des Herzens
description:
The theme of the game is a rally through the Sahel Zone. The rally starts and ends in Dakar. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first player to return to Dakar wins the game.

—user summary
categories: Sports, Travel
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Echo Actual
description:
Echo Actual is a wargame that fits well between the tabletop simulations and war/boardgames on your shelf. The system is adaptable for playing on a variety of maps you already own with a soon-to-be-released bundle of OPORD scenarios designed specifically for Echo Actual.

A number of features help Echo Actual stand out from other wargame offerings, including;

A combined arms game, the system is designed to allow players the selection of a specific Commander before assembling a mission-specific force with Sections, Teams and Modifications that can be equipped, further pushing the specialized capabilities of each unit.
The entire force must stay connected to the Communications Net to avoid the horrific consequences of a Blue-on-Blue attack.
At the beginning of the game, units are deployed face down - when spotted, they are revealed!
Some units have highly specific skills. The Electronic Warfare unit can cripple an enemy communications net. The Engineer Section can build a number of Fortifications.


The Core Rulebook includes print and play instructions to get you in the fight!

Tokens for everything listed in the Combined Arms List make for a quick start up. Also included are instructions for creating a set of DIY tokens in case a player didn't have access to a printer.

The first installment of Echo Actual will serve as the platform for a number of expansions.

—description from the publisher
categories: Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Vinyl: Top Shelf – Rare Album: Funkhousers Promo
description:
Promo originally available as part of the Promo Paradise 2019 Kickstarter.

This is a Top Shelf Rare Album promo for the game Vinyl.

When players have acquired two Collection Reward Tokens, they may flip them over and exhuast them to take a Top Shelf Album Card. The player will have the right to perform the action on the Top Shelf Albums on a subsequent turn. When a Top Shelf Album is removed from the Top Shelf Rack, a new one is drawn and placed in the drafting row.

Abilities on the Top Shelf cards are to be used one time only. Once the Top shelf power has been used, flip the Top Shelf album over to show that you have used that power.

Rare Album: At the end of the game, this Top Shelf Album is worth twelve victory points.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Music

name: Goatskin: Rules for Football in the Ancient World
description:
Want a fast pace game?
Want a chance to have come serious contact with an opponent?
Then Goatskin is the answer.

Goatskin is:
Football from the ancient world.
Football were there are few rules.
Football where every team can win.
Football where players can be put out of the game.

Goatskin is a two hour, fun filled game of small team football.

The game is a cross between rugby and hockey.
This game could never be played in real life.

So grab those old Roman legionaries and see if they can beat the druids!
Designed to be used with any figures. So pull up a flat surface and get your dice.

–description from publisher
categories: Ancient, Fantasy, Sports

name: Godzilla Rampage: Attack of the MUTO Supplement
description:
Expansion 2 X Attack of the MUTO for Godzilla Rampage board game. Includes NEW and updated Kaiju cards and a NEW Scenario featuring the MUTOs.
Free print and play just like base game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play

name: The Armoury Bible Game: The Accuser's Lair
description:
The Accuser's Lair is a Boss deck expansion for The Armoury Bible Game (TABG) that allows players to battle The Accuser who is a dragon that represents the Devil in a massive underground chamber!

Players are able to set a game difficulty by adjusting the requarments to activate Boss abilities that harm players.

There are 22 unique Boss cards that allow for plenty of verability within games.

This Boss Expansion Deck can be combined with The Archer & Prophet Expansion Box to accommodate a 5 player gaming experience.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval, Memory, Religious, Trivia
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Hand Management, Lose a Turn, Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Trading

name: Tugboats
description:
TugBoats is a two player ‘Tug of War’ cardgame where players play boats and tug ropes! Players plan their turn and choose a boat to reveal simultaneously.

Choose wisely as the fastest boat gets first choice of buoy bonuses but the strongest team moves the ribbon one step closer to victory! Each boat has it’s own unique special ability to help turn the tides in your favor!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Nautical, Print & Play, Transportation
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Simultaneous Action Selection, Tug of War, Variable Player Powers

name: Million Dollars But... The Game: Million Pounds Although
description:
