name: Historicon: Ancient and Medieval Wargame Rules
description:
The intent behind these rules is to achieve the following goals;


To gain realistic and believable battle results using the medium of tabletop miniature model figurines.
To have effective and efficient game mechanics that enables fast play with goal 1 as a prime directive, especially those like myself who are ‘time challenged’.
To retain some familiarity with existing sets allowing a painless trial and/or transition, e.g. no re-basing of troops is required.
To be flexible, allowing players to experiment and originate battle tactics etc., within the physics of ancient command control and troop characteristics.
Above all the game must be enjoyable to play.


—description from the designer
categories: Ancient, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame

name: A Game of the World
description:
This is a game of a thousand questions. There are 100 cards. At the top of each card is the name of a place, and where warranted, with the area and population of that place. This is followed by ten questions that all are answered by the name at the top.

Players take turns drawing a card and choosing one of the questions to ask. The first other player to answer correctly takes the card. If no other player can answer, the asking player keeps the card. The winner is the player with the most cards when the deck is exhausted.

The rules say this could be played as a party game by as many people as desired, either individually or in teams. It also could be used as an educational tool.

—user summary
categories: Card Game, Educational, Party Game

name: カエルの王冠 (Kaeru No Ōkan)
description:
The trick-taking game カエルの王冠 (Kaeru No Ōkan), roughly translated as "Frog Crown", was released as part of the publisher ruri ruri games' (るりるりゲームズ) Spring 2018 box of trick-taking games, titled トリテセット Vol. 2 (Trick Taking Set Vol. 2).

It is a "must follow" game with no trump suit. The game consists of 36 cards (1 to 9 in four suits), and 9 scoring cards. Each of the scoring cards show two lily pads, side by side, with a variable amount of victory points: sometimes positive, sometimes negative, and sometimes 0. The scoring cards are randomly placed out in a row and will be won sequentially.

The winner of a trick sets the scoring card between themselves and the player on their left. They will score the right most value on the card, and their left hand neighbor will score the left most value. The most score cards that can be placed between two players is 3, and if a 4th would be added, it is instead moved clockwise to the next position between players that does not already have 3 score cards.

The game lasts 1 hand. Each player sums the right half of the scoring cards on their left and the left half of the scoring cards on their right. The player with the most points wins.
categories: Card Game
publishers: るりるりゲームズ (ruri ruri games)

name: Schwere Kompanie: WWII Tabletop Miniature Rule System
description:
Schwere Kompanie are detailed Tactical scale rules at Company level.
The focus of these rules is to be as historically accurate and realistic as possible without making the game too complex to play.
All gun, vehicle and squad types have their own reference card that contains all information relating to that particular unit. Each unit in the game has a set number of Action Points.

Game is based on a system of 4 phases:

Repair,
Orders,
Impulse, and
Hand-to-Hand


Scale:

For 6mm to 15mm minis
1 turn = 5 min
1"= 50 yards


- Extract from game introduction
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: ECOtainment Games
description:
It is made up of three games efficiently articulated in an ECOAVENTURA, giving rise to a new and effective project of Environmental Education Entertaining for the whole family, where the excitement of throwing the dice; the decision whether or not to change a letter; the right strategy to recycle each waste in a timely manner; expectation about each question; solidarity in being able to rescue players who have not reached the goal; the concern about sanctions and the surprises of the benefits, will allow each player, not only to add the ECOpoints necessary to be the winner, but will build, almost without perceiving it, a solid and unforgettable environmental knowledge, that will allow to accelerate that change of attitude that is required to minimize, or better yet, to reduce, the events of Global Warming, which is affecting our planet so much.
DESCRIPTION OF THE GAMES
• Our biggest challenge was to create games where you could combine knowledge, strategy, decisions, solidarity, expectation, and that your players not only have fun, but in doing so acquire the necessary knowledge to take care of their future.
• The complete Kit consists of three (3) games, and in each of them we have considered different concepts about the environmental problem, which is affecting our planet, adapting them in an entertaining way to the family language. The three games are:
1. ECOTRIVIA: Containing 648 Questions related to the environmental issue and the ECOCARDS game.
2. ECOCARDS: 2 Decks of Cards, using the 4 elements of nature: Earth, Air, Water and Fire, containing 54 EcoTips and 54 EcoVips.
3. RECYCARDS: where only with the right strategy you will be able to recycle all waste.
• The great appeal is that the 3 games although they can be enjoyed independently, we have articulated them in a single Main Game, creating an entertaining ECO Adventure.

Play, get fun and learn in this ECOadventure to become into a Guardian of your Future! YOUR MISSION "SAVE THE PLANET"
categories: Card Game, Educational, Environmental
mechanics: Action/Event, Command Cards, Deduction, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: War Game Rules: Armour & Infantry – 1950-1975
description:
War Game Rules: Armour & Infantry – 1950-1975

Companion set for War Game Rules: Armour and Infantry – 1925-1950 that covers the period from 1950 to 1975, which sees the introduction of anti-tank guided missiles, helicopters, range finders, and efficient A.P.D.S., H.E.S.H. and H.E.A.T. ammunition for tank guns.

Scale:
1/300 (6mm) to 1/72
1 mini = 20 men
categories: Book, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Simulation

name: Escalating Profs
description:
Escalating Profs is a cardgame in which your aim is to become the greatest scientiest in the world. Use insane experiments, ingenious ideas and shady sabatoga-tacticts to show everybody that you're the mastermind on the table!
Also you can combine the game with an App. So you have different modes to play. Like Sport, Quiz or Drink mode.

Gameplay:
Shuffle the deck and place it in the middle of the table. Every Player draws 7 handcards. Afterwards, everybody have to put 3 cards from the deck face down in front of her/him. These three cards represent the reputation of a player! Once per turn, you can put 1 CARD from your hand face down to your REPUTATION. (Always from left to right).

The number on the left upper corner of a card represents the PLAYING COST.
You can play as many CARDS per turn as you want, as long as the combined amount of the PLAYING COST is not higher than your REPUTATION. You play one card after another, so use your mathematical skills to keep track of the total amout of PLAYING COSTS you already used.

After you played a CARD, you put it to the DISCARD PILE. (the DISCARD PILE is right next to your DECK). If you can´t or just don´t want to play another card, you finish your TURN by drawing 1 CARD from the DECK. Note that this is the last thing you can do. Therefore, immediately after drawing this card, the player next to your left side start his / her TURN.
IMPORTANT: After each TURN, the amount of used REPUTATION is put back to 0.

Goal of the Game:
If you increase your reputation to 10, you are the winner! Drops your reputation to 0, you must clear the table.
If your are the last 'Prof' standing, you're also the Winner!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Educational, Humor, Party Game, Sports
mechanics: Action Queue, Chaining, Command Cards, Finale Ending, Hand Management, Increase Value of Unchosen Resources, Turn Order: Claim Action, Turn Order: Pass Order

name: Guardian Angels: The Invisible Battle
description:
A Christian board game set in present time. People with their guardian Angels travel through the time of their life (days of the week on the game board), getting ether into a Wisdom square, or into a Battle square, depending on the number rolled on the dice. When they land on a square, they draw a Wisdom or a Battle card and play them out according to the rules.

The main resource in the game is Grace, which is represented by the colored rubber bands. People are awarded Grace when they draw from the sources of Wisdom and build the Church. They use up Grace when fighting Passions in Battles.

Wisdom cards contain short stories from the Bible (or other sources), that players are asked to re-tell with their own words. The players are rewarded with Grace, depending on the completeness of the story. After the story telling, they go into building the Church from the puzzle pieces.

Battle cards describe the life situations the People get into and what the Angles and the Passions advising them to do in these circumstances. Depending on the difficulty of the situation, there are from one to four Passions attacking the Person. Your goal is to help the angles to knock them down by shooting them with the Grace you’ve accumulated so far. If you can’t shoot down all the Passions, the Person goes into the Sinful Circle – an inner circle on the game board, where all the squares are Battle squares.

You’ll be building the church out of puzzle pieces on every Wisdom turn and on every successful Battle turn. If a Battle is lost, you don’t get to build the Church.

The game is over, when the Church is built. Everyone wins, but those with the most Grace bands left deserve the biggest praise.

-description from designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, Religious
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: Stars & Lasers!!: Free Scenario No.7
description:
This is the seventh set of two free scenarios for Stars & Lasers.

The first scenario is Once upon a pedestal can you get the cargo ship to safety?
The second scenario There’s something wrong with the sensors Captain… is a battle with a twist.


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: War Games Rules: Infantry Action – 1925-1975
description:
Miniature Wargame Rules covering the period from 1925 to 1975.

At infantry platoon level.

For figures from 1/72 to 1/35 scale.
categories: Book, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Simulation

name: ICBM Attack
description:
ICBM Attack is a light solo/solitaire free PNP wargame with a Cold War theme. World War III has started and nuclear warheads are raining from the sky. You are in command of the Missile Defense system, and your mission is to defend your cities from annihilation. Target and destroy the incoming enemy warheads. The fate of civilization depends upon you.

The game is designed to give something of the feel of the old "Missile Command" arcade game. It requires a 6x8 grid gameboard, 22 counters, and a 6d. The enemy warheads enter in three waves and are guided by dice rolls. Players defend three cities against these incoming warheads by placing Targeting Markers at aiming points for antimissile weapons. You lose if any of your cities are hit by an incoming warhead.

Games usually last 15-20 minutes. The difficulty-level is adjustable, from "easy" to "we're toast".
categories: Children's Game, Modern Warfare, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Buffalo Bluff
description:
A Game of cunning hometown deception where a wild imagination and Niagara Frontier know-how score big!

—description from the back of the box

There are two main goals in Buffalo Bluff:


To create a bluff (or fake answer) designed to trick your opponents into picking your answer.
Once the bluffs are created, players then try to pick the correct answer to the question dealing with Niagara Frontier happenings.


Scoring is different based on how many play. Basically you get points if people pick your bluff as truth.

—user summary
categories: Bluffing, Trivia

name: Wright Game
description:
This was a world travel game published as a promotional feature in the 1930s by Japanese company King Star. The presence of the Nazi flag and of Berlin as a short-cut space, together with the absence of a Soviet Union flag, suggests that it was published shortly after the 1936 Anti-Comintern Pact.

The board has a circular track made up mostly of national flags. There also are two straight tracks the cross the board at right angles. These are possible shortcuts.

Players roll dice and move one of their three planes forward by the number shown. If a plane lands on Mount Fuji, it can take the shortcut across to Mount Everest, which takes only 8 spaces instead of 22. If a plane on the shortcut lands on the North Pole, the central space, it can turn toward Berlin and reach the finish line in only five spaces. A second shortcut is possible by landing on the Airship space, directly across from the finish line. This allows the plane to skip the second half of the circle. The first player to get all three players to the finish line wins.

While the theme is about pleasure travel, competition is cutthroat. Any plane landing on the same space as another one "shoots down" the first plane, sending it back to start.

The rules are printed on the back of the board and appear in Japanese, English and Spanish.

—user summary
categories: Travel

name: Stockade
description:
This is an undated cowboys and Indians themed game. Peeper Pete and Beaver Bill face off against Chief Featherfoot and Chief War-Whoop. Each player has nine tokens and the first to get all of them in a line along the wooden stockade dividing the two sides wins.

The pieces move along a series of branching pathways, ending at the 12 stockade spaces. The paths are between 4 and 6 spaces long, and each stockade space has a number from 1 to 6.

Players have to land on each of the stockade spaces with a roll of that number, and so must decide where to put pieces that can't reach one of the stockade spaces in a single roll.

—user summary
categories: American Indian Wars
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Game of Puns
description:
This would be named more appropriately as the Game of Rebus Puzzles. The board consists of 64 numbered squares arranged in pyramid form on each side of the board. Each of the squares has a colored illustration.

Players roll dice to advance along the spaces, which start at the top of one pyramid and end near a corner of the board. When landing on a square, they must correctly solve the rebus puzzle or return to where they started the turn. For instance, the word CHOCK speckled with white circles on black letters would be the expression "chock full of holes".

—user summary
categories: Humor

name: Play Safe
description:
Play Safe is a 1951 game of traffic safety. The board has a network of interconnected squares, each marked with a safety slogan. These may force the player to pay money into the Safety Fund or Courtesy Fund squares or allow players to collect money from these spaces. Players may also land in Jail or Hospital, and may have to pay other players as well.

Sample spaces include: "The Speed that thrills is the Speed that Kills"; "There's a child in your future... Don't let careless driving make him a cripple"; "Jay-Walking is a short cut to Hospital".

The back of the board is elaborately decorated with a collage of photographs and newspaper articles about traffic accidents and their consequences.

—user summary
categories: Educational, Transportation

name: Rendezvous in literature
description:
When opening Rendezvous in literature, the beautiful and charming ancient Chinese literature world is unfolded for you. So many characters, so many schemes and plots are entwined in these long speaking stories, forming the glamorous treasures that enchanted generations after generations of people. Let's travel through these masterpieces with this simple but fascinating game, and sympathize with those famous characters.

In this game, Qin Shihuang, the first emperor in ancient Chinese who once burned the books and buried alive the Confucian scholars, is back to live again. This time he tears apart all the characters and separate couples and families in Chinese literature. Being a talented sorcerer, you will help these characters by identifying their names and locating them in the right stories.

During the game, you’ll need to get full understanding of the characters on your cards and speculate other players’ hand. Then you can guess what cards others have. Once you got the right answer, take that card from player who own the card. And if you collect a whole set of characters, play them to get the corresponding scores. The one with highest scores is the winner.

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Book, Card Game, Educational, Memory

name: Master of Mathemagician
description:
The tournament of the most powerful Mathemagician is now initiated! In order to win the jackpot: the legendary Mathemagic scroll, every mathemagician is well-prepared. Be ready for this challenge, doing whatever you can to win the tournament and become the Master of Mathemagician!

Through this game, players will build their deck by exchanging cards with each other, and use barriers to have their own marbles score, while at the same time try not to be affect by other competitors. Players can rely on the effect cards or their own judgment to achieve this goal. The key to win this game is by using your effect cards successfully and skillfully.

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Educational
mechanics: Action Queue, Hand Management, Programmed Movement

name: Behind the Dungeon
description:
Do you want to attack the dungeon? No! Well do you want to defend the dungeon then? YES!

In Behind the Dungeon the players become dungeon master who hire monsters and stop the warriors from attacking!
Hurry up! Champions will soon arrive in the dungeon!

At the start of the game the dungeon is set up which consist of 5 monster type tiles and below them 5 randomly drawn hero tiles which will represent the heroes that will attack the dungeon at the end of the game. Goal of the game is to defend each dungeon from each hero with the corresponding monster type. Players also receive 10 dungeon cores, which function like victory points in the game.
In a turn a player plays one card in front of them and then gives 1 card face down to a player of their choice. That player may accept or reject the card. It could be a monster card which can be put in the dungeon or a special card which effect has to be carried out immediately.
Then, the player draws back up to 4 cards and it is the next player's turn.

When the draw pile is empty players enter the scoring phase and check if the combined power of their monsters is higher than the hero's power. If the hero's power is higher it deducts that number from the dungeon cores. Whoever has the most dungeon cores is the winner of the game.
categories: Card Game, Number, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Deduction, Set Collection

name: Space Pirates
description:
Some folks prefer the freedom of “independent contracting” and open space to the restrictions of corporate governments. These wayward spirits are often on the search for untold treasures and riches on the myriad planets across the galaxy.

Relic Worlds Expeditions recreates skirmish battles in the Relic Worlds universe.
In it, players find artifacts and other treasures left behind by long-lost alien civilizations. But the characters must be careful, as these alien races also left behind traps, and fierce monsters remain that will prove a deadly challenge to your faction.

Within these pages you will find the characters and units to build and play the pirates faction.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Battle Brawlers
description: Battle Brawlers is the first Bakugan TCG set, and it introduces many staple cards that are in use today.
categories: Expansion for Base-game

name: Flash! News
description:
This is an elaborately accessorized 1937 newspaper game. Players compete to fill a blank front page with articles, matching headlines and pictures. The box is filled with glossy paper slips marked with a category on the back and either a headline or story on the front. The stories are actual news events from the time (including some false versions).

In turn, a player rolls 2D6, which requires drawing the top slip of paper from the appropriate box. These boxes are: 2 - Must (a story that must be included); 3 - Hold for Release (a story that cannot be put on the page until released by another event; 4 - City Editor; 5 - Telegraph Editor; 6 - News Editor (allows drawing a headline or a A-sized short story); 7 - Take a C-Short story; 8 - Take a B-Short story; 9 - Copy Desk (also allows choosing a headline or an A-Short; 10 - Picture Editor; 11 - Scoop; 12 - Flash. The last two are the only ways to get "Special" stories.

Players may rearrange their pages at any time, and "Go to Press" as soon as their pages are full. When all but one player has gone to press, the remaining player follows a process to fill in the page immediately.

The articles on each page are then rated against a secret key of circulation values. These values are added up for each player, and the one with the highest total circulation wins.

—user summary
categories: Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Armada Game of Naval Warfare
description:
This is a chess-type game of modern naval warfare published in the Philippines in 1975. The board has an unusual circular shape divided into latitudes and longtitudes.

Each player starts with 18 plastic ships in green or grey: 1 aircraft carrier, 1 battleship, 2 each of cruisers, destroyers and submarines, 4 mine ships and six patrol ships. Each type of ship has a unique "command" pattern that defines the directions and distances to which it can move and attack.

Before starting, each player secretly designates either his battleship or his aircraft carrier as his "flagship". The game ends immediately if a player takes the opposing flagship.

The game may also end in a truce: either because neither player has enough forces left to capture the opposing flagship or because one is offered by one player. If the opposing player refuses the truce offer, he must win within 14 moves or the truce becomes automatic. The winner of a game ending in a truce is determined by the point values of opposing ships captured, between 1 and 5 each.

—user summary
categories: Nautical, Wargame

name: Symbiosis
description:
How well do you know animals?

The world is full of amazing wonders. The animal kingdom is one of them, just waiting to be discovered by you.

Symbiosis is a game to help you learn about exotic animals in an entertaining way. Compete using fascinating animal cards, play awesome human powers, and collect habitats to win!

This game was designed for people who wish to know more about animals, because knowing them will allow you to care for them and ultimately cooperate with them in a symbiotic way.

HOW IT WORKS

To win you have to collect 4 different habitats or 3 of the same before everyone else. There are 6 different types of habitats. To gain habitats you have to compete for them using animal cards. There are 120 different animals, 20 for each habitat

Animals have four different characteristics: speed, length, lifespan, and birth rate. Each habitat is won with a different characteristic.

But wait! There are also powerful humans, who have game changing abilities that can utterly obliterate your opponent's schemes!
categories: Animals, Educational

name: Tractus Bellica: Space Fleet Combat Rules
description:
TRACTUS BELLICA is a set of easy to play open genre sci-fi space fleet combat rules.
All of the classic elements of spaceship to spaceship combats in the scif-fi universe are taken into account. Game play is both easy and quick.
The rules can be played with miniatures or counters on either an open tabletop or on hexes.
The rules use a D6 combat system and an initiative based phased Igo-Ugo format.
Statistics for more then 30 ship classes and installations, including rules for fighters.
Additional rules cover space monsters and abstract ground combat.
The rules are designed for those who are looking for just the right mix of flavor and content, without too much complication.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Measurement Movement

name: Warsaw is Burning: The Polish Campaign
description:
Warsaw is burning! is the first supplement for Five Men at Kursk.

Offering a new way of doing wargame campaigns, rather than giving you a few prepackaged scenarios, Kursk relies on random tables to generate a potentially infinite amount of scenarios.

The expansion provides the tables to roll up Polish, German and Soviet squads along with their respective support tables, custom-tailored to September 1939.
Tank profiles include vehicles like the 7TP and 20mm armed tankettes.
Included are also special rules to add additional flavour, new terrain and mission objective tables suitable for a campaign game and notes for continuing your campaign into WW2.

Intended for use with Five Men at Kursk, the expansion can also be adapted to most any skirmish wargame

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: On Samhain's Eve: Fantasy Skirmishes in Chevauchee
description:
A full fantasy supplement for the Chevauchee skirmish wargame rules.

On Samhain's Eve offers the following features:

Rules for heroes, spell casting, non-human characters and mystical weapons.
A bestiary of medieval-inspired monsters and the ability to create your own completely random monstrosities.
3 introductory scenarios as well as a simple selection system to quickly set up a fantastic encounter.
A new style of campaign, the Quest. Take your adventuring party and go on a perilous journey, fraught with encounters and random events.


On Samhain's eve builds upon the fundamentals of Chevauchee, expanding the game to allow you a few mystical elements in a campaign or full blow fantasy adventures with elves, noble knights and vile demons battling it out.

This is a supplement and although much of the material could be easily adapted to other systems, to make the most of it you will need the Chevauchee core rules.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Company Commander in Spaaace: A Science Fiction Supplement for FiveCore Company Commander
description:
Whether you want to lead a grav tank platoon, crush the enemy under the treads of your super tank or command a company of colonial militia against an onslaught of alien bugs, this supplement for FiveCore Company Commander has you covered.


New unit types, ranging from grav tanks and drop troops to stealth units and super soldiers.
Rules for super-sized units like monsters, super tanks and mecha.
New weapons systems, including energy weapons and drone swarms.
New unit specialists to assist your squads, like psionics and sentry guns.
To round it all off, a new war generator to help set up a science fiction conflict.


A typical army has 8-15 stands. Suitable for scales from 6-15mm but playable in other scales.

This is a supplement and a copy of FiveCore Company Commander is required to use this supplement.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Hop la bille: Bille Chaude Promo Card
description:
Promo Card for the Game Hop la bille. Included with magazine Plato n°61 from November 2013.
In deviation to the other cards, this 'Bille chaude'-Card is not placed on the solved cards pile after the combination has been set up, but the next player receives it and must also fulfill the combination.
The card 'Bille Chaude' is never fulfilled but always passed on.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Expansion for Base-game

name: Phalanx: Fast table-top gaming with model soldiers, dice and rules covering the period 3000 BC to 1500 AD
description:
The most unique ancient wargame set ever produced. Featuring revolutionary game mechanisms from the top down. Featuring combat resolution by one die. Fast, quick with realistic results to boot. Download the best ancients game ever. All yours for no charge whatsoever.

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Into Glory Ride: Fast table-top gaming with model soldiers, dice and rules covering the period 1500AD - 1900AD
description:
This set is an extension of Phalanx. Where this set differs is in that we have concentrated on speed of play while maintaining a good level of accuracy. We hope this is achieved by using efficient game mechanics that take a pure mathematical approach. This game contains many radical systems, terminology and mechanics of which combat resolution by one die is at the forefront. A lot of effort and thinking went into this game, our hope is that you enjoy gaming with Into Glory Ride.

Of course, your initial reaction may be "1500 - 1900, just not possible". However, while developing and testing Phalanx we started to see no logical reason to subdivide the period of 1500AD to 1900AD into the classic periods of Renaissance, Marlburian, Napoleonic, ACW and Colonial. We see the period from a different perspective, that of the increasing lethality of firearms and their effect on the field. Physics and physical constrains are our guidelines. In other areas not much changed, a Soldier at the battle of Omdurman would not find himself too out of place at Waterloo. However, his weapons being much more lethal. The dense close order of Line Infantry (1700ish) gave way to the thick skirmishing lines of the ACW and Colonial period. Even WW1 was fought using 19th Century thinking, albeit with massive fire power. Just be incompetent and you'll game quite realistically.

—description from the publisher
categories: American Revolutionary War, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Post-Napoleonic, Renaissance, Wargame

name: Blood & Swash: Gladiator Expansion
description:
Gladiator is an expansion for Blood & Swash to add optional rules for gladiator style combat with odd weapons, animals and traps.

-Description from rulebook
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: The New Zealand Wars: War in the Fern & Tussock – Te Kooti's Taupo Campaign 1869
description:
The New Zealand Wars - War in the Fern & Tussock; Te Kooti’s Taupo Campaign 1869

This book carries on the New Zealand Wars conflict with background provided about the history and people that took part in the war.

War in the Fern & Tussock focuses on the actions that took place in the Taupo region that was first campaign when forces of both sides were many made up of Maori soldiers.

Colonel Thomas McDonnell was in command of the colonial forces during this campaign that was to try to destroy Te Kooti and his Ringatu forces for good in 1869.

The booklet is full of information and details about the actions and battles that took place. Information you will find inside are the orders of battle, descriptions, and important dates of the campaign. To play the scenarios and campaign you will need the rules which are in a previous title - The New Zealand Wars: Skirmish Rules and Campaign Rules for the Waikato War 1863-1864

Scenarios:

Ambush at Opepe
Battle of Tauranga – Taupo Pa
Battle of Te Pononga Hill
Ambush of McDonnell
Battle of Te Porere – The Lower Redoubt
Battle of Te Porere – The Upper Redoubt


These will bring to life a little known campaign that took place in the middle of the North Island of New Zealand in the Taupo region during the New Zealand Wars.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame

name: 1718 Dice Game
description:
1718 Dice game is a free PNP. PDF attached. Its a good excuse to throw lots of dice. The famous Black Beard pirate died in 1718. This simple pirate dice game was inspired by 3 dice games Roll for it, Age of War and Los Banditos.

On a turn. Each player rolls his/ her available dice and will try to allocate the dice to match the requirements of the cards they want to claim in the hoard.

Action cards are grey. They give no points, but allow you to do special permanent actions on your turn. they are cumulative They are aquired through "battle" with dice. The dice battle could last more than 1 turn.

—description from the designer
categories: Dice

name: Tabletop WWII
description:
Historical Miniature Wargame rules for WWII

From Battlegroup to division / corps level.

Includes:

basic rules
advanced rules,
troops, organization and equipment for divisions
point system and
scenarios
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Tabletop Napoleonics
description:
Historical Miniature Wargame rules for the Napoleonic era.

From Battlegroup to division / corps level.

Includes:

basic rules,
advanced rules,
point system to create armies,
scenarios
categories: Book, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Seekriegs-Taktik
description:
This is a naval battle simulation between a German and an English fleet. Movement of the ships is determined depending of the ships class. A battleship for instance moves 3 spaces per turn whereas a light cruiser moves 4 spaces.
The goal of the game is to destroy or cripple the enemy fleet.
Hits are settled by rolling 3 dice and consulting a hit table.
The players may create their own scenarios for the game.

The ships have to be colored, cut out and glued together.

—user summary
categories: Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation

name: Spaces
description:
Spaces is designed to be enjoyed by players without being limited by their trivia knowledge. Each Topic Card has questions about a topic and there are always at least 10 correct answers. Players can be creative (including educated guessing) as they attempt to provide up to 9 answers in the 9 Spaces.

Players score 1 point for each correct answer plus 1 bonus point for getting 9 correct answers (maximum score 10 points per Topic Card)
categories: Card Game, Educational, Trivia

name: Spaces: Places Add On
description: Adds 25 place related topic cards to your Spaces game. Can be played as a standalone game, or with the base game and/or any other Add On(s).
categories: Card Game, Educational, Trivia

name: Spaces: Sport Add On
description: Adds 25 sports related topic cards to your Spaces game. Can be played as a standalone game, or with the base game and/or any other Add On(s).
categories: Card Game, Educational, Trivia

name: Spaces: Music Add On
description: Adds 25 music related topic cards to your Spaces game. Can be played as a standalone game, or with the base game and/or any other Add On(s).
categories: Card Game, Educational, Trivia

name: Spaces: Fiction Add On
description: Adds 25 fiction related topic cards to your Spaces game. Can be played as a standalone game, or with the base game and/or any other Add On(s).
categories: Card Game, Educational, Trivia

name: Im Reich der Phantasie
description:
Im Reich der Phantasie from the publisher "Pfiffiger Jakob" by Helmut Huber for 1 to 4 children from 4 years.
It is a small game collection with 4 games:

The paint tower
The dinosaur race in 2 variants
The Saurierfangerl and
The dinosaur poker


The game materials are stored in a jute sack. For better stacking on the shelf, everything is housed in a small, self-made box.

Der Farbenturm:
A color tower is to be built from 48 round wooden discs in 6 different colors with a color cube. The child must stop rolling the dice when the tower collapses or when the color is no longer available. The child with the highest tower won.

Das Saurierrennen:
A predetermined game board is laid out with the colored wooden discs. The color cube determines whether the dinosaur can move to the next field stone. Whoever reaches the finish line first wins the game.

Saurierfangerl:
Only two people play. The catcher places two dinosaurs on the prepared game board on the two starting fields, the hunted places his saurian on his starting field. The dice are alternately rolled. The catcher tries to get into the field of the hunted, the hunted tries to block the catcher with the black field stones.

Saurierpoker:
Each player gets 2 field stones of each color. Then each player places one of his stones in the middle of the table, they must have different colors. Now the dice are rolled. The player whose color has been rolled gets all the pieces from the center.
categories: Unspecified

name: Dawn of Legends
description:
In Dawn of Legends, 2 - 4 players will be recruiting Allies, adding Items and learning Tactics to prove their prowess on the battle field. By winning control of each field, promoting your proven assets and gaining more, players score Victory Points. The player with the most Victory Points at the end of 4 rounds wins!

Each round, players take turns, taking a single action each turn, until all players have passed or played their whole hand. Then, players resolve each of the 3 Battle Fields, scoring them and gaining their unique win rewards. The game proceeds in this manner for 4 rounds, after which, players will count the Victory Points they have collected from Tokens, cards they have Promoted as well as cards they own (in their Deck, Hand, Plan and Discard).

On your turn, take one of these Action:


Prepare Action. Players may discard any card from their hand to put a card from the Market in their Preparation Area (to draw next round).
Recruit Action. Players may discard 2 cards from their hand to play a card from the Study into their Active Card Slot of their Plan. The Icon(s) on the Recruited card MUST be represented at least once on the 2 cards discarded.
Play Action. Players may play a single card from their hand into their Active Card Slot.
Musou Action. Players may (if they still have cards in hand) spend Musou to activate their Legend's unique Musou Ability.


What makes Dawn of Legends unique is the Plan (Player Board) players play cards to. As Cards are played to it or exit it, they have varying effects. Some cards may have effects while they remain in your Plan, while others may protect your Plan or affect your opponents Plan.

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Card Game
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Delayed Purchase, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Spellweaving 101
description:
It's the end of your first year as an Apprentice Spellweaver, which means it's time to demonstrate your mastery of the basics of Spellweaving. You and your fellow Apprentices are gathered together in one of the great Training rooms and instructed to weave as many powerful, two-word spells as you can in a certain amount of time. Unfortunately, you all stayed up late last night "studying", and now all the spell words are jumbled in your mind. By quickly sorting through what you do remember, carefully listening to the other Apprentices, and using some of the characteristics of the seven Aspects, can you weave the most impressive spells and be named Apprentice of the Year?

Each player maintains a hand of five cards, either from the Draw deck or the four discard piles. Place cards in your tableau singly or in pairs. Pairs of cards provide points at the end, based on the value of each card's Aspect.

Improve your placed cards to create powerful Bound spells, or use the abilities of your cards to alter the strength of the placed cards, draw more cards, or steal from other players.

Create the most powerful spells, including those listed on your personal Challenge card, to win!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Fantasy
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Hidden Victory Points, Set Collection

name: Megiddo: Le Jeu de Simulation Tactique au temps de Thoutmosis
description:
Large scale tactical level Miniature Wargame rules in the times of the Pharaohs. in French

Minis: 28mm (recommended)

Règle de jeu pour reproduire les batailles de masse de la Haute Antiquité.
categories: Ancient, Book, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Gridlock
description:
A word game played on a pad of custom game sheets. Each player has a 5x4 grid in which letters are placed. Players take turns to call out any letter they want, which both players must enter into their grid.

After all the spaces are filled points are scored for words formed horizontally and vertically; words filling an entire column are worth two points and words filling an entire row are worth three points.
categories: Word Game

name: Quadrim
description:
Quadrim is played on an board of alternating small and large squares; each small square is surrounded by four large ones and each large square is surrounded by four of each. (It is therefore equivalent to a board of octagons and squares.)

Each player has two types of pieces: blocks (large discs) and pawns (small pointed cylinders). A large square can hold one block or up to four pawns (possibly from both players); a small square can only only a pawn.

On a turn both players roll two dice and the high roller gets to move; they can move two pieces, one with each die, or one piece using the sum of the dice. If they exceed the opponent's roll by at least four they must move blocks, otherwise they must move pawns.

The object of the game is to either surround the center square with your pieces or capture all opposing pieces. Capturing is generally done by occupying the large squares adjacent to opposing pieces with your own (there are seven different cases covered in the rules).

The game board is made of rolled-up vinyl, packaged with the pieces and rules in a large tube.
categories: Abstract Strategy

name: Jackpot! Break the Bank
description:
Jackpot! Break the Bank is a slot machine deck builder for 1-4 players where players are trying to earn money and victory points, and use their earnings to optimize their decks and attempt to hit the legendary Jackpot! - Breaking the bank!

The game is played simultaneously. Each round players get to draw two cards to their hand, and then 'pull the lever' and draw the top three cards in your slot machine deck into your three slots. Players now get to play a card from their hand into the slot machine to change the outcome.

The goal of the game is to hit payouts. Payouts occur when a player has three symbols of the same kind: ie. ???. When hitting a payout, the player is awarded a ⭐

Players will be optimizing their decks by sending cards to their opponents as well as purchasing cards that will yield bigger winnings.

The end game condition is triggered when any player "breaks the bank" which is a term used by the casinos when a player is winning more money than is currently available.

One cool feature in this game is that you never shuffle your deck. Once your slot machine deck is depleted - you simply stack your three slots into a new deck. This means that when playing cards from your hand, you will organize your deck and increase your chances of hitting payouts.

Players will also have 4 personal objectives that can be completed in a specific order. These are for instance to hit a payout using cherries. The next objective could be to win with melons. The final objective is always to hit the Jackpot ?

When there is no more money in the bank. The game ends - and the players count all ⭐ they have on their cards. ⭐ they got from completing their objectives, as well as any ⭐-tokens they got for hitting a payout.

The player who has the most ⭐ wins Jackpot! Break the bank.

-description from designer
categories: Card Game, Puzzle

name: Hyperspace War
description:
War has broken out between the Grendaran and Kalforian fleets. The two space fighter forces have met in deep space for the final battle. The winner will control the galaxy.

The fleets are evenly matched in both quantity and quality. It will be the skill of their commanders which determines the outcome.

Both the Grendaran and Kalforian fighters are equipped with plasma-drive engines for travel in normal spacetime. Both are also equipped with antimatter hyperdrive engines for traveling through hyperspace. And both have auto-tracking weapons systems for destroying enemy spacecraft.

Hyperspace War is a free PNP two-player space combat game based on the traditional Indonesian board game Surakarta. This game has a unique mechanism which uses looping paths to jump from one position on the board to another.

To play, you will need:
Gameboard (in four sections)
1 sheet of 24 space fighter counters
1d6

Destroy the enemy fleet to win.

—description from the designer
categories: Wargame

name: Opportunities Game
description:
Opportunities is an exciting game where you roll the dice and Backpack your way up Peaks and down Valleys as you strive to roll your way into the Inner Circle and land on your Dream all the while making a fortune doing it. Learn the Business Secrets that have been handed down for generations with a Fun, Financial and Educational Business Board Game.
You are an Entrepreneur who loves to win and in turn make a fortune doing it. As you and your fellow Entrepreneurs Backpack up Peaks and down Valleys you learn the time proven methods of other successful Entrepreneurs who have come before you. By following the concepts and techniques you will learn how to be a winner and earn a fortune in any business.

—description from the designer
categories: Educational

name: Chessnuts
description:
Chessnuts is a collection of seven four-player Chess variants and one four-player Checkers variant. They are all played on an 8x8 board with four 2x8 wings.

In five of the Chess variants each player plays individually. The games differ in their victory conditions - in three the object is to be the last player with a king, in the other two captured and remaining pieces are scoring using a points system - the game-ending condition, and the effects of losing one's king.

The other two Chess variants are played in partnerships; in one the players sit opposite each other and in the other they sit adjacent.

All the games are named after types of nut, e.g. the adjacent partners game is called Hazelnut.

The components are a roll-up vinyl board and four sets of plastic pieces, all packaged in a tube.
categories: Abstract Strategy

name: The Pooh Game
description:
In which Pooh and his friends race through the 100 Aker Wood, collecting honeypots as they go!

This game is a dice rolling game, in which players take turns to roll dice, and move their characters along the spaces. As they travel through the game board they will collect honeypots. But beware! Sometimes you might lose a honeypot.

It's not a race to the finish. The winner is the player with the most honeypots at the end of the game.

Based on the original E.H.Shepard illustrations for Winnie the Pooh books.

Made in England.
categories: Children's Game

name: Piraten auf Schatzsuche
description:
The jung pirates going on a treasure hunt using a secret treasure map. They have to find out how to avoid danger and get quickest to the final. This game is training memory and strategic thinking.
The main goal is to reach the pirate beach with the treasure. This can be archived only if they roll the exact numbers on the dice.

—user summary
categories: Children's Game

name: Trick‘n Trouble: Eulen promo card
description:
Promo card from Spiel 2018.

Promo task 4/0/1

Simply add this card to the other cards in Trick ‘n Trouble. It just expands the number of available tasks.
categories: Animals, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Superhit
description:
Superhit is a set of many games designed for education in arithmetic. The common components are dice, counters in five colors, and a 10x10 board with numbered spaces; the numbers also have various colors.

Some of the later games are suitable for play by adults. In one, players roll four dice and then must use arithmetic operations to produce a number on the board, which they place a counter on. When certain dice combinations are rolled the player with the top counter on a space may move the stack. The object is generally to reach the edge of the board, but (as with all the games in the set) there are many variants and optional rules.
categories: Educational, Math

name: Counteract
description:
Counteract is played on a 6x6 board with the squares numbered from 1-6; one space of each number is a "magic square" with a star on it. Each player has a supply of counters.

On a typical turn a player rolls a die and places a counter on an empty space with the matching number. They may take another turn if a 6 is rolled. Each player may make a "power play" three times during the game; this involves rolling two dice and allows replacing an opposing piece at the designated coordinates if there is one.

The game ends when one player uses all their pieces. Scoring is primarily based on forming lines of six pieces and on occupying the magic squares, although there are some extra points available to the player who goes out.
categories: Abstract Strategy

name: Mister Rogers' Neighborhood: The Game
description:
In this simple-to-learn children's game, players spin the spinner and move their trolleys around the board, attempting to visit each of the landmarks and neighbors in the Neighborhood of Make-Believe: Grandpere at the Eiffel Tower, King Friday and Queen Sara at the castle, Corny at the Rock-It Factory, X & Henrietta Pussycat at the tree, Lady Elaine at the Museum-Go-Round, Dr. Bill and Elsie Jean at the platypus mound, and Daniel Tiger at the clock.

Along the way, Mister Rogers cards offer bonuses and penalties (often with a motivational thought to soften the blow of the penalties). Landing on a Trolley space offers an extra turn.

The game offers three methods of play:
1. Players must circle the board and collect all seven of the Neighbor cards by landing at the colored landmarks for each one.
2. Players start with all seven cards and must "drop off" each Neighbor at their landmarks.
3. The "Advanced" game, in which players must collect all seven neighbor cards, and once all seven are collected, drop them off.

The game box suggests a minimum age of 6 years old, but the game is about on par with something like Candy Land. Ages 4 and 5 can learn and play it.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: The Confederate High Command: American Civil War Rules
description:
Miniature Wargame rules for the American Civil War.

33 pages including casualty tables. Includes details of how to make shell burst circles in three sizes, a canister cone, and a shrapnel spider.

Scale:
1 mini = 33 men
1mm = 1 yard
categories: American Civil War, Book, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Shingo!
description:
Shingo is a set collecting game wherein 2-6 players try to score points by adding counters to a playmat that correspond to the same symbol and location on cards that they build a hand of during the game.

The game starts with a stack of cards being placed face down in the middle of the table, and three cards being peeled off and laid face up adjacent to the stack.

On each player's turn they select a card from the three face up ones and add it to their hand, and after doing so add a counter or counters to their playmat, according to whether they have a pink star in that location on the card they've picked up. If they have stars in multiple locations on the card, they add a counter to each of those locations on their playmat, whether or not they have a counter there already from a previous turn, and regardless of whether or not there is a nought or a cross in that location on another card.

Once every player has a hand of seven cards, the game ends and the players add up their points. For more info on scoring and other points, please follow the link to the rules file.
categories: Card Game, Print & Play

name: FeWa-Würfelspiel
description:
The players start at space 1 and have to reach space 50. Movement is determined by a die. If a pawn reaches an occupied space, the other pawn has to start anew from space 1. On some spaces the player learns, why it is a good idea to use FeWa laundry detergent and gets a reward for using FeWa or a penalty for beeing stupid enough to use another product.

This is a promotional game for FeWa laundry detergent (invented in 1932,today it's called "Perwoll"). The washing woman "Johanna" was created in 1938. Seems the figure wasn't named yet when the game was published.

—user summary
categories: Children's Game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Gaggle of Geese
description:
A free PNP game for one player. You are the leader of a flock of Geese heading south for the winter. Lead your flock through the Hunters and avoid the lurking Eagles to reach the safety of the Marshlands.

You have six Geese that you must guide to safety by moving them each turn towards the Marshlands at the bottom of the gameboard. In your path are six Hunters who try to shoot you and eight Eagles who try to eat you. Each turn, you use dice rolls as an AI to determine their movements. If they reach any of your Geese, that bird is captured and removed from the board.

You win if at least one of your Geese reach safety in the Marshlands by successfully passing through the Hunters and Eagles. Variable levels of difficulty can be set by adjusting the number of Eagles on the board.

—description from the designer
categories: Animals, Print & Play

name: Star Conflict: Insurgency
description:
The Galaxy is at war. An alliance of several High Lords of the Interstellar Empire has rebelled against the Em -
peror, in an attempt to seize power for themselves. After years of conflict, the loyalists have managed to defeat
the majority of the insurgent forces. The few remaining insurgents have gone into hiding in a secret base, where
they are now rebuilding their forces. Given enough time, they will be able to rally enough support to launch an-
other full-scale rebellion and defeat the Emperor once and for all. The loyalists are set to find the base and de-
stroy the last remnants of the opposition before this happens.

Star Conflict: Insurgency is a free print and play asymmetric wargame for two players, taking approximately 30
to 60 minutes to play.

One player takes control of the loyalists and one player of the insurgents. The loyalist player’s goal is to locate
and conquer the hidden insurgent base. The insurgent player’s goal is to survive long enough to gather enough
support to overthrow the Emperor. Both players will muster armies, fight battles, and expand their galactic do-
main in order to reach their aim. The loyalists are more powerful and organized, but the insurgents have time and
the element of surprise on their side.

—description from the designer
categories: Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: A Baton in Both Hands
description:
A set of solo wargame rules that were designed for the horse and musket period but could be used for others.

Rules were designed so that any type of engagement could be played at any figure scale or basing type.

The player controls both sides in a solo wargame.
categories: Ancient, Book, Medieval, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Pike and Shot, Post-Napoleonic, Renaissance, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War I, World War II

name: War of Dice
description:
War of Dice is a print&play board game designed to play in solo mode.

In War of Dice you have to face an enemy contingent, who came to conquer the world. Armies are represented by dice. Each die represents a troop, and the value of the die, which you face upwards, represents the number of health points of the troop.

​The goal is to eliminate enemy troops.

To play it you only need standard six-sided dices and print the game board on an A4 sheet.

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Deduction, Print & Play

name: Secrets of the Lost Station: Dr. Quatuormanus XVI
description:
A new card for Secrets of the Lost Station. This character's name is a Latin version of Qua(r)termain, clearly an allusion to H. Rider Haggard's Allan Quatermain.

Stamina: 13
Ability: Once per game, you may choose to flip this card and take another turn after this one. (Do not advance Station Track)

Available as part of the 2020 Dice Tower Kickstarter Contenders Pack.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Movement Points, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Conflicting Legends: Dice Tower 2020 Promo Pack
description:
A promo pack of three cards for Conflicting Legends!

Ben Franklin - Choose an opponent. That opponent randomly discards a Persona in front of them (Culture/Green)

Sir Issac Newton - Use the ability of any Persona in front of a player (Science/Blue)

Leif Erikson - Attack an opponent. If you lose, attack a different opponent (Military/Red)

Available as part of the 2020 Dice Tower Kickstarter Explorers Pack.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Skyfight: Air Combat Rules 1960-1985
description:
Air battles rules for the 1960-1985 period

For 1/300th miniatures.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Sparkle*Kingdom
description:
Welcome to Sparkle*Kingdom!

If you are just joining the Sparkle*Kitty series, you are in luck! This 100% FREE version was created to allow families and friends to enjoy a silly spell slinging game whether you are trapped together in towers or spread apart in different kingdoms. It’s a bit different from the base Sparkle*Kitty card game, but with the same adorable giggle jiggles, otter devastations and added coloring fun!

Players use a Sparkle deck from previous games (or online) to fill in their colors in their kingdom. The player with the highest score wins.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Humor, Party Game

name: Willkommen im deutschen Weinparadies
description:
Each player has a pawn and travels on the board showing a route through the (Western) German wine cultivation regions according to the roll of a die. If you roll a 1 or 2, you may draw a card and follow the instruction or answer the question instead of advancing your pawn. For a correct answer you get a wine box tile (that may contain from 6 to 30 bottles). If a player reaches the last space, the game ends and the player with the most bottles wins.

This game was produced by Otto Maier Verlag, Ravensburg, Industrie- und Promotion-Service as a commercial game.

—user summary
categories: Educational, Travel, Trivia

name: Climate Change
description:
Everything starts in the savannah. It’s pleasantly warm and it does not rain very often. Different species are living in there, perfectly adapted to their habitat. Life is easy.
Temperature and rainfall are not the same everywhere, so the world is divided in four habitats based of the climate in each area. Each round covers approximately one million years, in which the species can move and evolve, by adapting to new habitats.
Every now and then the climate changes globally. When the temperature increases the savannah expands; when it drops it shrinks and the ice grows, while the other habitats move accordingly. In order to survive, species should either move to follow their habitats or adapt quickly to new ones, if they are not able to do so they will go extinct. And, after a while, humans may arrive and start changing things…
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Educational, Environmental

name: Lords of Florence
description:
Lords of Florence recreates the battle for political control of the Republic of Florence in the time of the Renaissance, a period famous for bankers, spectacular art, literature, betrayal and bloody conflict.Players control powerful families and individuals who together ruled the Republic during its 300 year history, as members of the Signoria (the ruling council of Florence), together they compete to gain enough political power (VPs) to overthrow the Republic and be named Duke.

Over 6 turns, players race to earn the most political power (VPs), if any player earns 50 political power, at the end of any turn before the end of turn 6, they automatically win.

In a turn, players spend their resources to complete shared projects, which in turn provide resources and VPs when completed. Projects are expensive, so players are encouraged to cooperate to complete them; yet the assymetric player powers mean some projects are more beneficial for some players than others. Therefore players must consider carefully whether to cooperate or not. In addition, each turn players may blind bid for intrigue cards, which provide opportunities to attack other players, disrupt projects they have completed, steal resources or even provide alternative victory conditions. However, players who focus too much on attacking others will not only fail to complete projects that would benefit them, but also risk triggering the shared loss condition. Failing to complete projects comes with a price - increasing the threat of the shared loss condition (known as instability), as the people of Florence become angry that their demands to complete projects are disregarded. If instability rises too far, the players all lose, forcing players to cooperatively complete at least some projects every turn to avoid defeat.

Player resources and intrigue cards are hidden behind player shields, allowing players to bluff, extort and hide their true strategies. The game rewards careful planning, timing and ruthlessness – all qualities critical to political success in the cutthroat World of Renaissance Italy

—description from the publisher
categories: Renaissance
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Bribery, Negotiation, Variable Player Powers

name: Around Australia Car Trial
description:
Around Australia Car Trial is a three-dimensional game of skill to navigate a car similar to a FX Holden around a winding course in Australia.

Published in the mid to late 1950s. The colorful board has a map of Australia overlaid by a road that begins near Melbourne and finishes near Perth. Interesting the game board displays several Mobil gas stations with the red Pegasus logo.

The plastic car is steered along the path using a magnetic control device, situated under the board. It passes through plastic tunnels along its travels. Points are scored by passing cities or time trials can be played. The player with the most points or fastest time is the winner.

The game is similar to Tarco games produced in the US around about the same time period and published by Sidney A Tarrson Co.

—user summary
categories: Action / Dexterity

name: Stars, Bars & Tars: Civil War Naval Rules
description:
Star, Bars & Tar

Naval Warfare during the American Civil War 1861-1865.
Both Steam and sailing rules.
Realistic movement rules, no hexes.
Combat cards, wind templates, speed scales, turning circles and damage cards provided.

Data for over 190 classes of ships

scale : 1:500 or less

—description from the publisher
categories: American Civil War, Book, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame

name: Stars, Bars & Tars: Scenario Book One – Civil War Naval Actions I
description:
This civil War naval scenario Book covers four Civil War naval Battles between Union and Confederate Ships.

It can be played with any scale of ships.

Also you can get the Civil war rules Stars, Bars & tars or play with another set.

—description from the publisher
categories: American Civil War, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame

name: Fighting Sail: Fast Play Naval Rules for the Age of Sail
description:
Fighting Sail: Fast Play Naval Rules for the Age of Sail

Naval Warfare from 1650 to the age of steam.

Realistic sailing rules with no hexes. Combat Cards, Wind Templates, Turning Circles and Damage Cards are all provided.

Fighting Sail has data for over 400 ships.

—description from the publisher
categories: Age of Reason, Book, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Nautical, Renaissance, Wargame

name: Sides of Steel III: Pre-Dreadnought Fast Play Naval Rules
description:
Sides of Steel III: pre-Dreadnought Fast Play Naval Rules

Naval Warfare during the age of the pre-Dreadnought Battleship Era 1881-1906.

Realistic movement rules without hexes. Combat cards, speed scales, torpedo wakes turning circles, smoke templates and damage cards provided.

Sides of Steel III has data for over 220 classes of ships of 18 navies.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Nautical, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Dreadnought III: Fast Play WWI Naval Rules
description:
Dreadnought III: Fast Play WWI Naval Rules

Naval Warfare during the age of the Dreadnought Battleship 1906-1930 Realistic movement rules, no hexes.

Combat cards, speed scales, torpedo wakes turning circles, smoke templates and damage cards provided.

Dreadnought III contains data for over 220 classes of ships of 14 navies.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War I

name: Task Force III: Fast Play WWII Naval Rules
description:
Task Force III: Fast Play WWII Naval Rules

Naval Warfare from 1930 – 1955 including WW2.
Realistic movement rules, no hexes.

Includes both naval gunnery and carrier combat. Speed scales, turning circles, torpedo wakes, smoke templates and damage cards provided.

Data for over 190 classes of ships of 12 navies.

Scale: 1:2400 or smaller.

Charts, damage cards, and turning circles are included in each game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: The Kings Musketeers are Wimps: Fast Play for Drinking and Brawling in the Age of Musketeers
description:
The Kings Musketeers are Wimps

Fast play rules for dueling, drinking and brawling in the 17th century.

Each figure represents a single person.

The rules cover movement, fighting, drinking, gambling, and romance.

There’s even a surgeon to fix wounds.

Small War Games Skirmish series games are designed to be played in an area the size of a kitchen table or even a card table without heavy weapons. With more players bigger battles are possible. Each figure moves and fire in accordance with its class and the number of increments it can use per move. Firing and hand-to-hand combat rules are easy to learn. There is one combat card per set of rules that has all the tables needed to play.
categories: Age of Reason, Book, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: Odin's Way: Fast Play Viking Era Skirmish Rules
description:
Odin’s Way are rules for the Viking Era. Each figure is an individual Viking or Saxon.

Odin’s Way can be used for a large or small game.

Rules include point values for fighting pillaging, gathering booty and capturing slaves.

There are even sailing rules!

Small War Games Skirmish series games are designed to be played in an area the size of a kitchen table or even a card table without heavy weapons. With more players bigger battles are possible. Each figure moves and fire in accordance with its class and the number of increments it can use per move. Firing and hand-to-hand combat rules are easy to learn. There is one combat card per set of rules that has all the tables needed to play.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame

name: March & Fight or Die! Colonial Era Skirmish Rules
description:
March and Fight or Die ! are the Small War Skirmish rules for the colonial era from roughly the 1850s to the 1920s.

French Foreign Legion, the British and German Schutztruppen are all covered and so are their enemies.

Without heavy weapons 2-4 players can play on a card table.

Small War Games Skirmish series games are designed to be played in an area the size of a kitchen table or even a card table without heavy weapons. With more players bigger battles are possible. Each figure moves and fire in accordance with its class and the number of increments it can use per move. Firing and hand-to-hand combat rules are easy to learn. There is one combat card per set of rules that has all the tables needed to play.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame

There are rules for tanks but they better not get too close to infantry armed with bazookas and Panzerfausts.

Small War Games Skirmish series games are designed to be played in an area the size of a kitchen table or even a card table without heavy weapons. With more players bigger battles are possible. There are Musketeers, Cardinal’s Guards, Cardinal’s agents, mercenaries, and thieves searching for it.
Each player has 3 figures who question townsfolk to find clues to the location of the necklace and who might have.

Two to eight players and an umpire.

Small War Games Skirmish series games are designed to be played in an area the size of a kitchen table or even a card table without heavy weapons. With more players bigger battles are possible. Each figure moves and fire in accordance with its class and the number of increments it can use per move. Firing and hand-to-hand combat rules are easy to learn. categories: Adventure, Age of Reason, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: Judgement of God: Fast Play Medieval Rules
description:
Judgement of God
Takes in all the aspects of medieval warfare including the knights, infantry, bow, crossbows and formation.

The rules include the realities of the Swiss and the Mongols.

The Two Page Rules series features rules that are 2 pages long with one combat card that has the information needed to play the game. The sequence of movement is decided by a dice roll and after that, the games follow the sequence of move-fire-move-fire. Casualties are decided simply and effectively. Morale is divided into 4 stages with the chance to rally at each stage. New players should be able to conduct their own transactions by the third move. These are combat rules that reflect the tactics and technologies of their era. Decisions are made by players, not cards or dice. These rules can be used for nearly any scale of the figure. They are great for large or small battles.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Undying Lands
description:
Putting the ‘reality’ back into your fantasy games

Welcome to Undying Lands a completely revised version of FLD. The constant evolution of the rules is thanks to the feedback I have received. Before I briefly cover the new features of the rules I would like to firstly focus on why these rules came about. The purpose and intent of this game is to provide players with a much more realistic fantasy game in contrast to the artificially contrived contemporary games that pay little attention to deployment, command control, light troops, orders, linear tactics and ignore the problems of movement, drill and reserves, they have unrealistic armies with ultra powerful beast that trance anything that moves, with 20 year old game mechanics repackaged every 5 years and sold at a phenomanal price that spotty teenagers are all to pleased to pay. Crap game, slick marketing. The list goes ever on.

We take the works of Tolkien and Moorcock to be actual historical accounts. In our careful reading we found that fantasy battle is an extension of the mechanics of historical battle. In Undying Lands you get all the tactical subtleties of historical wargaming plus an array of fantastic beasts, sorcery, special attributes and their associated benefits and problems. Whether your intent is fair or foul, regardless of your Balrog bodyguard, the ‘ordinary’ rank and file is the tactically most important soldier on your battlefield and that his physical constraints is on par with his historical counterpart.

What’s new in Undying Lands? Basing is much more integrated and flexible, The command control system has been streamlined and clarified, troop and weapon characteristics have been amalgamated into a single versatile and variable factor. The result is a streamlined, integrated and smooth game that plays faster.

First, we define the combat and manoeuvre characteristics of your troops, then deal with command, control and orders starting from the top down. Next we generate the battle field, then the sections on the game turn, movement, combat, missile fire, results and victory conditions. Finally, there's a section on 'how to win and common battlefield, tactical and organisational errors. HAVE FUN.

—description from the rulebook
categories: Book, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: The Icarus Investigation
description:
Free Print and Play version.

The Space Shuttle PK100A crashed somewhere in Texas on the unmanned maiden flight (Project Icarus).
Your team will search the crash site for items scattered around. Move items to the Investigation hangar for further investigation.
Could the cause be a broken bolt in control system, located in tail? Or an electric fire in a wing? Find out... Score Prestige Points during investigation. It is kind of cooperative - but the most effective team will win.

Main elements are the crash site board with items (cubes) scattered around. Items are moved to the Investigation hangar board

Assistant (meeples) activates items by card play.

Deck building.
Primary mechanism is deck build. It is essential to build your deck according to actual situation on boards. Situation change quickly during a game, with a final dramatic race. You must discard useless cards. Correct Evidence cards must be discarded to your Personal file Board for end game scoring.

—description from the designer
categories: Aviation / Flight, Deduction, Print & Play
mechanics: Deck Construction, Semi-Cooperative Game, Variable Set-up

description:
Time goes by, and the universe is full of galaxies swirling around. So it happens that stars once out of reach are now dangerously close: in Entropia «The Outer Stars» you will master new powers, new abilities and new ways to win: will you take up the challenge these new stars are offering you?

Current Stage:
98% Ready to crowdfunding
45% Illustrations and Graphics

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Multi-Use Cards, Open Drafting, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Clash!
description:
CLASH ! is a Wargame system with figurines that acts as a bridge between players of level, experience and even fro different periods.

The player embodies his entire army and makes decisions for each officer. It does not emphasize combat formations and is easy to learn.

CLASH! is not intended to be used in competition as it leaves a bit of improvisation to the players. In several places, the rule proposes solutions only.

The game is played with figurines, grouped in constituted units. Each figurine represents a certain number of real men, therefore a unit can represent from a troop to a regiment or more, generally a company, a squadron or equivalent.

Army lists are available online

—description (extract) from the ruleset

English rules in progress / French rules v1.0

name: Dobellone
description:
Northern Italian, set collection, card game similar to Scopa, but played with a special italian suits deck of 52 cards. Better with 4 players for a joint scoring tactics. The king card is wild, the ace can "clean" the cards on the table but not scoring a scopa, the deuce of swords is worth 1 point (Dobelon), also a Napoli sequence basically a set of ace, two and three or more of the same suit that could give a extra scoring points.

The pair of players reaching 120 points is declared winner.
categories: Card Game

name: Shopping
description:
Players play the role of characters who are handling money and shopping. There are stores with products and paths leading around them on the board placed at the center of the table. Each player starts the game with three coins.

The game has unique movement mechanic - player rolls a die with icons, move their figurine along any possible path, and stop at the first space with the same icon. They collect as many coins as they passed along the way. Then they can reveal and buy products adjacent to their position. If the die lands on a shopping cart, they can buy any of the opened products or roll again.

Because the products have different prices, the players have to balance getting and spending their coins.

The game ends when a player has five products in their shopping cart. Scoring - if a product has the icon of the player’s character or a star, it is worth two points, otherwise it is only worth one point. The player with the most points wins.

The game has an advanced mode included, in which players can close certain stores to block other players.

—description from the publisher
categories: Children's Game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Akihabara
description:
It’s the 80s and the electric city in Tokyo start changing… players compete to open new stores around Akihabara station.

Players will have to build 5 building. On your turn, you have to draw biz cards that allow you to open the most interesting stores at the best building. Choosing the best floor will be the key to attract the customers, tourist and otakus.

Every time you draw a biz card, you have to decide to stop and get the biz cards and then arrange then on their building or continue by drawing more biz cards. Nevertheless, If you do so and draw two biz cards of the same type, your turn ends immediately and all the biz cards are discarded.

When playing a biz card on your building, you should to take account that is not allowed to play two cards of the same type on the same building.

The game ends when a player build the 5th floor of one of their buildings. Then, the rest of players will get one last turn.

Your final scoring will be as follows:
Check the first floor of your 5 building and get 1 VP per each type of biz you got. Then, do the same with the second floor and so on until you have scored all the floors. The player with the most points is the winner.

-description from designer
categories: Card Game
mechanics: Grid Coverage, Push Your Luck, Tile Placement
